No sooner did the tidings reach [the tyrant at [Corinth]7-corinth]799-the tyrant at corinth , that [the veteran hero]800-the veteran hero was arrived at [Cenchræa]1-cenchræa , than [he]212-nero sent [him]204-corbulo a message to commit suicide . A gracious condescension that , for the property of [the man who was executed]801-the man who was executed was forfeit and [[his]801-the man who was executed wife]572-his wife and [children]3831-children reduced to beggary , whereas the will of [the testator who destroyed [himself]801-the man who was executed]804-the testator who destroyed himself was allowed to remain in force . [Lamia]219-lamia washed the stains from the hands and locks of [the girl]3790-the girl , and bathed [her]3790-the girl face with water till [she]3790-the girl came round . Then , when [he]219-lamia saw that [she]3790-the girl had recovered full consciousness , [he]219-lamia asked to be allowed to hasten for assistance . [She]3790-the girl bowed [her]3790-the girl head , as [she]3790-the girl could not speak , and [he]219-lamia entered [[the women]806-the women ’s portion of [the villa]3731-the villa]807-the women ’s portion of the villa to summon [some of [the female slaves]810-the female slaves]809-some of the female slaves . [These]809-some of the female slaves were , however , in no condition to answer [his]219-lamia call and be of use . [Duilia]181-duilia had monopolized the attentions of [almost all such as had not been commissioned to raise the funeral wail]811-almost all such as had not been commissioned to raise the funeral wail . Some , indeed , there were , scattered in all directions , running against each other , doing nothing save add to the general confusion , but precisely these were useless for [Lamia]219-lamia ’s purpose . Unwilling to leave [the child]3777-the child longer alone , [Lucius]219-lamia returned to [the garden]690-the garden , and saw [Domitia]191-domitia seated on the breastwork of the fountain . Ten years seemed to have passed over [her]3790-the girl head , so altered was [she]3790-the girl . [She]3790-the girl was not now weeping . The rigidity of the fainting fit seemed not to have left [her]3790-the girl face , nor relaxed the stony appearance it had assumed . [Her]3790-the girl eyes were lustreless , and [her]3790-the girl lips without color . [The young man]535-the young man was startled at [her]3790-the girl look . “ [Domitia]191-domitia ! ”[535-the young man] said [he]535-the young man . [She]3790-the girl raised [her]3790-the girl eyes to [him]535-the young man , and said in reply , “ [Lucius]219-lamia ! ”[3790-the girl] Then letting them fall , [she]3790-the girl added in hard , colorless tones , “ There is one thing [I]3790-the girl desire of [thee]535-the young man . By some means or other , [I]3790-the girl care not what , bring [me]3790-the girl into the presence of the monster . [I]3790-the girl know how [[my]3790-the girl father]3834-my father has come by [his]3834-my father death — as have [so many others]3984-so many others , [the best and the noblest]3985-the best and the noblest . [I]3790-the girl have but one ambition on [earth]3986-earth , [I]3790-the girl see but a single duty before [me]3790-the girl — to drive if it be but a silver bodkin into [his]3834-my father heart . ”[3790-the girl] “ [Domitia]191-domitia ! ”[3790-the girl] “ [Lucius]219-lamia , the last words [[my]3790-the girl father]3834-my father used to [me]3790-the girl were to bid [me]3790-the girl look to the stars and to sail by them . [I]3790-the girl look and [I]3790-the girl see one only star . [I]3790-the girl feel but one only duty on [earth]3986-earth — to revenge [his]3834-my father death . ”[3790-the girl] “ [[My]219-lamia friend]3989-my friend ! ”[219-lamia] said [Lamia]219-lamia , in a low tone . “ Be careful of [thy]3989-my friend words . If overheard , they might cause [your]3989-my friend blood to be mingled with [his]3834-my father . ”[219-lamia] “ [I]3790-the girl care not . ”[3790-the girl] “ But to [me]3790-the girl it matters sovereignly . ”[3790-the girl] “ Why ? Dost [thou]3989-my friend care for [me]219-lamia ? ”[219-lamia] “ Above all in [the world]466-the world . ”[3790-the girl] “ Then revenge [me]3790-the girl . ”[3790-the girl] “ [Domitia]191-domitia , [my]219-lamia grief is little less than thine . If [you]191-domitia would revenge the loss , so would [I.]219-lamia But what can be done ? [He]3834-my father , [the coward]3991-the coward , is carefully guarded . [None]3936-none are suffered to approach [him]3834-my father who have not first been searched , and even then are not allowed within arm ’s length . Nothing can be done , save invoke [the Gods]198-the gods . ”[219-lamia] “ [The Gods]198-the gods ! ”[3790-the girl] laughed [the girl]3790-the girl hoarsely . “ [The Gods]198-the gods ! [They]198-the gods set up the base , the foul , and crown [him]3834-my father with roses , and trample [the noble and good]3993-the noble and good into [the earth]3994-the earth . [The Gods]198-the gods ! see [you]191-domitia now ! [They]198-the gods set a star in [heaven]3995-heaven , [they]198-the gods grave a duty in [my]3790-the girl heart , and the star is unattainable , and the duty , [they]198-the gods make impossible of achievement . Bah ! There is no star . There are no duties on [earth]3986-earth , and [no Gods]3997-no gods in [heaven]3995-heaven . ”[3790-the girl] “ It is of no use in [the world]466-the world , [Plancus]182-plancus , [your]182-plancus attempting to reason [me]816-the lady longa duilia out of a fixed resolve , ”[816-the lady longa duilia] said [the lady [Longa Duilia]181-duilia]816-the lady longa duilia , peevishly . “ [[My]181-duilia Corbulo]4000-my corbulo shall not have a shabby funeral . ”[181-duilia] “ [Madam]3720-madam , [I]491-the steward do not suggest that , ”[491-the steward] said [the steward]491-the steward humbly , rubbing [his]491-the steward hands . “ Yes , [you]3720-madam do . It is of no good [your]3720-madam standing on one leg like a stork . Shabby it must be — [no ancestors present]4002-no ancestors present . As [the Gods]3756-the gods love [me]491-the steward , [you]3720-madam would not have [me]491-the steward [borrow ancestors of [Asclepiades]226-asclepiades , [[our]4005-our client]4006-our client , who has lent [us]4005-our [this villa]4007-this villa]4004-borrow ancestors of asclepiades , our client , who has lent us this villa ! [He]4006-our client may have [them]4004-borrow ancestors of asclepiades , our client , who has lent us this villa or not , that is no concern of [mine]491-the steward . Will [you]3720-madam have done preening [yourself]3720-madam like [an old cockroach]4008-an old cockroach . [I]491-the steward say it would be an indignity to have a funeral for [[my]491-the steward Corbulo]4000-my corbulo without [ancestors]4010-ancestors . O Times ! O Morals ! What is the good of having [ancestors]4010-ancestors if [you]3720-madam do not use [them]4010-ancestors ? ”[491-the steward] “ But , [Madam]3720-madam , [they]4010-ancestors are in [[your]3720-madam palace at [Rome]13-rome]4013-your palace at rome in [the Carinæ]4014-the carinæ — or at [the Gabian villa]4015-the gabian villa . ”[181-duilia] “ And for that reason [they]4010-ancestors are not [here]3736-here . Without the attendance of [[his]4000-my corbulo forbears]4017-his forbears , [my]181-duilia Corbulo shall not be buried . Besides , who is there to impress [here]3736-here with the solemnity ? Only a lot of [wretched sailors]4019-wretched sailors , [ship sutlers]4020-ship sutlers , [Jew pedlers]4021-jew pedlers and [petty officials]4022-petty officials , not worth considering . [I]181-duilia have said it . ”[181-duilia] “ But , [Lady]3723-lady , [Lucius Lamia]219-lamia agrees with [me]491-the steward — — ”[491-the steward] “ [Lucius Ælius Lamia]219-lamia — it will not exhaust [your]3720-madam lungs to give [him]4000-my corbulo [his]4000-my corbulo name more fully — is not as yet one of [the family]4024-the family . ”[181-duilia] “ [Madam]3720-madam , consider how [Agrippina]227-agrippina did with [Germanicus]228-germanicus — [she]227-agrippina had [his]228-germanicus pyre at [Antioch]16-antioch , and conveyed [his]228-germanicus ashes to [Rome]13-rome . ”[181-duilia] “ [Agrippina]227-agrippina was able to have the funeral conducted with solemn pomp at [Antioch]16-antioch . There were [the soldiers]4026-the soldiers , [the lictors]4027-the lictors , [great officers]4028-great officers and all that sort of thing . [Here]3736-here — nothing at all . By [the Immortals]3880-the immortals — consider the expenses , and none to look on gaping but [tarry sailors]4031-tarry sailors and [Jew rag - and - bone men]4032-jew rag - and - bone men . ”[491-the steward] “ [Madam]3720-madam ! ”[181-duilia] “ Silence . Without ancestors!—as impossible as without wood . ”[181-duilia] To understand the point made so much of by [the widow]818-the widow , the Roman funeral custom must be understood . On the death of [a noble or high official]819-a noble or high official , [his]819-a noble or high official face was immediately moulded in wax , into a mask , or rather , into two masks , that were colored and supplied with glass eyes . One was placed over the dead face , when the corpse lay in state , and when [he]819-a noble or high official was conveyed to [his]819-a noble or high official funeral pyre , and the first effect of the rising flames was to dissolve the mask and disclose the dead features . [The ancient Greeks]820-the ancient greeks before [they]820-the ancient greeks burned [their]820-the ancient greeks dead laid gold - leaf masks on [their]820-the ancient greeks faces , and in a still earlier time the face of the corpse was rouged with oxide of iron , to give it a false appearance of life . But the second mask was preserved for the family portrait gallery . When [a Roman gentleman]821-a roman gentleman or [lady]3723-lady was carried forth to [his]819-a noble or high official funeral pyre , [he]819-a noble or high official was preceded by [a procession of actors dressed up in the togas and military or municipal insignia of [departed ancestors]824-departed ancestors]823-a procession of actors dressed up in the togas and military or municipal insignia of departed ancestors , each wearing the wax mask of [him]819-a noble or high official [he]819-a noble or high official personified . For these masks were preserved with great care in [the atrium of [the house]744-the house]825-the atrium of the house . Now as [Longa Duilia]181-duilia saw , to have [[her]181-duilia husband]579-her husband burned at [Cenchræa]1-cenchræa , without a procession of [imitation ancestors]828-imitation ancestors , would be to deprive the funeral of its most impressive feature . [Plancus]182-plancus had advised the burning at [the port]3716-the port , with shorn rites , and that the ashes should be placed in [the family mausoleum at [Gabii]36-gabii]830-the family mausoleum at gabii , and that the utmost dignity should be accorded to this latter ceremony sufficient to content [the most punctilious widow]831-the most punctilious widow . But this did not please [the lady]482-the lady . The notion of a funeral with maimed pomp was distasteful to [her]482-the lady ; moreover , as [she]482-the lady argued , it was illegal to have two funerals for [the same man]833-the same man . “ That , ”[182-plancus] said [Plancus]182-plancus , “ hardly applies to [one who has died out of [Italy]22-italy]4034-one who has died out of italy . ”[182-plancus] “ It is against the law , ”[181-duilia] replied [Duilia]181-duilia . “ [I]181-duilia will give no occasion to objection , offer no handle to [informers]4035-informers . Besides , [I]181-duilia wo n’t have it . The respect [I]181-duilia owe to [Corbulo]204-corbulo forbids the entertainment of such an idea . Really , and on [my]181-duilia word , [Plancus]182-plancus , [I]181-duilia am not [a child]3968-a child to be amused with shadow pictures , and unless [you]182-plancus are making a rabbit , a fish , or a pig eating out of a trough , [I]181-duilia can not conceive what [you]182-plancus are about with [your]182-plancus hands , fumbling one over the other . ”[181-duilia] “ [Madam]3720-madam , [I]182-plancus had no thought — — ”[182-plancus] “ [I]181-duilia know [you]182-plancus have none . Be pleased another time when addressing [me]181-duilia to keep [your]182-plancus hands quiet , it is irritating . [One]3914-one never knows where they are or will be , sometimes folding and unfolding them , then — they disappear up [your]182-plancus sleeves and project [none]3936-none can guess where — like snails ’ horns . Be pleased,—and now pawing [your]182-plancus face like a cat washing itself . Please in future hold them in front of [you]182-plancus like a dog when sitting up , begging . But as to the funeral — [I]181-duilia will not have it cheap and nasty . Without ancestors a funeral is not worth having . ”[181-duilia] “ Then , ”[834-the harassed freedman] said [the harassed freedman]834-the harassed freedman , “ there is nothing for it but to engage [an embalmer]4040-an embalmer . ”[834-the harassed freedman] “ Of course — one can be obtained at [Corinth]7-corinth . Everything can be had for money . ”[181-duilia] As [Plancus]182-plancus was retiring , [the lady]482-the lady recalled [him]182-plancus . “ Here , ”[482-the lady] said [she]482-the lady , “ do not act like [a fool]4041-a fool , and let [the man]4042-the man charge a fancy price . Say that [I]482-the lady have an idea of pickling [Corbulo]204-corbulo in brine , and have brought an amphora large enough for the purpose . Do n’t close with [his]4042-the man terms at once . ”[482-the lady] When [the steward]491-the steward was gone , then [Longa Duilia]181-duilia turned [her]181-duilia head languidly and summoned [a slave - girl]493-a slave - girl . “ [Lucilla]183-lucilla ! The unfortunate feature of the situation is that [I]181-duilia must not have [my]181-duilia hair combed till [we]4043-we reach [Gabii]36-gabii . It is customary , and for a bracelet of pearls [I]181-duilia would not transgress custom . [You]482-the lady can give [my]181-duilia head a tousled look , without being dishevelled , [I]181-duilia would wish to appear interesting , not untidy . ”[181-duilia] “ [Lady]3723-lady ! Nothing could make [you]3723-lady other than fascinating . [A widow in tears]4045-a widow in tears — some stray locks — it would melt marble . ”[181-duilia] “ And [I]181-duilia think [I]181-duilia shall outdo [Agrippina]227-agrippina , ”[181-duilia] said [Duilia]181-duilia , “ [she]227-agrippina carried [[her]227-agrippina husband]579-her husband ’s cinders in an urn at the head of [her]227-agrippina berth and on appropriate occasions howled in the most tragic and charming manner . But [I]181-duilia shall convey the unconsumed body of [my]181-duilia Corbulo in state exposed on [his]579-her husband bier , in [his]579-her husband military accoutrements all the way to [Rhegium]39-rhegium , then up [the coast]4047-the coast to [Ostia]40-ostia and so to [Gabii]36-gabii . There will be talk ! ”[181-duilia] “ [You]3723-lady will be cited in history as [a widow the like of which [the world]466-the world has never seen]4048-a widow the like of which the world has never seen . As for [Agrippina]227-agrippina , in [your]3723-lady superior blaze [she]227-agrippina will be eclipsed forever . ”[482-the lady] “ [I]482-the lady should prefer doing what [Agrippina]227-agrippina did — make a land journey from [Brindisium]41-brindisium , but — but — [one]3914-one must consider . It would be vastly expensive , and — — ”[482-the lady] But [the lady]482-the lady did not finish the sentence . [She]482-the lady considered that [Nero]212-nero might resent such a demonstration , as exciting indignation against [himself]212-nero , in having obliged [Corbulo]204-corbulo to put an end to [his]212-nero life . But [she]482-the lady did not dare to breathe [her]482-the lady thought even into the ear of [a slave]749-a slave . “ No , ”[482-the lady] [she]482-the lady said ; “ it would come too expensive . [I]482-the lady will do what [I]482-the lady can to honor [[my]482-the lady husband]4051-my husband , but not ruin [myself]482-the lady . ”[482-the lady] When [Longa Duilia]181-duilia had resolved to have [her]181-duilia own way , and that was always , then [all [the entire family of]841-the entire family of [slaves]589-slaves and [retainers]843-retainers]840-all the entire family of slaves and retainers , [freedmen]844-freedmen and [clients]845-clients knew it must be done . [The vessel]454-the vessel after a brief stay at [Cenchræa]1-cenchræa had left for [Diolcus]10-diolcus where [it]454-the vessel had been placed on rollers and conveyed across [the isthmus]3750-the isthmus , and was launched in [the Corinthian Gulf]21-the corinthian gulf . [Nero]212-nero had been engaged for some days in excavating [a canal between [the two seas]849-the two seas]848-a canal between the two seas . [He]212-nero had [himself]212-nero turned the first sod , but after getting some little way , rock was encountered of so hard a quality that to cut through it would cost time , toil and money . [He]212-nero speedily tired of the scheme , wanted the money it would have cost for some dramatic exhibition , and was urged by [Helios]229-helios , [a freedman whom [he]212-nero had left in [Rome]13-rome]850-a freedman whom he had left in rome , to return to [Italy]22-italy , to prevent an insurrection that was simmering . [Nero]212-nero did not much believe in danger , but [he]212-nero had laden [[his]212-nero fleet]851-his fleet with the plunder of [Greece]24-greece , [he]212-nero had strutted and twittered on every stage , carried off every prize in every contest , and was desirous of being applauded in [Italy]22-italy and at [Rome]13-rome for what [he]212-nero had achieved , and exhibit there the chaplets [he]212-nero had won . Accordingly [he]212-nero started , and hardly had [he]212-nero done so before [the Artemis]206-the artemis with spread sail swept down [the Corinthian Gulf]21-the corinthian gulf . [The ship]539-the ship , a Liburnian , of two banks of oars , was constructed very differently from [a modern vessel]853-a modern vessel . The prow was armed above water - mark with three strong and sharp blades , called the rostra , the beaks , which when driven into the side of [an enemy]854-an enemy would tear [her]854-an enemy open and sink [her]854-an enemy . [The quarter - deck]855-the quarter - deck was midships , and served a double purpose , being raised as high as the bulwarks it served as [an elevated place where [the captain]573-the captain could stand and survey the horizon and watch the course of [the vessel]454-the vessel]856-an elevated place where the captain could stand and survey the horizon and watch the course of the vessel , and it also served to strengthen the mast . On [this quarter - deck]859-this quarter - deck , on a bed of state , lay the body of [Cnæus Domitius Corbulo]204-corbulo , with [his]204-corbulo sword at [his]204-corbulo side , and the wax mask over [his]204-corbulo face . At [his]204-corbulo feet was a tripod with glowing coals on which occasionally incense and Cilician crocus were sprinkled , and on each side of [his]204-corbulo head blazed torches of pinewood dipped in pitch . The poop had a covered place , called the aplaustre , in which sat [the steerer]860-the steerer . The hinged rudder had not then been invented , it was a discovery of the Middle Ages , and the head of [the vessel]454-the vessel was given its direction by [the helmsman]862-the helmsman , [gubernator]863-gubernator , who worked a pair of broad flat paddles , one on each side . [The rowers]463-the rowers , under [the deck]865-the deck , were [slaves]589-slaves , but [the sailors]3794-the sailors were [freemen]868-freemen . [The rowers]463-the rowers were kept in stroke by [a piper]870-a piper , who played continually when [the vessel]454-the vessel was being propelled ; and [the rowers]463-the rowers were under the direction and command of [a hortator]873-a hortator , so called because [his]873-a hortator voice was incessantly heard , urging , reprimanding , praising , threatening . [The captain of [a Roman vessel]875-a roman vessel]874-the captain of a roman vessel was not supreme in authority on [board ship]876-board ship as with [us]877-us , but if [the vessel]454-the vessel contained [military]879-military , [he]874-the captain of a roman vessel was subject to the control of [the superior military officer]880-the superior military officer . The passage down [the Corinthian Bay]43-the corinthian bay was effected without difficulty , before a favorable wind , but as [the vessel]454-the vessel was about to pass out of [it]43-the corinthian bay , the wind suddenly changed and blew a squall from the west . And at this moment an accident occurred that was seriously embarrassing . Whilst [the captain]573-the captain was standing near [the steersman]883-the steersman giving [him]573-the captain directions relative to [the passage of [the straits]885-the straits]884-the passage of the straits , a wave rolling in caught the paddle , and caused it by the blow to snap the bronze bolt of the eye in which it worked , and the handle flying up and forward , struck [the captain]573-the captain on the forehead , threw [him]573-the captain down , and [he]573-the captain fell against the bulwark so as to cut open [his]573-the captain head . [He]573-the captain had to be carried below insensible . [The Artemis]206-the artemis lay under shelter till the gale abated , and then consultation arose as to what was to be done . [Lucius Lamia]219-lamia took the command , [he]219-lamia was competent to manage [the vessel]454-the vessel , with the advice , if needed , of [the mate]888-the mate . [He]219-lamia and [all]568-all were reluctant to put back to [Lechæum]20-lechæum , [the port of [Corinth]7-corinth]890-the port of corinth , on [the Gulf]45-the gulf , and the broken eye in which the paddle worked was repaired with a stout thong , which , as [the steersman]883-the steersman said , would hold till [Adria]11-adria was crossed and [Rhegium]39-rhegium was reached . The squall had passed , and the look of the sky was promising ; moreover the wind was again favorable . “ [Sir]3806-sir , ”[888-the mate] said [the mate]888-the mate , “ [my]888-the mate opinion is that [we]4053-we should make all speed across [Adria]11-adria . This is a bad season of the year . It is a month in which sailing is overpassed . [We]4053-we must take advantage of [our]4053-we chances . While the wind blows , let [us]4053-we spread sail . [The rowers]463-the rowers can ship [their]463-the rowers oars ; should the wind fail , or prove contrary , [they]463-the rowers will be required , and [they]463-the rowers may have a hard time of it . Therefore let [them]463-the rowers husband [their]463-the rowers strength . ”[888-the mate] “ So be it , ”[219-lamia] answered [Lucius Lamia]219-lamia . And now [the Artemis]206-the artemis , with sail spread , leaning on one side , drave through the rippling water , passed [the Straits]47-the straits into [the Adriatic]48-the adriatic , with [the mountains of [Ætolia]49-ætolia]893-the mountains of ætolia to the north , and [the island of [Cephalonia]50-cephalonia in the blue west before [her]206-the artemis]894-the island of cephalonia in the blue west before her ; and as [she]206-the artemis flew , [she]206-the artemis left behind [her]206-the artemis a trail of foam in the water , and a waft of smoke in the air from the torches that glowed about [the dead general on the quarter - deck]895-the dead general on the quarter - deck . The day was in decline , and although the season was winter yet the air was not cold . [The mountains of [Greece]24-greece]896-the mountains of greece lay in the wake like a bank of purple cloud tinged with gold . On [the quarter - deck]855-the quarter - deck reposed the corpse , with the feet turned in the direction of the prow ; the torches spluttered , and cast off sparks that flew away with the smoke . On each side were [three slave women]898-three slave women , detailed to wail , but [Longa Duilia]181-duilia had issued instructions that [they]898-three slave women were not to be noisy in [their]898-three slave women demonstration so as to disturb or swamp conversation aft . The undulating lament swerving through semi - tones and demi - semitones , formed a low and sad background to the play of voices on [the lower deck]899-the lower deck , where , sheltered from the wind , [the widow]818-the widow reclined on cushions , and [[her]818-the widow daughter]901-her daughter [Domitia]191-domitia sat at [her]818-the widow side in conversation . A change had come over [the girl]3790-the girl , so complete , so radical , that [she]3790-the girl seemed hardly to be [the same person as before [[her]3790-the girl father]3788-her father ’s death]903-the same person as before her father ’s death . This was noticeable as being in appearance and manner,—noticeable even to [the slaves]494-the slaves , not the most observant in matters that did not particularly concern [their]494-the slaves comfort and interests . [She]3790-the girl had been transmuted from [a playful child]906-a playful child into [a sad and serious woman]907-a sad and serious woman . The sparkle had left [her]3790-the girl eyes to make way for an eager , searching fire . The color had left [her]3790-the girl cheek ; and [her]3790-the girl face had assumed a gloomy expression . The change , in fact , was much like that in a landscape when a sunny May day makes place for one that is overcast and threatening . The natural features are unaltered , but the aspect is wholly different in quality and character . A mighty sorrow contracting , bruising , oppressing the heart sometimes melts it into a sweetness of patient endurance that inspires pity and love . But grief seemed to have frozen [Domitia]191-domitia and not to have dissolved [her]191-domitia into tears . [The philosopher]606-the philosopher approached with solemn stalk , walking on the flat of [his]606-the philosopher soles . [Such men]909-such men were retained in [noble households]910-noble households as [family chaplains]911-family chaplains , to advise , comfort , and exhort . And [this man at intervals]912-this man at intervals approached [the widow , who on such occasions assumed a woe - begone expression]913-the widow , who on such occasions assumed a woe - begone expression , beat [her]913-the widow , who on such occasions assumed a woe - begone expression brow and emitted at intervals long - drawn sighs . At such times , [the Magus , standing near]914-the magus , standing near , curled [his]914-the magus , standing near lip contemptuously , and endeavored by shrugs and sniffs to let [the bystanders]915-the bystanders perceive how little [he]914-the magus , standing near valued the words of [the stoic]916-the stoic . [The philosopher]606-the philosopher [Senecio]208-senecio now in formal style addressed [the widow]818-the widow , and then turned to harangue [the daughter]919-the daughter , on the excellence of moderation in grief as in joy , on the beauty of self - control so as to suffer the storms of life to roll over the head with indifference . In this consisted the Highest Good , and to attain to such stolidity was the goal of all virtuous endeavor . Then [he]208-senecio thrust [his]208-senecio hand into the folds of [his]208-senecio toga , and withdrew , to be at once attacked and wrangled with by [the Chaldæan]207-elymas . [Domitia , who had listened with indifference]920-domitia , who had listened with indifference , turned to [[her]920-domitia , who had listened with indifference mother]519-her mother as soon as [he]208-senecio was gone , and said — “ The Summum Bonum , the crown and glory of Philosophy is to become in mind what [the slave]520-the slave becomes after many bastinadoes , as callous in soul as [he]520-the slave is on the soles of [his]520-the slave feet . The lesson of life is not worth the acquisition . ”[920-domitia , who had listened with indifference] “ [I]482-the lady think [he]208-senecio put it all very well . ”[482-the lady] “ Why are the strokes applied ? Why should [we]4056-we bear [them]4057-them without crying out ? After all , what profit is there in this philosophy ? ”[920-domitia , who had listened with indifference] “ Really , [[my]920-domitia , who had listened with indifference dear]4058-my dear , [I]920-domitia , who had listened with indifference can not tell . But it is the correct thing to listen to and to talk philosophy , and [good families]4059-good families keep [[their]4059-good families tame stoics,—even quite new and vulgar people , wretched knights who have become rich in trade]4060-their tame stoics,—even quite new and vulgar people , wretched knights who have become rich in trade — in a word , [they]4060-their tame stoics,—even quite new and vulgar people , wretched knights who have become rich in trade all do it . ”[920-domitia , who had listened with indifference] “ But , [mother]4061-mother , what is this Highest Good ? ”[920-domitia , who had listened with indifference] “ [You]4061-mother must inquire of [Claudius Senecio]208-senecio [himself]208-senecio . It is , [I]920-domitia , who had listened with indifference am sure something very suitable to talk about , on such solemn occasions as this . ”[920-domitia , who had listened with indifference] “ But what is it ? [A runner in the course]4062-a runner in the course knows what is the prize for which [he]4062-a runner in the course contends , [a singer at the games]4063-a singer at the games sees the crown [he]4062-a runner in the course hopes to earn — but this Highest Good , is it nothing but not to squeal when kicked ? ”[920-domitia , who had listened with indifference] “ [I]920-domitia , who had listened with indifference really do not know . ”[920-domitia , who had listened with indifference] “ [Mother]230-cornelia , would to the Gods [I]920-domitia , who had listened with indifference did know ! [My]920-domitia , who had listened with indifference sorrow is eating out [my]920-domitia , who had listened with indifference heart . [I]920-domitia , who had listened with indifference am miserable . [I]920-domitia , who had listened with indifference am in darkness , like [Theseus]231-theseus in the labyrinth , but without a clue . And the Highest Good preached by philosophy is to sit down in the darkness and despair of the light . [I]920-domitia , who had listened with indifference want to know . Has [[my]920-domitia , who had listened with indifference father]3834-my father ’s life gone out forever , like an extinguished torch cast into [the sea]474-the sea ? or is it a smouldering ember that may be blown again into flame ? ”[920-domitia , who had listened with indifference] “ Have [you]4061-mother not heard , [Domitia]191-domitia , how [Senecio]208-senecio has assured [you]4061-mother that [[your]4061-mother father]4066-your father will live . ”[920-domitia , who had listened with indifference] “ Where ? ”[920-domitia , who had listened with indifference] “ On the page of history . ”[920-domitia , who had listened with indifference] “ First assure [me]920-domitia , who had listened with indifference that the page will be written , and that impartially . What [I]920-domitia , who had listened with indifference know of [historians]4067-historians is that [they]4067-historians scribble all the scurrility [they]4067-historians can against [the great and noble]4068-the great and noble , in the hope of thereby advancing the credit of [[their]4067-historians own mean selves]4069-their own mean selves . Has [a man]3770-a man no other hope of life than one built on the complaisance of [the most malignant of [men]3873-men]4071-the most malignant of men ? ”[920-domitia , who had listened with indifference] “ [My]920-domitia , who had listened with indifference dear,—positively , [I]920-domitia , who had listened with indifference do not know . [You]4061-mother turn [my]920-domitia , who had listened with indifference head with [your]4061-mother questions . Call [Plancus]182-plancus that [I]920-domitia , who had listened with indifference may scold [him]182-plancus , to ease [my]920-domitia , who had listened with indifference overwrought nerves . [The fellow]3811-the fellow has been stopping up [his]3811-the fellow wrinkles with a composition of wax , lard and flour , and really , at [his]3811-the fellow age , and in [his]3811-the fellow social position — it is absurd . ”[920-domitia , who had listened with indifference] “ But , [mother]4061-mother , [I]920-domitia , who had listened with indifference want to know . ”[920-domitia , who had listened with indifference] “ Bless [me]482-the lady , [you]4061-mother make [me]482-the lady squeamish . Of course [we]4075-we want to know a vast number of things ; and the Highest Good , [I]482-the lady take it , is to learn to be satisfied to know nothing . [Cats]4076-cats , dogs , donkeys , do n’t worry [themselves]4077-themselves to know — and are happy . [They]4077-themselves have , then , the Summum Bonum . If [you]4061-mother want to know more , ask [the philosopher]606-the philosopher . [He]606-the philosopher is paid for the purpose , and eats at [our]4075-we expense , and [ye gods]4079-ye gods ! how [he]606-the philosopher eats . [I]482-the lady believe [he]606-the philosopher finds the Highest Good in the platter . ”[482-the lady] [The lady]482-the lady made signs , and [a slave , ever on the watch]923-a slave , ever on the watch , hastened to learn [her]482-the lady desire , and at [her]482-the lady command summoned [the Stoic]916-the stoic . [The philosopher]606-the philosopher paced [the deck]865-the deck with [his]606-the philosopher chin in the air , and came aft . “ [[My]818-the widow daughter]3841-my daughter , ”[818-the widow] said [the widow]818-the widow , “ is splitting [my]818-the widow suffering head with questions . Pray answer [her]3841-my daughter satisfactorily . Here [Felicula]232-felicula , [Procula]233-procula , [Lucilla]183-lucilla , help [me]818-the widow to [the cabin]4081-the cabin . ”[818-the widow] When [the lady]482-the lady had withdrawn , [the philosopher]606-the philosopher said : “ [Lady]3723-lady , [you]3723-lady will propound difficulties , and [I]606-the philosopher shall be pleased to solve them . ”[606-the philosopher] “ [I]191-domitia ask plain answers to plain questions , ”[191-domitia] said [Domitia]191-domitia . “ At death — what then ? ”[606-the philosopher] “ Death , [young lady]4083-young lady , is the full stop at the end of the sentence , it is the closing of the diptychs of life , on which its story is inscribed . ”[606-the philosopher] “ [I]606-the philosopher asked not what death is — but to what it leads ? ”[606-the philosopher] “ Leads!—it — leads ! ahem ! Death encountered with stoic equanimity is the highest point to which — ”[606-the philosopher] “ [I]606-the philosopher do not ask how to meet death , but what it leads to . [You]606-the philosopher seem unable or unwilling to answer a plain question . [[My]606-the philosopher dear father]4084-my dear father , does [he]4084-my dear father live still — as a star that for a while sets below the horizon but returns again ? ”[606-the philosopher] “ [He]4084-my dear father lives , most assuredly . In all [men]3873-men ’s mouths — on [the snowy plains of [Germany]28-germany]4086-the snowy plains of germany , on [the arid wastes of [Syria]33-syria]4087-the arid wastes of syria , the fame of [Cnæus Domitius Corbulo]204-corbulo — — ”[606-the philosopher] “ [I]606-the philosopher asked naught about [his]4084-my dear father fame , but about [himself]4084-my dear father . Does [he]4084-my dear father still exist , can [he]4084-my dear father still think of , care for , love [me]606-the philosopher — as [I]606-the philosopher still think of , care for , love [him]4084-my dear father — ”[606-the philosopher] [Her]930-her voice quivered and broke . “ [Young lady]4083-young lady — [Socrates]234-socrates could say no more of the future than that it is a brilliant hope which one may run the risk of entertaining . And [our]4089-us own Immortal Cicero declared that the hope of the soul living after death is a dream , and not a doctrine . [The Immortals]3880-the immortals have seen fit to cut the thread of [his]4084-my dear father life — — ”[930-her] “ [The Immortals]3880-the immortals had no scissors wherewith to do it . [He]4084-my dear father fell on [his]4084-my dear father own sword . Is there a soul ? And after death where does it go ? Is it a mere shadow ? ”[606-the philosopher] “ [[My]606-the philosopher dear lady]4092-my dear lady , philosophy teaches [us]4089-us to hope — — ”[606-the philosopher] “ Natural instinct does that without the cumbrous assistance of philosophy — but what is that hope built on ? ”[930-her] “ [I]606-the philosopher can not tell . ”[606-the philosopher] “ Then of what avail is it to lead a good life ? ”[606-the philosopher] “ On the page of history — — ”[606-the philosopher] “ That is where [the great man]4093-the great man lives — but [the poor girl]4094-the poor girl or [the mechanic]4095-the mechanic ? Of what avail is a good life ? What motive have [we]4089-us to induce [us]4089-us to lead it ? ”[606-the philosopher] “ The approval of the conscience . ”[606-the philosopher] “ But why should it approve ? What is good ? Where is it written that this is good and that is evil ? ”[606-the philosopher] “ [I]606-the philosopher can not tell . ”[606-the philosopher] “ So , ”[3790-the girl] said [the girl]3790-the girl , and [she]3790-the girl signed to [Elymas]207-elymas to approach . [He]207-elymas came up with a sneer at [the philosopher , who retired in discomfiture]932-the philosopher , who retired in discomfiture . “ [You]4092-my dear lady , [Chaldæan]207-elymas , answer [me]932-the philosopher , who retired in discomfiture that which confounds [the Stoic]235-the stoic . [You]4092-my dear lady have learning in [the East]4096-the east which [we]4089-us have not in [the West]3-the west . Tell [me]932-the philosopher , who retired in discomfiture — what is the human soul ? and has it an existence after death ? ”[932-the philosopher , who retired in discomfiture] “ Certainly , [lady]3723-lady . The soul is a ray of Divine light , an æon out of infinite perfection . This ray is projected into space and enters into and is entangled in matter , and that is life , in the plant , in the fish , in the bird , in the beast , in [man]3963-man . ”[606-the philosopher] “ And what after death ? ”[606-the philosopher] “ Death is the disengagement of this ray from its envelope . It returns to the source , to the pleroma or fulness of being and light whence it emanated , and loses itself in the one urn of splendor ! ”[932-the philosopher , who retired in discomfiture] “ But when [Pactolus]236-pactolus and [Styx]237-styx run into [the sea]474-the sea , the waters are mingled and lost , as to their individuality . ”[606-the philosopher] “ And so with the spirits of [men]3873-men . ”[606-the philosopher] “ What ! ”[191-domitia] exclaimed [Domitia]191-domitia . “ When [I]191-domitia die [my]191-domitia little ray re - enters the sun and is lost in the general glory — and [[my]191-domitia father]3834-my father ’s ray is also sucked in and disappears ! There is no comfort in a thought where individuality is extinguished . But say . How know [you]4092-my dear lady that what [you]4092-my dear lady have propounded is the truth ? ”[191-domitia] [The Magus]210-the magus hesitated and became confused . “ It is , ”[210-the magus] said [he]210-the magus , “ a solution at which the minds of [the great thinkers of [the East]2-the east]4102-the great thinkers of the east have arrived . ”[210-the magus] “ [I]191-domitia see , ”[191-domitia] said [Domitia]191-domitia , “ it is no more than a guess . [You]4092-my dear lady and [all alike]4103-all alike are stagnant pools , whose muddy bottoms ferment and generate and throw up guesswork bubbles . One bubble looks more substantial than another , yet are all only the disguise of equal emptiness . ”[191-domitia] [The Chaldæan]207-elymas withdrew muttering in [his]207-elymas beard . [Domitia]191-domitia looked after [him]207-elymas and noticed [the physician [Luke]219-lamia standing near , leaning over [the bulwarks]934-the bulwarks]933-the physician luke standing near , leaning over the bulwarks . [He]219-lamia was [an elderly man , with kindly soft eyes , and a short beard in which some strands of gray appeared]935-an elderly man , with kindly soft eyes , and a short beard in which some strands of gray appeared . [A modest man , ready when called on to advise]936-a modest man , ready when called on to advise , but never self - assertive . [Domitia]191-domitia had noticed [him]219-lamia already and had taken a liking to [him]219-lamia , though [she]191-domitia had not spoken to [him]219-lamia . An unaccountable impulse induced [her]191-domitia to address [him]219-lamia . “ [They]4104-they are [all quacks]4105-all quacks , ”[191-domitia] [she]191-domitia said . “ [They]4104-they must needs be [seekers]4106-seekers , and the best [they]4104-they can produce , is out of [themselves]4104-they , and that conjecture . From the depths of the intellect what can be brought up than a more or less plausible guess ? ”[191-domitia] “ And on these guesses [we]4107-we must live , like those who float across [the Tigris]51-the tigris and [Euphrates]52-euphrates — on rafts supported by inflated bladders . There is then no solid ground ? ”[191-domitia] “ [Man]3963-man inflates the bladders — [God]180-titus lays the rocky basis . ”[191-domitia] “ What mean [you]219-lamia ? ”[191-domitia] “ No certainty can be attained , in all these things [man]3963-man desires to know , the basis of hope , the foundation of morality , that can not be brought out of [man]3963-man . It can only be known by revelation of [God]180-titus . ”[191-domitia] “ And till [he]219-lamia reveals [we]4107-we must drift on wind - bags . Good lack ! ”[191-domitia] “ Do [you]219-lamia think , [Lady]3723-lady , that [He]219-lamia who made [man]3963-man , and planted in [man]3963-man ’s heart a desire for a future life , and made it necessary for [his]3963-man welfare that [he]3963-man should know to discern between good and evil , should leave [him]3963-man forever in the dark — like as [you]219-lamia said [Theseus]231-theseus in [the labyrinth]4114-the labyrinth , without a clue ? ”[191-domitia] “ But where is the clue ? ”[191-domitia] “ Or think [you]219-lamia that [He]219-lamia who launched the vessel of [man , having carefully laid the keel and framed the ribs]4115-man , having carefully laid the keel and framed the ribs , and set in [her]454-the vessel [a pilot]4116-a pilot , should send [her]454-the vessel forth into unknown seas to certain wreckage — to be wafted up and down by every wind — to be carried along by every current — to fall on reefs , or be engulfed by quicksands , and not to reach [a port]4117-a port , and [He]219-lamia not to set lights whereby [her]454-the vessel course may be directed ? ”[191-domitia] “ But where are the lights ? ”[191-domitia] At that moment , before [Luke]219-lamia could answer , [Lamia]219-lamia , who had been in the fore part of [the vessel]454-the vessel , came hastily aft , and disregarding [the physician]938-the physician , heedless of the conversation on which [he]938-the physician broke in , said hurriedly and in agitated tone : — “ [The Imperial galley]4118-the imperial galley ! ”[219-lamia] [The Imperial galley]4118-the imperial galley ! [Domitia]191-domitia leaped to [her]191-domitia feet . Everything was forgotten in the one thought that before [her]191-domitia , on [the sea]474-the sea , floated [the man who had caused the death of [[her]191-domitia father]3788-her father]941-the man who had caused the death of her father . “ [Lucius]219-lamia [I]941-the man who had caused the death of her father must see — — ”[941-the man who had caused the death of her father] [He]941-the man who had caused the death of her father drew [her]191-domitia forward , but at the same time checked [her]191-domitia speech . “ Every word dropped is fraught with danger , ”[941-the man who had caused the death of her father] [he]941-the man who had caused the death of her father said . “ What know [you]191-domitia but that [yon physician]4119-yon physician be [a spy]4120-a spy ? ”[941-the man who had caused the death of her father] “ [He]941-the man who had caused the death of her father is not that , ”[191-domitia] [she]191-domitia answered , “ show [him]941-the man who had caused the death of her father to [me]191-domitia — [him]941-the man who had caused the death of her father — — ”[191-domitia] [They]943-they walked together to the bows . With the declining of the sun , the light wind had died away , and , although [the sea]474-the sea heaved after the recent storm , like the bosom of [a sleeping girl]945-a sleeping girl , in the stillness of the air , the sail drooped and [the ship]539-the ship made no way . Accordingly the sail was furled , and , by the advice of [the mate]888-the mate , [the rowers , who had rested during the day]948-the rowers , who had rested during the day , were summoned to [their]948-the rowers , who had rested during the day benches and bidden work the oars during the night . The sky was clear , and the stars were beginning to twinkle . No part of the voyage in calm weather would be less dangerous than this , which might be performed at night , across [open sea]949-open sea , unbroken by rocks and [sand - banks]950-sand - banks . So long as [the vessel]454-the vessel had to thread [her]454-the vessel way between [the headland of [Araxus]53-araxus and [the Echinades]54-the echinades]952-the headland of araxus and the echinades , and then betwixt [the isles of [Cephalonia]50-cephalonia and [Zacynthus]238-zacynthus]953-the isles of cephalonia and zacynthus , [an experienced navigator]954-an experienced navigator was necessary , and caution had to be exercised both in the management of the sail and in the manipulation of the helm . But now all was plain , and [the mate]888-the mate had retired below to rest . During the time [he]888-the mate reposed [Lamia]219-lamia took charge of [the vessel]454-the vessel , assisted by [the second mate]957-the second mate . “ [You]4121-you take [your]4121-you meridian by [Polaris]55-polaris , [Castor and Pollux]4122-castor and pollux , steer due west ; if there be a slight deviation from the right course , that is a trifle . [I]957-the second mate will set it right when [my]957-the second mate watch comes . ”[957-the second mate] Such was [the mate]888-the mate ’s injunction as [he]888-the mate retired below . “ [The steersman]883-the steersman is done up , ”[219-lamia] said [Lamia]219-lamia ; “ [he]883-the steersman shall rest now , and [no better man]4124-no better man can be found to replace [him]883-the steersman than [Eboracus]193-eboracus , who has been accustomed to [the stormy seas of [Britain]56-britain]4125-the stormy seas of britain , and whose nerves are of iron . ”[219-lamia] Indeed , [the gubernator]959-the gubernator or [helmsman]960-helmsman had hard work for [his]960-helmsman arms . The two enormous paddles had short cross - pieces let into them , like the handles of a scythe , and the clumsy and heavy mechanism for giving direction to the head of [the vessel]454-the vessel was worked by leverage in this manner . [The sailors]3794-the sailors managed everything on [deck]963-deck , the cordage , the anchors , the sail and [the boats]964-the boats . In rough weather [they]3794-the sailors undergirded [the ship]539-the ship ; that is to say , passed horizontal cords round [her]539-the ship to brace the spars together so as to facilitate resistance to the strain when laboring against the waves . [The sailors]3794-the sailors were under the direction of [the captain]573-the captain or [trierarch]968-trierarch , so called whether [he]573-the captain commanded a trireme or [a Liburnian of two benches]969-a liburnian of two benches . On [deck]963-deck [the steersman]883-the steersman occupied a sort of sentry - box in the stern , and beside [him]573-the captain sat [the mate]888-the mate , [the second mate]957-the second mate , and often also [the captain]573-the captain , forming a sort of council for the direction of [the vessel]454-the vessel . It was a favorite figure in [the early Church]976-the early church to represent [the Bishop]977-the bishop as [the helmsman of [the sacred vessel]979-the sacred vessel]978-the helmsman of the sacred vessel , and [the presbyters who sat about [him]573-the captain as [the mates occupying the stern bench]981-the mates occupying the stern bench]980-the presbyters who sat about him as the mates occupying the stern bench . As already said , in [a Roman vessel]875-a roman vessel , there was a lack of that unity in direction under [the captain to which [we]984-we are accustomed]983-the captain to which we are accustomed . [A military officer]985-a military officer was always supreme everywhere on [sea as on land]986-sea as on land . When [the sailors]3794-the sailors were engaged in sailing , then [the rowers]463-the rowers rested or caroused , and when [they]463-the rowers in turn bowed over the oars , [the sailors]3794-the sailors had leisure . The sun went down in the west , lighting up the sky above where [he]573-the captain set with a rainbow or halo of copper light fading into green . The night fell rapidly , and the stars looked out above and around , and formed broken reflections in [the sea]474-the sea . In winter the foam that broke and was swept to right and left had none of the flash and luminosity it displayed in summer , when [the water]3819-the water was warm . Already in the wake [the Greek isles]992-the greek isles and [mountain ridges]993-mountain ridges had faded into night . The oars dipped evenly , and [the vessel]454-the vessel sped for ward at a speed equal to that of [a modern Channel steamer]995-a modern channel steamer . At a signal from [Lamia]219-lamia [the mourners on the quarter - deck]996-the mourners on the quarter - deck ceased to intone [their]996-the mourners on the quarter - deck wail . [He]573-the captain and [Domitia]191-domitia stood in the bows and looked directly before [them]996-the mourners on the quarter - deck . [They]996-the mourners on the quarter - deck could see [a large vessel ahead , of three banks of oars]997-a large vessel ahead , of three banks of oars , but [she]997-a large vessel ahead , of three banks of oars floated immovable on [the gently heaving , glassy sea]998-the gently heaving , glassy sea . The oars were all shipped and [she]997-a large vessel ahead , of three banks of oars was making no way . [The deck]865-the deck sparkled with lights . Torches threw up red flames , lamps gave out a fainter yellow gleam . To the cordage lights had been suspended , and braziers burning on [the quarter - deck]855-the quarter - deck , fed with aromatic woods , turned the water around to molten fire , and sent wafts of fragrance over [the sea]474-the sea . The twang of a lyre and the chirp of a feeble voice were faintly audible ; and then , after a lull , ensued a musical shout of applause in rhythmic note . “ It is [the Augustus]4126-the augustus singing , ”[219-lamia] said [Lamia]219-lamia in a tone of smothered rage and mortification . “ And [he]4126-the augustus has [his]4126-the augustus band of [adulators]4127-adulators about [him]4126-the augustus . ”[219-lamia] “ But why do not [the rowers]463-the rowers urge on [the vessel]454-the vessel ? ”[191-domitia] asked [Domitia]191-domitia . “ Because [the piper giving the stroke]4130-the piper giving the stroke would be committing high treason in drowning the song of [the princely performer]4131-the princely performer . By [the Gods]3756-the gods ! the grinding of the oars in the rowlocks and the plash in [the water]3819-the water would drown even [his]4126-the augustus most supreme trills . ”[191-domitia] “ Hast [thou]4134-thou seen [him]4126-the augustus on the stage , [Lamia]219-lamia ? ”[219-lamia] “ [The Gods]3756-the gods forbid , ”[535-the young man] answered [the young man]535-the young man passionately , “ this fancy to be the first of [singers and mimes]4136-singers and mimes had not come on [him]4126-the augustus before [I]535-the young man left [Rome]13-rome for [Syria]33-syria . To think of it , that [he]4126-the augustus — [the head of [the magis tracy]4138-the magis tracy]4137-the head of the magis tracy , of [the army]4139-the army , of [the senate]4140-the senate , of [the priesthood]4141-the priesthood , should figure as [Apollo]239-apollo , half naked , in a gold - powdered wig , and with painted cheeks before sniggering [Greeks]214-greeks ! [The Gods]198-the gods deliver [me]535-the young man from such a sight ! ”[535-the young man] “ But [you]191-domitia will behold it now . As [we]4142-we speed along [we]4142-we shall overtake [this floating dramatic booth]4143-this floating dramatic booth . ”[219-lamia] “ [I]535-the young man will give [her]4126-the augustus a wide berth , and stop [my]535-the young man ears with wax , though , by [the Gods]198-the gods ! this is no siren song . ”[535-the young man] [Domitia]191-domitia leaned over the side of [the vessel]454-the vessel . “ Are they sharp , [Lucius]219-lamia ? ”[191-domitia] “ Are what sharp , [Domitia]191-domitia ? ”[219-lamia] “ The beaks . ”[219-lamia] “ Sharp as lancets . ”[191-domitia] “ And strong ? ”[219-lamia] “ Strong as rams . ”[219-lamia] “ Then , [Lucius]219-lamia , [we]4142-we will not give [her]4126-the augustus wide berth . [You]219-lamia loved [[my]191-domitia father]3834-my father . [You]219-lamia regard [me]191-domitia . [You]219-lamia will do what [I]191-domitia desire , for [his]219-lamia sake and for [mine]191-domitia . ”[191-domitia] “ What would [you]219-lamia have of [me]219-lamia ? ”[219-lamia] “ Ram [her]4126-the augustus ! ”[191-domitia] [Lucius Lamia]219-lamia started , and looked at [the girl]3790-the girl . [She]3790-the girl laid [her]3790-the girl hand on [his]219-lamia arm , and gripped it as with an iron vice . “ Run [her]4126-the augustus down , [Lucius]219-lamia ! Sink [the accursed murderer]4145-the accursed murderer and mountebank in [the depths of [the Ionian sea]4147-the ionian sea]4146-the depths of the ionian sea . ”[3790-the girl] [Lamia]219-lamia gasped for breath . [She]3790-the girl looked up into [his]219-lamia face . “ Can it be done ? ”[3790-the girl] “ By [Hercules]220-hercules ! [we]4148-we could rip up [her]4126-the augustus side . ”[3790-the girl] “ Then do so . ”[219-lamia] [He]219-lamia stood undecided . “ Hearken to [me]219-lamia . [None]3936-none will suspect [our]4148-we intention as [we]4148-we swiftly shoot up — no , none in [this vessel]4150-this vessel , only [Eboracus]193-eboracus must be in it . Suddenly [we]4148-we will round and ram and welt [her]4126-the augustus ; and send [the new Orion]4151-the new orion with [his]4151-the new orion fiddle to the fishes . By [the Furies]58-the furies ! [We]4148-we shall hear [him]4151-the new orion scream . [We]4148-we shall see [him]4151-the new orion beat the waves . [Lucius]219-lamia , let [me]219-lamia have a marline - spike to dash at [him]4151-the new orion as [he]4151-the new orion swims and split [his]4151-the new orion skull and let out [his]4151-the new orion brains for the fishes to banquet on [them]58-the furies . ”[219-lamia] “ [We]4148-we risk all [our]4148-we lives . ”[3790-the girl] “ What care [I]3790-the girl ? [[My]3790-the girl father]3834-my father , [[your]219-lamia friend]4153-your friend , will be avenged . ”[3790-the girl] Still [Lamia]219-lamia stood in unresolve . “ [Lucius]219-lamia ! [I]219-lamia will twine [my]219-lamia white arms about [your]219-lamia neck , and will kiss [you]219-lamia with [my]219-lamia red lips , the moment [his]4151-the new orion last scream has rung in [my]219-lamia ears . ”[219-lamia] “ In the name of Vengeance — then , ”[219-lamia] said [Lamia]219-lamia . “ Eboracus [I]191-domitia can count on , ”[191-domitia] said [Domitia]191-domitia . “ There is [the under - mate]4154-the under - mate . If [any one on board]4155-any one on board suspect [our]4156-we purpose , [we]4156-we are undone . ”[191-domitia] “ [None]3936-none need suspect , ”[3790-the girl] said [the girl]3790-the girl . “ Say that [the prince]4158-the prince is holding festival on board [the trireme]4159-the trireme , and that it behoves [us]4156-we to salute . [None]3936-none will think other than that [we]4156-we are befooling [ourselves]4156-we like [the rest]4161-the rest . At the right moment , before any has a thought of [thy]206-the artemis purpose , call for the double - stroke , and trust [Eboracus]193-eboracus — [he]193-eboracus will put the helm about , and in a moment [we]4156-we run [her]206-the artemis down . ”[3790-the girl] [Lamia]219-lamia walked to [the quarter - deck]855-the quarter - deck , bade [the mourning women]1007-the mourning women go below . [He]219-lamia extinguished the funeral torches , and threw the ashes from the tripod into [the sea]474-the sea . Then [the Artemis]206-the artemis was no longer distinguishable by any light [she]206-the artemis bore . [Next Lamia]240-lamia walked aft , and in a restrained voice said : “ [The vessel of [Cæsar]224-domitian]4162-the vessel of cæsar is before [us]4156-we . [We]4156-we dare not pass without leave asked and granted . ”[240-lamia] “ All right , [sir]3806-sir , ”[957-the second mate] said [the second mate]957-the second mate . “ Any orders below ? ”[957-the second mate] “ Keep on at present speed . When [I]240-lamia call [Slack]241-slack , then let [them]4164-them slacken . When [I]240-lamia call Double , then at once with full force double . ”[240-lamia] “ Right , [sir]3806-sir . [I]888-the mate will carry down instructions . ”[888-the mate] [The mate]888-the mate went to the ladder and descended into [the hold]1011-the hold . There were now left on [deck]963-deck only [Lamia]240-lamia , [Domitia]191-domitia , [the steersman]883-the steersman , [Eboracus]193-eboracus , [one sailor]1014-one sailor and [the physician]938-the physician , who was leaning over the bulwarks looking north at [the glittering constellation of [Cassiopea]242-cassiopea ’s Chair]1016-the glittering constellation of cassiopea ’s chair . [He]938-the physician was near [the quarter - deck]855-the quarter - deck , in [the fore part of [the vessel]454-the vessel]1018-the fore part of the vessel , and had been unobserved in the darkness by [Lamia]240-lamia and [Domitia]191-domitia , till [they]1020-they returned aft . Then [the young man]535-the young man started as [he]535-the young man observed [him]938-the physician . Was it possible that [the man]4042-the man had overheard the words spoken ? There was nothing in the attitude or manner of [the physician]938-the physician to show that [he]4042-the man entertained alarm . [Lamia]240-lamia resolved on keeping an eye upon [him]938-the physician that [he]938-the physician did not communicate with [the crew]3860-the crew . [Luke]219-lamia returned aft when [the young people]1025-the young people came in that direction , and seated [himself]219-lamia quietly on a bench . [Eboracus]193-eboracus was rapidly communicated with and gained . The Artemis flew forward , noiselessly , save for the plunge of the oars and the hiss of the foam , as it rushed by like milk , and from the hold sounded the muffled note of the symphonicius or piper . Every moment [the vessel]454-the vessel neared [the imperial galley]4118-the imperial galley , and sounds of revelry became audible . Nothing showed that [any on board]1028-any on board were aware of the approach of [a Liburnian]243-a liburnian . It was now seen that tables were spread on [the deck of [the Imperial vessel]1030-the imperial vessel]1029-the deck of the imperial vessel , and that [the prince]4158-the prince and [[his]4158-the prince attendants]560-his attendants , and indeed [the entire crew]1033-the entire crew were engaged in revelry . Between the courses which were served , [Nero]212-nero ascended the quarter - deck , and sang or else delivered a recitation from [a Greek tragedian]1034-a greek tragedian , or a piece of [his]212-nero own composition . If the approach of the bireme was observed , which did not seem to be the case , it caused no uneasiness . [[The Emperor]1035-the emperor ’s vessel]1036-the emperor ’s vessel had been accompanied by [a convoy]1037-a convoy , but [the ships]586-the ships had been dispersed by the storm ; and [the bireme]455-the bireme , if perceived , was doubtless held to be one of [the fleet]1040-the fleet . And now [Helios]229-helios , [the confidant of [Nero]212-nero]1041-the confidant of nero , had ascended [the quarter - deck]855-the quarter - deck to [[his]229-helios master]505-his master , and began to declaim the speech of [the attendant in the Electra]1044-the attendant in the electra descriptive of the conquests of [Orestes]60-orestes — applying the words , by significant indications to [the prince returning [a victor from the Grecian games]1046-a victor from the grecian games]1045-the prince returning a victor from the grecian games . “ [He]212-nero , having come to the glorious pageantry of the sports in [Greece]24-greece , entered the lists to win the Delphic prizes , [he]212-nero , [the admired of every eye]4166-the admired of every eye . And having started from [his]212-nero goal in wondrous whirls [he]212-nero sped along the course , and bore away the of all coveted prize of victory . But that [I]212-nero may tell [thee]4167-thee in few words amidst superfluity [I]212-nero have never known [such a man of might and deeds]4168-such a man of might and deeds as [he]212-nero — ”[212-nero] and [he]212-nero bowed and waved [his]212-nero hands towards [Nero]212-nero . A roar of applause broke out , interrupted by a cry from [Nero]212-nero who suddenly beheld [a dark ship]1047-a dark ship plunge out of the night and come within the radiance of the lights on board [[his]212-nero vessel]1048-his vessel . Meanwhile , on [the Artemis]1049-the artemis , with set face sat [Eboracus]193-eboracus , guiding the head of [the Liburnian as directed]1050-the liburnian as directed . [He]212-nero could see the twinkling lights , and hear the sounds of rejoicing . “ Slack speed , ”[219-lamia] called [Lamia]219-lamia . “ Slack [your]212-nero oars , ”[219-lamia] down into the hold . There was a pause — all oars held poised for a moment . “ Double ! ”[219-lamia] shouted [Lamia]219-lamia . “ Double [your]212-nero oars ! ”[219-lamia] down the ladder . Instantly the water hissed about the bows , and the oars plunged . [Eboracus]193-eboracus by a violent movement threw [himself]193-eboracus and [his]193-eboracus entire weight on the handle of one paddle , so as to turn the bireme about , and ram [her]1048-his vessel midships into [the Imperial trireme]1051-the imperial trireme , when suddenly , without a word , [Luke]219-lamia had drawn a knife through the thong that restrained the paddle , and instantly the pedalion leaped out of place , and would have gone overboard , had not [the physician]938-the physician caught and retained it . Immediately the direction of [the Artemis]206-the artemis was altered and in place of running into [the trireme]4159-the trireme , [she]206-the artemis swerved and swung past [the Imperial galley]4118-the imperial galley without touching [her]206-the artemis . [Nero]212-nero , white with alarm and rage shrieked from [the quarter - deck]855-the quarter - deck , “ Who commands ? ”[212-nero] Then to those by [him]212-nero , “ Pour oil on the flames . ”[212-nero] At once from the braziers , tongues of brilliant light leaped high into the air . “ The name ! ”[1056-the furious prince] yelled [the furious prince]1056-the furious prince . Then came the reply : — “ [Cnæus Domitius Corbulo]204-corbulo . ”[212-nero] And by the glare [he]212-nero saw , standing by the mast , distinct against the darkness of the night behind , the form of [a man]3770-a man — and the face was the face of [the murdered general]1058-the murdered general . [Nero]212-nero staggered back — and would have fallen unless caught by [Helios]229-helios . “ [The dead]746-the dead pursue [me]212-nero , ”[212-nero] [he]212-nero gasped . “ [Wife]3875-wife , [mother]4061-mother , [brother]4172-brother , and now , [Corbulo]204-corbulo ! ”[212-nero] “ It is well done , ”[193-eboracus] said [Eboracus]193-eboracus in an undertone to [the physician]938-the physician ; “ Otherwise there had been the cross for [you]938-the physician and [me]193-eboracus . The thong broke . ”[193-eboracus] “ [I]219-lamia severed it , ”[219-lamia] said [Luke]219-lamia . “ That [I]520-the slave saw , ”[520-the slave] said [the slave]520-the slave , “ [I]520-the slave shall report that it yielded . [One]3914-one must obey [a master]4174-a master even to the risk of the cross . Did’st see [the noble Lamia]4175-the noble lamia , how ready [he]4175-the noble lamia was ? [He]4175-the noble lamia assumed the mask of [[my]520-the slave dead master]4176-my dead master and [we]4177-we have slipped by and sent a shiver through [the whole company of the Trireme]4178-the whole company of the trireme , and [the August]4179-the august too , [I]520-the slave trow,—for [they]4180-they have thought [us]4177-we [the Ship of [the Dead]746-the dead]4181-the ship of the dead . ”[520-the slave] After a pause [he]1061-he said,—“In [[my]1061-he home]4183-my home [we]4177-we hold that [all souls]4184-all souls go to [sea]3761-sea in [a phantom vessel]4186-a phantom vessel ; and sail away to [the West]3-the west , to [the Isles of [the Blessed]62-the blessed]4187-the isles of the blessed . At night [a dark ship with a sail as a thundercloud]4188-a dark ship with a sail as a thundercloud comes to [the shore]4189-the shore , and [those near can hear the dead in trains]4190-those near can hear the dead in trains go over [the beach]4191-the beach and enter [the ghostly vessel]4192-the ghostly vessel , till [she]4192-the ghostly vessel is laden , and then [she]4192-the ghostly vessel departs . ”[1061-he] [The Artemis]1049-the artemis made [her]1049-the artemis way without disaster to [Rhegium]39-rhegium , and thence coasted up [Italy]22-italy to [the port of [Rome]13-rome]1063-the port of rome . [She]1049-the artemis had gained on [the Imperial vessel]1030-the imperial vessel , that was delayed at [Brundusium]63-brundusium to collect the scattered fleet . [Nero]212-nero would not land until [he]212-nero reached [Neapolis]64-neapolis , and then not till all [his]212-nero wreaths and golden apples , as well as [his]212-nero entire wardrobe of costumes and properties had arrived . Then only did [he]212-nero come ashore , and [he]212-nero did so to commence a triumphal progress through [the Peninsula]1065-the peninsula , the like of which was never seen before nor will be seen again . This was on the 19th March , the anniversary of the murder of [[his]212-nero mother]1066-his mother . On the same day a letter was put into [his]212-nero hands announcing the revolt of [the legions in [Gaul]65-gaul]1067-the legions in gaul and the proclamation of [Galba]244-galba , at that time [Governor of [Spain]66-spain]1068-governor of spain . So engrossed , however , was [his]212-nero mind with preparation for [his]212-nero theatrical procession , that [he]212-nero paid no heed to the news , nor was [he]212-nero roused till [he]212-nero read the address of [Vindex]245-vindex , who led the revolt , denouncing [him]212-nero as [a “ miserable fiddler]4193-a “ miserable fiddler . ”[212-nero] This touched [him]212-nero to the quick , and [he]212-nero addressed [an indignant despatch]1069-an indignant despatch to [the Senate]4140-the senate , demanding that [Vindex]245-vindex should be chastised , and appealed to the prizes [he]212-nero had gained as testimony to [his]212-nero musical abilities . So [he]212-nero started for [Rome]13-rome . [Eighteen hundred and eight heralds]1071-eighteen hundred and eight heralds strutted before [him]212-nero , bearing in [their]1071-eighteen hundred and eight heralds hands the crowns that had been awarded [him]212-nero and announcing when and how [he]212-nero had succeeded in winning the award . [He]212-nero entered [Rome]13-rome in this leisurely manner , in [a triumphal chariot]1072-a triumphal chariot , wearing a purple robe , embroidered with gold , an olive garland about [his]212-nero head . Beside [him]212-nero [a harper]1073-a harper struck [his]212-nero instrument and chanted [his]212-nero praises . [The houses]1074-the houses were decorated with festoons , [the streets]1075-the streets were strewn with saffron ; singing birds , comfits , flowers were scattered by [the people before [him]212-nero]1076-the people before him . If [the Sen ate]1077-the sen ate expected that now [the prince]4158-the prince was in [Rome]13-rome , [he]212-nero would attend to business , it was vastly mistaken . [His]212-nero first concern was to arrange for a splendid exhibition in which [he]212-nero might gratify [the public]1079-the public with a finished study of [his]212-nero acting and singing . Solicitude about [his]212-nero triumph , [his]212-nero voice , [his]212-nero reception , had so completely filled the shallow mind of [Nero]212-nero , that [he]212-nero gave no further thought to the vessel that had shot out of the darkness , nearly fouled [[his]212-nero galley]1080-his galley , and which had been apparently commanded by [one of [[his]212-nero noblest victims]1082-his noblest victims]1081-one of his noblest victims . [Longa Duilia]181-duilia arrived on [the Gabian estate]1083-the gabian estate , with the corpse of [[her]181-duilia husband]579-her husband , [[her]181-duilia daughter]901-her daughter , [Lucius Lamia]219-lamia , and [[her]181-duilia entire “ family]4194-her entire “ family , ”[181-duilia] as the company of [household slaves]1086-household slaves was termed , without accident and without deter . [Gabii]36-gabii lay eleven miles from [Rome]13-rome at the foot of one of [the spurs of [the Alban mountains]1088-the alban mountains]1087-the spurs of the alban mountains . [The town]1089-the town stood on [a small knoll rising out of [the Campagna]67-the campagna]1090-a small knoll rising out of the campagna . The stone of which [it]1089-the town was built was dark , being a volcanic peperino ; it was perhaps one of the least attractive sites for [a country residence]1091-a country residence , which [a Roman noble]638-a roman noble could have selected ; but this was not without its advantage , when [Emperors]246-emperors acted as did [Ahab]247-ahab , and cut off those whose [villas and vineyards]1093-villas and vineyards attracted [their]246-emperors covetous eyes . [A lake]1094-a lake occupied [the crater of [an extinct volcano]1096-an extinct volcano]1095-the crater of an extinct volcano ; [the water]3819-the water was dark as ink , but this was due rather to the character of the bottom , than to depth , which was inconsiderable . [The villa]3731-the villa and [[its]3731-the villa gardens]1099-its gardens lay by [the water]3819-the water ’s edge . [The old city]1101-the old city not flourishing , but maintaining a languid existence , was famous for nothing but a peculiarity in girding the toga adopted by [the men]1102-the men , by the dingi ness of [its]1089-the town building stone , and by [[its]1089-the town temple of [Juno]248-juno]1103-its temple of juno , an object of pilgrimage when [the deities of [other shrines]1105-other shrines]1104-the deities of other shrines had proved unwilling or unable to help , a sort of pis - aller of devotion . [Longa Duilia]181-duilia hated [the place]3754-the place ; [it]3754-the place was dull , and [she]181-duilia would never have frequented [it]3754-the place , had it not been the fashion at the period for [all people of good family]1107-all people of good family to affect a love of retirement into [the country]1108-the country , and to pretend a taste for simplicity of rural life . [Some fine fops]1109-some fine fops had [their]1109-some fine fops “ chambers of poverty ”[1109-some fine fops] to which on occasions [they]1109-some fine fops retired , to lie on mats upon the ground , and eat pulse out of common earthenware . Such periods of self - denial added zest to luxury . [Domitia]191-domitia , on the other hand , was attached to [the place]3754-the place . [It]191-domitia was associated with the innocent pleasures of earliest childhood . [Its]191-domitia spring flowers were the loveliest [she]191-domitia had ever culled , its June strawberries the most delicious [she]191-domitia had ever eaten . And [the lake]1111-the lake teeming with char gave opportunities for boating and fishing . Here was [the family burial - place]1112-the family burial - place ; and here [Corbulo]204-corbulo was to be burnt , and then [his]204-corbulo ashes collected and consigned to [the mausoleum]1113-the mausoleum . [Messengers]1114-messengers had been sent forth to invite the attendance of [all relations]1115-all relations , [acquaintances]1116-acquaintances and [dependents]1117-dependents . The invitation was couched , according to unalterable custom , in antiquated terms , hardly intelligible . When on the day appointed for the ceremony , vast numbers were collected , the funeral procession started . First went [the musicians]1118-the musicians under the conduct of [a Master of the Ceremonies]1119-a master of the ceremonies . By law , the number of [flautists]1120-flautists was limited to ten . Then followed [the professional mourners]1121-the professional mourners , hired for the occasion from [the temple of [Libitina]68-libitina]1122-the temple of libitina , [the priests of which]1123-the priests of which were [the licensed undertakers]1124-the licensed undertakers . [These mourners]1125-these mourners chanted the nænia , a lament composed for the purpose of lauding the acts of [the deceased]1126-the deceased and of reciting [his]1126-the deceased honors . When [they]1125-these mourners paused at the conclusion of a strophe , horns and trumpets brayed . Immediately after [the wailers]1127-the wailers walked [a train of [actors]782-actors , one of whom was dressed in the insignia of [the deceased]1126-the deceased and wore a mask representing [him]1126-the deceased . [He]1126-the deceased endeavored to mimic each peculiarity of [the man [he]1126-the deceased personated]1131-the man he personated]1128-a train of actors , one of whom was dressed in the insignia of the deceased and wore a mask representing him . he endeavored to mimic each peculiarity of the man he personated , and [buffoons around]1132-buffoons around by [their]1132-buffoons around antics and jests provoked [the spectators]1133-the spectators to laughter . This farcical exhibition was calculated to moderate the excessive grief superinduced by the lament of [the wailers]1127-the wailers . Then came the grand procession of [the ancestors]1135-the ancestors , especially dear to [the heart of [the widow]818-the widow]1136-the heart of the widow . Not only did the effigies of [the direct forefathers]1138-the direct forefathers appear , but [all related families]1139-all related families trotted out [[their]1139-all related families ancestors]1140-their ancestors , to attend [the illustrious dead]1141-the illustrious dead , so that there can not have been less than a hundred present . As already mentioned , the wax masks of [the dead of [a family]1143-a family]1142-the dead of a family ornamented [[every nobleman]1144-every nobleman ’s hall]1145-every nobleman ’s hall , usually enclosed in boxes with the titles of the defunct inscribed on them in gold characters . These were now produced . [The mimes]1146-the mimes were costumed appropriately , as [senators]1147-senators , [generals]1148-generals , [magistrates]1149-magistrates , with [[their]1146-the mimes attendants]1150-their attendants , wearing the wax masks , and artificial heads of hair . The idea represented was that of [the ancestors]1135-the ancestors having returned from [the land of Shadows]1152-the land of shadows to fetch [[their]1135-the ancestors descendant]1153-their descendant and accompany [him]1153-their descendant to [the nether world]1154-the nether world . The corpse , that lay on a bier in [the hall]754-the hall , was now taken up , and carried forth to a loud cry from all in [the house]744-the house of “ [Vale]69-vale ! Farewell ! Fare [thee]4195-thee well ! ”[1160-attendants carrying lighted torches] Between the lips of [the dead man]1157-the dead man was a coin , placed there as payment of the toll across [the River of Death in [the ferry - boat]1159-the ferry - boat of [Charon]70-charon]1158-the river of death in the ferry - boat of charon . On each side of the bier walked [attendants carrying lighted torches]1160-attendants carrying lighted torches . In ancient times all funerals had been conducted at night . Now the only reminiscence of this custom was in the bearing of lights ; but the torches served as well a practical purpose , as they were employed to kindle the pyre . Before [the dead]746-the dead were carried the insignia of [[his]1157-the dead man offices]1162-his offices , pictures of the battles [he]1157-the dead man had won and statues of [the kings]1163-the kings and chiefs [he]1157-the dead man had conquered . [The corpse]1164-the corpse was followed by a number of [manumitted slaves]1165-manumitted slaves , all wearing the cap of liberty , in token of [their]1165-manumitted slaves freedom . Finally came [the members of [the family]4024-the family]1166-the members of the family , [friends]1168-friends , [retainers]843-retainers , and [the sympathizing public]1170-the sympathizing public . [Longa Duilia]181-duilia and [Domitia Longina]191-domitia walked in [their]1171-their proper place , with dishevelled hair , unveiled heads , and in the ricinium or black garment thrown over [their]1171-their tunics ; [the men]1102-the men all wore the pænula , or short travelling cloak . [The procession]1173-the procession advanced into [the marketplace of [Gabii]36-gabii]1174-the marketplace of gabii , where [Lucius Lamia]219-lamia ascended the rostrum to pronounce the funeral oration . Immediately , ivory chairs and inlaid stools were ranged in a crescent before [him]1157-the dead man , and on these [the ancestors]1135-the ancestors seated [themselves]1135-the ancestors , the bier being placed before [them]1135-the ancestors . The panegyric was addressed to [the crowd outside the circle of [mimes with wax faces]1177-mimes with wax faces]1176-the crowd outside the circle of mimes with wax faces . [Lamia]219-lamia had a gift of natural eloquence , [his]219-lamia feelings were engaged , but [his]219-lamia freedom of speech was hampered by necessity of caution in allusion to the death of [Corbulo]204-corbulo , lest some word should be let slip which might be caught up and tortured into a treasonable reference to [Nero]212-nero . The Laudation ended , [the entire assembly]1178-the entire assembly arose and re - formed in procession to [the place of burning]1179-the place of burning , which by law must be sixty feet from [any building]1180-any building . There a pit had been excavated and a grating placed above [it]1181-it .
