Then [I]1405-his companion let go — [I]1405-his companion let go — and — and [I]1405-his companion saw no more . ”[1405-his companion] “ When that day comes , [[my]1405-his companion Domitia]4373-my domitia , no hands shall divide [us]4483-us , no face be thrust between . Now come forth . [You]4373-my domitia have seen enough . ”[1405-his companion] “ Nay , [I]1411-she will look to the end . ”[1411-she] [She]1411-she took the hand of [Helena]276-helena , into which some flexibility and warmth were returning . “ Art [thou]1411-she willing ? ”[210-the magus] asked [the Magus]210-the magus . [She]1411-she nodded , and the fifth veil fell . For full five minutes [Domitia]191-domitia stood rigid , without moving a muscle , hardly breathing . Then [Lucius]219-lamia said : “ See what a purple light shines out of the crystal . What is [thy]191-domitia vision now , [Domitia]191-domitia ? By the light that beams , it should be right royal . ”[219-lamia] “ It is royal , ”[191-domitia] [she]191-domitia said in faint tones . “ [Lucius]219-lamia ! what [that Christian prophet]4485-that christian prophet spoke , that have [I]191-domitia also seen — the beast with seven heads , [one wounded to the death]4486-one wounded to the death , and there cometh up another out of the deadly wound , and — it hath the red face [I]191-domitia saw but just now . And it climbeth to a throne and lifteth [me]191-domitia up to sit thereon . Away with the vision . It offendeth [me]191-domitia . It maketh [my]191-domitia blood turn ice cold ! ”[191-domitia] “ Hast [thou]191-domitia a desire to see further ? ”[1309-the magus] asked [the Magus]1309-the magus . “ [I]191-domitia can see naught worse than this , ”[191-domitia] said [Domitia]191-domitia . A shudder ran through [her]191-domitia , and [her]191-domitia teeth chattered as with frost . Then [Elymas]207-elymas again waved [his]207-elymas hands , and chanted , “ [Askion]278-askion , [Kataskion]279-kataskion , lix , Tetras , damnameneus , ”[207-elymas] and raised and cast down the sixth veil . At once from the crystal a red light shone forth , and suffused [the whole cell of [the temple]566-the temple]1413-the whole cell of the temple with a blood - colored illumination , and by it [Lucius]219-lamia could see that there was in it no image present , only a dense black veil behind the altar on which the stone glowed like a carbuncle . [He]219-lamia heard the breath pass through the teeth of [Domitia]191-domitia , like the hissing of a serpent . [He]219-lamia looked at [her]191-domitia , [her]191-domitia face was terrible , inflamed . The eyes stiffened , the teeth were set , the brow knitted and lowering . Then [she]191-domitia said : “ [I]191-domitia stand on the beast , and the sword of [[my]191-domitia father]3834-my father pierces [his]3834-my father heart . ”[191-domitia] [Lucius]219-lamia wondered ; there was a look of hate , a hideousness in [her]191-domitia face , such as [he]219-lamia had not conceived it possible so beautiful and sweet a countenance could have assumed . Then [Elymas]207-elymas cast off the last veil . For a moment all was darkness . The red light in the crystal had expired . In stillness and suspense , not without fear , all waited , all standing save [Helena]276-helena , who had recovered from [her]276-helena trance , and [she]276-helena paused expectant on [her]276-helena couch . Then a minute spark appeared in the crystal , of the purest white light , that grew , rapidly sending out wave on wave of brilliance , so intense , so splendid , so daz zling , that [the magician]1391-the magician , unable to endure the effulgence , turned and threw [himself]1391-the magician into a corner , and wrapped [his]1391-the magician head about with [his]1391-the magician mantle . And [the medium]1416-the medium turned with a cry , as though the light caused [her]1416-the medium physical pain , buried [her]1416-the medium face in the pillow , and groped on the floor for the veils to cast over [her]1416-the medium head to exclude the light . [Lucius]219-lamia , unable to endure the splendor , covered [his]219-lamia eyes with [his]219-lamia palm . But [Domitia]191-domitia looked at it , and [her]191-domitia face grew soft , the scowl went from [her]191-domitia brow , and a wondrous tenderness and sorrow came into [her]191-domitia eyes ; great tears rose and rolled down [her]191-domitia cheeks , and glittered like diamonds in the dazzling beam . Then [she]191-domitia said with a sob : “ Ubi lux — ibi Felicitas . ”[191-domitia] Suddenly an explosion . The orb was shattered into a thousand sparks , and all was black again in [the temple]566-the temple — black as deepest night . Then [Lucius]219-lamia caught [Domitia]191-domitia to [him]219-lamia , put [his]219-lamia hand behind [him]219-lamia , drew back the curtain , and carried [her]191-domitia forth into the calm evening air , and the light of the aurora hanging over the setting sun . [She]191-domitia sobbed , gradually recovered [herself]191-domitia , drew a profound sigh , and said : “ Oh , [Lucius]219-lamia ! where is light , there is felicity ! ”[191-domitia] “ Plancus , come hither ! ”[191-domitia] [The lady Longa Duilia]816-the lady longa duilia was in an easy - chair , and [a slave - girl]493-a slave - girl , [Lucilla]183-lucilla , was engaged in driving away the flies that , perhaps attracted by [her]493-a slave - girl cosmetics , came towards [the lady]482-the lady . Summer was over , and winter storms were beginning to bluster , and the flies were dull with cold and only maintained alive by the warmth of [the chambers]1421-the chambers , heated by underground stoves , and with pipes to convey the hot air carried through every wall . “ [Plancus]182-plancus , did [you]182-plancus hear [me]482-the lady speak ? ”[482-the lady] “ [I]482-the lady am here , [[my]482-the lady lady]3717-my lady , at [your]182-plancus service . ”[482-the lady] “ Really ; [you]182-plancus have become torpid like the flies . Has the chill made [you]182-plancus deaf as well as sluggish ? ”[482-the lady] “ [[My]482-the lady lady]3717-my lady , [I]482-the lady can always hear when [you]182-plancus speak . ”[482-the lady] “ Do [you]182-plancus mean to imply that [I]482-the lady shout like [a fishwife]4490-a fishwife ? ”[482-the lady] “ [I]482-the lady mean not that . But when a harp is played , it sets every thread in every other stringed instrument a - chiming ; and so is it with [me]482-the lady . ”[482-the lady] “ The simile is wiredrawn . What [I]482-the lady want [you]182-plancus for is — no , [I]482-the lady will have no stroking of [your]182-plancus face like a cat!—is to go to [Rome]13-rome and see that [the palace]620-the palace is made ready to receive [us]4492-us . The stoves must be well heated , and everything properly aired , [The country]1108-the country at best of times is tedious ; in winter , intolerable . Besides , [I]482-the lady have no right to remain [here]3736-here buried . [I]482-the lady must consider — [Plancus]182-plancus , why are [you]182-plancus scratching ? [I]482-the lady must consider [[my]482-the lady daughter]3841-my daughter . [She]3841-my daughter is in a fit of the blues , and has nothing to say to amuse [me]482-the lady . [You]182-plancus need not blow like a sea - horse , breathe more evenly and equably;—Plancus , [you]182-plancus are becoming unendurable . [I]482-the lady must not consider [my]482-the lady bereaved feelings , but [her]3841-my daughter welfare , [her]3841-my daughter health . The air or the situation of [Gabii]36-gabii does not suit [her]3841-my daughter . [Rome]13-rome is [an extraordinarily healthy place in winter]4496-an extraordinarily healthy place in winter . [I]482-the lady [myself]482-the lady am never better anywhere than [I]482-the lady am [there]3753-there . [I]482-the lady was pretty well at [Antioch]16-antioch ; there were [military there]4498-military there , and [I]482-the lady find [the soil]4499-the soil and climate salubrious where there are [military]879-military . [Plancus?—as the Gods]4501-plancus?—as the gods love [me]482-the lady , [you]4501-plancus?—as the gods have been in [the stables]4502-the stables . [I]482-the lady know it by infallible proofs . Stand at a distance , [I]482-the lady insist . And , [Plancus]182-plancus ! [you]4501-plancus?—as the gods are not showing off conjuring tricks , that [you]4501-plancus?—as the gods should fold and unfold [your]4501-plancus?—as the gods hands . [I]482-the lady am not going to be mewed up here any longer , because [my]482-the lady two years of widowhood are not over . [You]4501-plancus?—as the gods are making faces at [me]482-the lady , positively [you]4501-plancus?—as the gods are , [Plancus]182-plancus . Do , [I]482-the lady entreat [you]4501-plancus?—as the gods , look as if [you]4501-plancus?—as the gods were [not a mountebank]4505-not a mountebank mouthing at [a crowd]4506-a crowd . ”[482-the lady] “ [I]482-the lady fly , [mistress]3718-mistress , as though winged at heel like [Mercury]281-mercury . ”[482-the lady] “ Much more like [Mercury]281-mercury ’s tortoise . Send [me]482-the lady [Claudius Senecio]267-senecio . [I]482-the lady must know what ails [Domitia]191-domitia . [She]191-domitia has the vapors . ”[482-the lady] “ [I]182-plancus obey , ”[182-plancus] said [Plancus]182-plancus , “ Am [I]482-the lady much worn , [Lucilla]183-lucilla ? ”[482-the lady] asked [the lady]482-the lady , as soon as [[her]482-the lady steward]1323-her steward had withdrawn . “ The laceration of the heart tells on a sensitive nature , and precipitates wrinkles and so on . ”[182-plancus] “ [Madam]3720-madam , [you]183-lucilla bloom as in a second spring . ”[482-the lady] “ A second spring , [Lucilla]183-lucilla ! ”[181-duilia] exclaimed [Longa]181-duilia , sitting bolt upright . “ [You]183-lucilla hussy , how dare [you]183-lucilla ? A second spring , indeed ! Why , by [the zone of [Venus]201-venus]4509-the zone of venus , [I]181-duilia am not through [my]181-duilia first summer yet . ”[181-duilia] “ [You]183-lucilla misconceive [me]482-the lady , [dear lady]4510-dear lady . When [a virgin]4511-a virgin has been wedded , then come on [her]4511-a virgin the cares of matronhood , the caprices , the ill - humors of [[her]4511-a virgin husband]579-her husband — and to some , not without cause , the vexation of [his]579-her husband jealousy . But when [the Gods]3756-the gods have removed [him]579-her husband , it sometimes happens that the ravages caused by the annoyances of marriage disappear , and [she]4511-a virgin reverts to the freshness and loveliness of [her]4511-a virgin virginity . ”[482-the lady] “ There is something in what [you]183-lucilla say ; of course it is true only of highly privileged natures , in which is some divine blood . A storm ruffles the surface of [the lake]1111-the lake . When the storm is past , [the lake]1111-the lake resumes its placidity and beauty — exactly as it was before . [I]606-the philosopher have noted it a thousand times . Yes , of course it is so . Here comes [Senecio]267-senecio ; [he]267-senecio waddles just like [the Hindu nurse [I]606-the philosopher saw at [Antioch]16-antioch]4516-the hindu nurse i saw at antioch , laboring about with [two fat babies]4517-two fat babies . ”[606-the philosopher] [The Philosopher]606-the philosopher approached . “ [I]818-the widow will trouble [you]183-lucilla to come in front of [me]818-the widow , ”[818-the widow] said [the widow]818-the widow . “ Have [you]183-lucilla eaten so heavy a meal as to shrink from so much unnecessary exertion ? [I]818-the widow can not talk with [my]818-the widow neck twisted . The windpipe is not naturally constructed like a thread in a rope . [I]818-the widow am returning to [Rome]13-rome . ”[818-the widow] “ To [Rome]13-rome , [madam]3720-madam ! [I]482-the lady do not advise that . [The place]3754-the place is in commotion . There have been sad scenes of riot and pillage in [the capital]642-the capital . ”[482-the lady] “ As [the Gods]3756-the gods love [me]482-the lady ! what care [I]482-the lady so long as [they]3756-the gods do not invade [the house]744-the house in [the Carinæ]83-the carinæ ? ”[482-the lady] “ But there have been also massacres . ”[818-the widow] “ Well , when [princes]4523-princes shift about , that is inevitable . [They]4523-princes all do it . For [my]482-the lady part , [I]482-the lady rather like — that is , [I]482-the lady do n’t object to massacres in [their]4523-princes proper places and confined to [the proper persons]4524-the proper persons . ”[482-the lady] “ [Madam]3720-madam , [you]3720-madam are secure where [you]3720-madam are . [I]818-the widow am not [a man]3770-a man . Moreover , [I]818-the widow thank [the Gods]198-the gods , [[my]818-the widow house]4529-my house is not on the Flaminian Way , nor is it in [the Velabrum]92-the velabrum , nor [the Suburra]93-the suburra , nor in [the Forum Boarium]94-the forum boarium either . Give [me]482-the lady massacres rather than stagnation . [He]283-vespasian married above [his]283-vespasian position , one [Vespasia Polla]293-vespasia polla ; [I]482-the lady have seen and heard of [her]293-vespasia polla , [a round - faced woman like a pudding]4553-a round - faced woman like a pudding ; [he]283-vespasian took [her]293-vespasia polla for [her]293-vespasia polla blood , but [she]293-vespasia polla was only [[a knight]4554-a knight ’s daughter]4555-a knight ’s daughter ; and [those city knights]4556-those city knights , as [the Gods]3756-the gods love [me]482-the lady ! what a money - grubbing low set [they]4556-those city knights are ! [[His]283-vespasian son]4558-his son , [Flavius Vespasianus]285-flavius sabinus is proclaimed ! It is really funny . It is , [O Morals]4559-o morals ! [I]482-the lady must laugh . Now , if [[my]482-the lady good man]4560-my good man had but listened to [me]482-the lady . But there , [I]482-the lady shall become mad.—I do n’t know how long it is since [you]4561-you have been pecking , or whether [you]4561-you eat all day long ? But [you]4561-you have crumbs sticking in [your]4561-you beard . Another time be good enough to comb [your]4561-you beard before approaching [me]482-the lady . Tell [me]482-the lady , what has given [Domitia]191-domitia the dumps ? ”[482-the lady] “ [I]818-the widow believe , [madam]3720-madam , [she]191-domitia has been frightened by [that unscrupulous impostor]4563-that unscrupulous impostor , [Elymas]207-elymas , or [Ascleparion]286-ascleparion , or whatever [he]4563-that unscrupulous impostor is called . Positively two years retirement for [a widow]4574-a widow is unreasonable . In the good old days of the Republic one was thought enough . [Flavius Sabinus]285-flavius sabinus is [præfect of [the city]3846-the city]4576-præfect of the city , and [he]285-flavius sabinus is [the elder brother of [Vespasian]283-vespasian]4578-the elder brother of vespasian . [I]482-the lady positively must be [home]1201-home before the Ides ; why — ”[482-the lady] with a start of pleasure—“The Ides of December ! that is the dedication feast of [the temple of [Tellus]328-tellus in [the Carinæ]83-the carinæ]4583-the temple of tellus in the carinæ . There [you]4584-you have it ! Devotion to [the gods]3756-the gods — an excuse for a little supper — a wee little supper — but so good and so nicely turned out . ”[818-the widow] [Longa Duilia]181-duilia and [[her]181-duilia entire household]1427-her entire household had returned to [the capital]642-the capital , and were installed in [the family mansion in [the Carinæ]83-the carinæ]1429-the family mansion in the carinæ . Happily , as [Corbulo]204-corbulo had considered [it]1430-it , [this house]1431-this house had escaped in the conflagration of [Rome]13-rome under [Nero]212-nero . This , however , was a matter of some regret to [Duilia]181-duilia , who would have preferred to have had [it]1431-this house burnt , so that [it]1431-this house might have been rebuilt in greater splendor and in newer style . Nevertheless , although externally dingy , [it]1431-this house was [a commodious mansion within]1432-a commodious mansion within , and was well furnished , especially with carpets and curtains of Oriental texture , that had been wrought at , or purchased at [the bazaars of [Antioch]16-antioch and [Damascus]98-damascus]1433-the bazaars of antioch and damascus . [The centre of [the house]744-the house]1434-the centre of the house was occupied by [the atrium , or hall]1436-the atrium , or hall , open to the sky above the water tank in the midst . On each side at the further end from the entrance extended the “ wings ”[4024-the family] that contained [the family]4024-the family portraits enclosed in gilded boxes or shrines , the doors of which were thrown open on festal occasions . In the centre , between the wings was the tablinum , [the reception - room of [the house]744-the house]1438-the reception - room of the house , and on the right side of the entrance was the family money - chest , girded with iron . On the ledge of the water tank before [the reception room]1440-the reception room , smoked a little altar before an image of [Larpater]290-larpater , [the ancestor and founder of [the family]4024-the family]1441-the ancestor and founder of the family , regarded as [the tutelary deity of [the house]744-the house]1443-the tutelary deity of the house . [The penates , the subsidiary household gods , that had formerly been retained in [the hall]754-the hall , near the altar]1445-the penates , the subsidiary household gods , that had formerly been retained in the hall , near the altar — curious , smoked , and badly - shaped dolls , [some in rags , some in wood]1447-some in rags , some in wood , others in terra cotta — were sometimes consigned to [a family chapel]1448-a family chapel , but in [the house of [the widow of [Corbulo]204-corbulo]1450-the widow of corbulo]1449-the house of the widow of corbulo , as in many another , [they]1447-some in rags , some in wood had been relegated to a shelf in [the kitchen near the hearth]1451-the kitchen near the hearth , and a lamp was maintained perpetually burning before [them]1447-some in rags , some in wood . In primitive times , when life was simple , [the hall]754-the hall had been [the common room of [the house]744-the house , in which [the wife]1337-the wife cooked the meals at the hearth]1453-the common room of the house , in which the wife cooked the meals at the hearth , and where also on seats , [father]531-father , [wife]3875-wife , [children]3831-children and [domestics]1459-domestics partook together of the common meal . But now all this was altered . In winter [the hall]754-the hall was too cold to be sat in . It was inconvenient to have the cooking done before all eyes . Consequently [a separate kitchen]1461-a separate kitchen and [separate dining - rooms]1462-separate dining - rooms were constructed , and the smoking altar and the image by [it]754-the hall alone remained in [the hall]754-the hall as a reminiscence of [the family hearth that once stood there]1464-the family hearth that once stood there . It is more difficult to understand the meals and meal times of [the old Romans]1465-the old romans , than the arrangement of [[their]1465-the old romans houses]1466-their houses . [They]1465-the old romans rose vastly early in the morning , and took a snack of breakfast of the simplest description , which lasted [them]1465-the old romans till lunch at 10 a. m. But such as were occupied abroad rarely returned [home]1201-home for this meal . At noon [they]1465-the old romans bathed , and then came the great feed of the day , the cœna , which [we]1468-we translate “ supper , ”[1468-we] but which was begun at half - past one in winter and an hour later in summer . This lasted the entire afternoon , and even on great occasions into the night . [Some revellers]1469-some revellers did not break up till midnight , or even prolonged the orgy to dawn . It was not till [the Goths]291-the goths and [Vandals]1470-vandals overflowed the classic world , that the supper was postponed until the evening . [The Roman citizen]1471-the roman citizen ’s day was from dawn till noon . Then [he]1471-the roman citizen had [his]1471-the roman citizen snooze and [his]1471-the roman citizen bath , and the remainder of the day was devoted to the mighty meal and to reading , conversation , and amusement . “ [I]181-duilia am so pleased to see [you]1471-the roman citizen , ”[181-duilia] said [Longa Duilia]181-duilia , stepping forward to receive the Præfect of [Rome]13-rome , to [her]181-duilia little supper . [He]1471-the roman citizen was [a gray - headed , plain , blunt man]1472-a gray - headed , plain , blunt man , with very ordinary features ; [he]1471-the roman citizen was attended by [two lictors]1473-two lictors , and by [[his]1471-the roman citizen son]4558-his son , [Sabinus]285-flavius sabinus . “ [I]4558-his son thank [you]1471-the roman citizen , [madam]3720-madam , for the courteous invitation . ”[4558-his son] “ [I]1471-the roman citizen could kill [myself]1471-the roman citizen with vexation not to have made [your]1471-the roman citizen acquaintance earlier . [You]1471-the roman citizen see , for some years [I]1471-the roman citizen have been at [Antioch]16-antioch , with [[my]1471-the roman citizen dearest husband]4587-my dearest husband , whose sword — that sword which drank the blood of [Germans]292-germans , Parthians and [Armenians]187-armenians — excuse these tears — [you]1471-the roman citizen see it — suspended yonder . But , as [I]1471-the roman citizen was saying , [we]4588-we have been from [Rome]13-rome so long , and since [my]1471-the roman citizen return [I]1471-the roman citizen have lived in such seclusion , that [we]4588-we have not met — and yet , considering [our]4588-we relationship — — ”[1471-the roman citizen] “ [[My]4558-his son dear lady]4092-my dear lady , [I]4558-his son was unaware that [I]4558-his son was entitled to such an honor . ”[4558-his son] “ Oh ! yes , of course , [cousins]4590-cousins . ”[4558-his son] “ [Cousins]4590-cousins ! ”[1471-the roman citizen] “ Through Vespasia [Polla]293-vespasia polla , [[your]4590-cousins mother]4592-your mother . What [a sweet creature]4593-a sweet creature [she]4592-your mother was ! So distinguished in [her]4592-your mother manner . [She]4592-your mother had such an intelligent face , and , as [I]4558-his son remember [her]4592-your mother , the remains of great beauty . Of course [I]4558-his son was then quite a mite of [a child]3968-a child . ”[4558-his son] “ This is indeed flattering . ”[4558-his son] “ [[You]4590-cousins men]4595-you men have other things to consider beside pedigree . [Cousins]4590-cousins [we]4590-cousins certainly are . And how is [that sweet lady]4597-that sweet lady , [[your]4590-cousins wife]4598-your wife ? By all accounts as frail as the last autumn leaf on an acacia . ”[1471-the roman citizen] “ [I]4558-his son am glad to say that , on the contrary , [she]4597-that sweet lady enjoys rude health . ”[4558-his son] “ [You]4590-cousins do not say so ! What fibs are told ! [[Your]4590-cousins son]4599-your son [Clemens]294-clemens is not here ? [I]4558-his son — [I]4558-his son have heard , does not go into society , a little peculiar in [his]4599-your son views . [We]4590-cousins are not all made alike . But this , [[your]4590-cousins son]4599-your son [Sabinus]294-clemens , is formed like an Apollo . And [[your]4590-cousins daughter]3826-your daughter Plautilla — so sorry ! infected in the same way . Will not go to dinners or shows — ah ! well it is [her]3826-your daughter loss . It is a pleasure to reunite [family]580-family ties . Alas ! [you]4590-cousins know of [my]4558-his son irreparable loss . [I]4558-his son do not know whether [you]4590-cousins saw the sword of [[my]4558-his son darling]3832-my darling . [He]3832-my darling fell on it . Bathed it with [his]3832-my darling blood . Every night [I]4558-his son bedew the sacred blade with [my]4558-his son tears . Excuse [me]4558-his son — [my]4558-his son emotion overcomes [me]4558-his son . [I]4558-his son would have buried [myself]4558-his son at [Gabii]36-gabii , clasping the sword to [my]4558-his son wounded bosom for the remainder of [my]4558-his son shattered life , had it not been for the health of [[my]4558-his son child]4270-my child . [A mother]4605-a mother ’s thoughts are with [[her]4605-a mother offspring]4606-her offspring . Well , now to table . [A widow]4574-a widow ’s fare , only a small supper in [a house of mourning]4608-a house of mourning — though more than a twelvemonth since the funeral — indeed , two years since [[my]4558-his son dear one]4609-my dear one died — on that sword . Oh ! [I]4558-his son turn away [my]4558-his son eyes ! The sight of that blade . But , come — that is [[my]4558-his son daughter]3841-my daughter . Salute [her]3841-my daughter . [A cousin]4611-a cousin . Give [me]4558-his son [your]4612-your hand , [Flavius]294-clemens . The table calls [us]4613-us . ”[4558-his son] [The house of [a wealthy Roman]1476-a wealthy roman at this period]1475-the house of a wealthy roman at this period had not only [a summer dining - room]1477-a summer dining - room , open to the air , but one also for winter , well heated by stoves . Three tables were placed , so as to accommodate [nine persons]1478-nine persons , three at each , leaving the ends of two and an open square in the middle . Into [this hollow]1479-this hollow [the servants]1480-the servants ran the “ repository , ”[1480-the servants] a sort of what - not , on wheels , consisting of a tier of shelves , all laden with dishes ; and [the guests]1481-the guests put forth [their]1481-the guests hands and selected such meats as [they]1481-the guests fancied . Knives [they]1481-the guests had , but no forks . In place of these latter [they]1481-the guests were furnished with spoons , having the extremity of the handle turned down as claw or hoof , or sharpened to a point , so as to serve to hold the meat whilst it was being cut . When so employed , the bowl of the spoon was held in the hollow of the hand ; but when used as a spoon , then the end was reversed . A sideboard was piled up with silver and gold plate . In addition in a corner stood a round table with three feet ; on which were laid napkins neatly tied up with blue and red bands . These napkins contained trinkets , rings , brooches , comfits , mottoes , and were to be given to [the guests]1481-the guests along with the dessert . [Our]1483-our presentation of Christmas crackers is a reminiscence of the old Roman custom of making presents to [the guests]1481-the guests at the close of a banquet . [The males]1336-the males lay at table on couches , with [their]1336-the males legs extended behind [them]1336-the males , [their]1336-the males left elbows reposed on pillows . It was against ancient Roman custom for [ladies]1486-ladies to recline , but recently [some empresses]1487-some empresses had broken through the rule , and when [they]1487-some empresses set the example of lounging , [others]3837-others followed . [Duilia]181-duilia , however , was [a stickler]1489-a stickler in some things , and [she]181-duilia somewhat affected archaic usages , as a mark of distinction , as a token of the antiquity of [the family]4024-the family , whose customs had acquired an almost sacred sanction . [Ladies]1486-ladies sat on stools . The couches and seats were sumptuous , inlaid with mother - of - pearl , tortoise - shell and silver , and were covered with Oriental carpets . [Every guest]1492-every guest was attended by [a slave]749-a slave , bearing an ewer and napkin , so that [he]749-a slave might cleanse [his]749-a slave fingers directly they became greasy — a necessity of constant recurrence , on account of the absence of proper forks . A baldachin of embroidered silk was stretched above the table , and the heads of [the banqueters]1494-the banqueters . This was done for the purpose of cutting off the draught , as immediately above , in the ceiling , was the lacunar , an opening through which the steam and savor of dinner might escape , and through which , when the canopy was not spread , rose - leaves , violets , a spray of scent , even garlands were scattered over [the revellers]1495-the revellers . A Roman dinner began , like one in [Russia]99-russia at the present day , with a gustus , a snack of something calculated to stimulate the appetite or to help digestion . Then came in soft - boiled eggs , the invariable first dish , just as invariably , the meal closed with apples . With the eggs were served salads and sauer - kraut , cabbage shredded in vinegar , Brussels sprouts boiled with saltpetre to enhance their green , turnips and carrots in mustard and vinegar . Melons were eaten with pepper , salt , and vinegar ; artichokes were consumed raw , with oil ; mallows and sorrel , olives , mush rooms and truffles were favorite vegetables , and were eaten along with large snails , oysters , sardines , and chopped lizards . All this was preparatory . Now entered [the repository]1496-the repository , groaning under meats and fish . At the same moment [a slave]749-a slave produced and handed round a menu card . But before eating , a benediction was pronounced , [the household gods]1498-the household gods were invoked and promised a share of the good things from the table . It is unnecessary to catalogue the solids and entrées sent up at such a supper . Pork was a favorite dish , and there were fifty ways in which a pig could be served up . Octopus was much relished , as it is to this day in [Italy]22-italy . Wild fowl was stuffed with garlic , mutton with asafœtida , and some meats were not considered in condition till decomposition had begun . The strong savor produced by those dishes was dissipated by [servants holding large fans]1499-servants holding large fans , and counteracted by the diffusion of aromatic smoke , and the sprinkling of [guests]1500-guests and table with essences . A supper consisted of several courses , but a considerable interval elapsed between each , which interval was filled in with conversation , or enlivened with the antics of [buffoons]1501-buffoons , or with music , or the recitation of poetry . Nothing in the smallest degree unseemly was allowed in [the house of [Longa Duilia]181-duilia]1502-the house of longa duilia , at such entertainments . [We]1503-we read a good deal , in [the ancient authors]1504-the ancient authors , of the license allowed at such times , but this was not general , certainly was not suffered except in very “ fast ”[1508-the præfect] houses , and such were attended by [none who respected [themselves]1506-themselves]1505-none who respected themselves . [The widow]818-the widow knew how to make [herself]818-the widow agreeable . [Flavius Sabinus]294-clemens , [the præfect]1508-the præfect , was [a great talker]1509-a great talker , and there was a little rivalry between [the two]1510-the two as to which should lead the conversation . [Domitia]191-domitia hardly spoke , but [the guests]1481-the guests generally entertained [themselves]1481-the guests heartily . [Lamia]219-lamia was there , and near [[his]219-lamia betrothed]1512-his betrothed , but found it difficult to carry on conversation with [her]1512-his betrothed . Since the questioning of [Ishtar]274-ishtar in [the Temple at [Gabii]36-gabii]1513-the temple at gabii , [she]1512-his betrothed had been haunted by the visions presented to [her]1512-his betrothed inner sight , and [she]1512-his betrothed was unable to shake off the oppression of spirits and distress of mind , [they]1514-they had caused . When supper was ended , previous to the dessert , all rose , a grace was said , and again [the household gods]1498-the household gods were invoked . [All]568-all were thus standing , in solemn hush , whilst a portion for [the deities]1517-the deities was being taken away , when the curtain before the door was roughly drawn aside , and [a young man ran in — then halted , bewildered by the lights and the company]1518-a young man ran in — then halted , bewildered by the lights and the company , and hesitated before advancing further . A faint cry escaped the breast of [Domitia]191-domitia ; and [she]191-domitia staggered back , and caught [Lamia]219-lamia convulsively by the wrist . Then [Flavius Sabinus]294-clemens said apologetically to [[his]294-clemens hostess]1519-his hostess : “ [This youth]4614-this youth is [[my]294-clemens nephew]4615-my nephew , [Titus Flavius Domitianus]295-titus flavius domitianus , [the younger son of [[my]294-clemens brother]4617-my brother [Vespasian]283-vespasian]4616-the younger son of my brother vespasian . Pardon [his]4614-this youth lack of breeding , [lady]3723-lady — [I]294-clemens bade [him]4614-this youth find [me]294-clemens here , if matters of importance demanded [my]294-clemens attention . Excuse [me]294-clemens , [I]294-clemens pray , if [I]294-clemens retire with [him]4614-this youth and hear what news of weight [he]4614-this youth bears . ”[294-clemens] [Duilia]181-duilia bowed , and [the præfect]1508-the præfect , leaving [his]1508-the præfect place , went to meet [[his]1508-the præfect nephew]1521-his nephew . [Lamia]219-lamia felt that [Domitia]191-domitia was trembling . [He]219-lamia looked in [her]191-domitia face and it alarmed [him]219-lamia . With wide eyes [she]191-domitia was staring at [the intruder]1522-the intruder ; [her]191-domitia lips were slightly parted , every trace of color had deserted them ; and between them gleamed [her]191-domitia teeth . Not till the curtain had fallen , and hidden the form of [the young man]535-the young man , as [he]535-the young man left with [[his]535-the young man uncle]1524-his uncle , did [she]191-domitia breathe freer . Then [she]191-domitia heaved a long sigh , and said in a faint voice : “ It is [he]535-the young man — [the eighth crowned head]4619-the eighth crowned head — the fifth come again — [the new Nero]4620-the new nero . O [Lamia]219-lamia ! Terrible is [Fate]296-fate ! ”[191-domitia] “ [[My]181-duilia dear child]4621-my dear child , ”[181-duilia] said [Duilia]181-duilia , “ [I]191-domitia never did a better stroke of policy than that supper a few evenings ago . It went off quite charmingly , without a hitch . [I]191-domitia allowed that good [Flavius Sabinus]294-clemens to talk ; and [he]294-clemens is just one of [those men who enjoys [himself]294-clemens best where [he]294-clemens is given full flow for [his]294-clemens twaddle]4622-those men who enjoys himself best where he is given full flow for his twaddle . [A good , worthy , commonplace man]4623-a good , worthy , commonplace man . [I]191-domitia doubt if [he]294-clemens has push in [him]294-clemens , but [he]294-clemens is just so situated now that [he]294-clemens must go ahead . The news is most encouraging . [Mucianus]297-mucianus is on [his]297-mucianus way to [Italy]22-italy at the head of [an army]4379-an army . [Primus]298-primus , with [[his]298-primus legions]4625-his legions , is approaching ; [he]298-primus has beaten [the troops sent against [him]298-primus]4626-the troops sent against him , and has sacked [Cremona]101-cremona ; there are positively [none who hold by [Vitellius]284-vitellius except [[his]298-primus brother]4580-his brother in [Campania]102-campania , and [[his]298-primus German bodyguard]4629-his german bodyguard]4627-none who hold by vitellius except his brother in campania , and his german bodyguard . [Domitia]191-domitia , ”[191-domitia] [the widow]818-the widow dropped [her]818-the widow voice , “ [we]4630-we can do better than with that milksop Ælius Lamia . ”[818-the widow] “ [Mother]4061-mother , [I]191-domitia will have no other . ”[191-domitia] “ Then [we]4630-we must push [him]298-primus up into position . But come , [[my]818-the widow dear]4058-my dear , [we]4630-we must show [ourselves]4630-we at [the Lectisternia]103-the lectisternia . It will be expected of [us]4630-we , and be setting a good example , and all that sort of thing , and it is positively wicked to mope indoors when [we]4630-we ought to be seen in [the streets]1075-the streets and [the forum]4222-the forum . So there , make [yourself]4058-my dear ready . [I]818-the widow am going instantly . [I]818-the widow have ordered round [the palanquins]4635-the palanquins , and , as [you]4058-my dear may perceive , [I]818-the widow am dressed and [my]818-the widow hair done to go out . That supper was quite a success . ”[818-the widow] The time was now that of the Saturnalia , lasting seven days , beginning on the 17th December with a strange institution , a banquet of [the gods]3756-the gods . Usually [the several gods]1527-the several gods had [their]1527-the several gods feasts in [[their]1527-the several gods own temples]1528-their own temples and invited [others]3837-others to [them]1527-the several gods , but on certain solemn occasions all banqueted together in public . The distress , the butcheries , the general confusion caused by the setting up and casting down of [emperors]4278-emperors — three in ten months — and now , eight months after , a fourth tottering ; and every change involving massacre , plunder , disturbance of [order;—this]1531-order;—this had moved [the priests]1532-the priests to decree a solemn lectisternium and supplication for the restoration of tranquillity and the cessation of civil broil . The banquet was to take place in [the forum]4222-the forum . “ [You]4058-my dear shall come in the lectica ( palanquin ) with [me]181-duilia , ”[181-duilia] said [Duilia]181-duilia . “ It will have quite a pathetic aspect — [the widow]818-the widow and [the orphan]4637-the orphan together . Besides , [I]181-duilia want [some one]4638-some one to talk to . What do [you]4058-my dear think of [Flavius Domitianus]295-titus flavius domitianus ? [A modest lad]4639-a modest lad , to [my]181-duilia mind . ”[181-duilia] “ Shy and clumsy , ”[191-domitia] observed [Domitia]191-domitia . “ The sight of [him]295-titus flavius domitianus is a horror to [me]191-domitia . ”[191-domitia] “ [[My]181-duilia dear child]4621-my dear child , only [a fool]4041-a fool will take sprats when [he]4041-a fool can have whitebait . Look out to better [yourself]4621-my dear child . ”[181-duilia] “ Oh , mother!—what is that ? ”[191-domitia] “ [A god]4642-a god going to supper , ”[482-the lady] said [the lady]482-the lady . “ [We]4643-we shall see plenty of them presently . ”[482-the lady] That which had attracted [[her]482-the lady daughter]901-her daughter ’s attention was a bier supported on the shoulders of [priests , on which]1536-priests , on which lay a figure dressed handsomely , in the attitude of [a man at table]1537-a man at table , raised on [his]1537-a man at table left elbow that was buried in a pillow , the head erect and the right arm extended , balanced in the air . The body was probably of wood under the drooping drapery , but the face and hands and feet were of wax . In jolting over [the pavement]1538-the pavement , the sleeve had become disarranged , and showed the wooden prop that sustained the waxen right hand . The face was colored , the eyes were of glass , and real hair was affixed to the head ; the lower jaw , hung on wires , opened and shut with the jostling . [The staring figure swaying on the shoulders of [the bearers]1540-the bearers]1539-the staring figure swaying on the shoulders of the bearers , had a sufficiently startling effect , sweeping round a corner , wagging [its]1539-the staring figure swaying on the shoulders of the bearers beard , and past the palanquin in which were [the ladies]1205-the ladies . “ A thing like that ca n’t eat , ”[191-domitia] said [Domitia]191-domitia . “ Oh , [[my]191-domitia dear child]4621-my dear child , no . [The gods]3756-the gods only sniff at the food . After it has been set before [them]3756-the gods , it is carried away , and [the people]3888-the people scramble for it . ”[191-domitia] “ [They]3756-the gods are naught but wax and woodwork , ”[3790-the girl] said [the girl]3790-the girl contemptuously . “ [[My]3790-the girl child]4270-my child , how often have [I]3790-the girl not had to quote to [you]4270-my child that text , “[3790-the girl] It is not well to be overwise about [the gods]3756-the gods ? ” Here [we]4648-we are ! What [a crowd]4506-a crowd ! ”[191-domitia] [The forum of [Rome]13-rome]1544-the forum of rome , [that wondrous basin towered over on one side by [the Capitol]1546-the capitol]1545-that wondrous basin towered over on one side by the capitol , inclosed on another by [the Palatine]1547-the palatine , and on the third by [the densely packed blocks of houses in [the Suburra]93-the suburra below [the Quirinal]77-the quirinal]1548-the densely packed blocks of houses in the suburra below the quirinal , [Viminal and Esquiline Hills]104-viminal and esquiline hills , was [itself]1544-the forum of rome crowded with [temples and basilicas]1549-temples and basilicas , yet not then as dense with monuments as later , when [the open spaces]1550-the open spaces were further encroached upon by [the Antonines]299-the antonines . “ [Domitia]191-domitia , ”[181-duilia] said [Longa Duilia]181-duilia , in [her]181-duilia ear , “ all things are working out excellently . [Vitellius]284-vitellius is aware that [he]284-vitellius has no chance , and has been consulting with [[our]4648-we cousin]4650-our cousin in [the Temple of [Concord yonder]106-concord yonder]105-the temple of concord yonder , and [they]4651-they have nearly settled between [them]4651-they that [Vespasian]283-vespasian is to assume the purple without further opposition . [Vitellius]284-vitellius will retire to [some country villa]4652-some country villa on a handsome annuity . That will prevent more bloodshed and confiscation , and all that sort of thing . It is always advisable to avoid unpleasantnesses if possible . There , [child]4287-child , there are quite a bevy of [gods already at table]4654-gods already at table . See that dear old doll , [Summanus]300-summanus , without a head — [you]4287-child know it was struck off by lightning in the time of [Pyrrhus]301-pyrrhus . It was of clay , and rolled all the way to [the Tiber]107-the tiber and plopped in . Since then [he]300-summanus has been without a head , [the darling]4655-the darling ! ”[181-duilia] “ How can [he]300-summanus either smell or eat , [mother]4061-mother ? ”[181-duilia] “ [[My]181-duilia child]4270-my child , [I]181-duilia do n’t ask . It is not well to be overwise about [the gods]3756-the gods . There go [the Arval Brothers]302-the arval brothers with the image of [Aca Larentia]303-aca larentia seated — of course not lying . [You]4270-my child will see [some venerable curiosities , who put in an appearance on days like this so as not to be wholly forgotten]4659-some venerable curiosities , who put in an appearance on days like this so as not to be wholly forgotten . ”[181-duilia] The sight presented by [the forum]4222-the forum was indeed strange . [A space]1552-a space had been cleared and shut off from the intrusion of [the crowd]1188-the crowd , and there lay and sat the images at tables that were spread with viands . All were either life - size or larger . [Some]760-some were skilfully modelled , and wore gorgeous clothing , but others were of the rudest moulding in terra cotta , or carved wood , and evidently of very ancient date , of Etruscan workmanship little influenced by Greek art . [Domitia]191-domitia looked on in astonishment . [The populace]1555-the populace laughed and commented on the images , without the least reverence ; and [the priests]1532-the priests and [[their]1532-the priests assistants]1557-their assistants laid the dishes before the puppets , then whisked [them]1558-them off and carried [them]1558-them without the barriers . Thereupon ensued a struggle who should get hold of the savory morsels that were being conveyed from the table of [the gods]3756-the gods ; even the vessels used for the viands and for the wine were snatched at and carried away , and [the priests]1532-the priests offered no resistance . [Domitia]191-domitia was completely transported out of [herself]191-domitia by astonishment at the sight . Every now and then the hum of voices spluttered into a burst of laughter at some ribald joke , and then roared up into a hubbub of sound over the trays of meats and wine that were being fought for . Already the short winter day was closing in , and torches were being brought forth and stood beside the images . Then the tables were cleared and removed . A trumpet blast sounded , and instantly the barriers were cast down , and the second act of this extraordinary spectacle ensued . This was the supplication . Instantly the temper of [the mob]1561-the mob changed from scepticism and mockery to enthusiastic devotion , and [those pressed forward]1562-those pressed forward to kneel and touch the cushions and drapery on which [the gods]3756-the gods reposed , and to entreat [their]1562-those pressed forward assistance , whose lips had but recently uttered a scoff . Nothing so completely differentiates Christian worship from that of Pagan [Rome]13-rome as the congregational character of the former contrasted with the uncongregational nature of the latter . At the present day in [Papal]108-papal [Rome]13-rome [the priests]1532-the priests may be seen behind glass doors in [little chapels annexed to S. Peter ’s]1565-little chapels annexed to s. peter ’s and S. Maria Maggiore saying [[their]1532-the priests offices]1566-their offices , indifferent to there being [no laity present]1567-no laity present , indeed , with no provision made that [they]1532-the priests should assist . This is a legacy of [Pagan Rome]1568-pagan rome . The sacrifices , the services in [the temples]1569-the temples and [other sanctuaries]1570-other sanctuaries , were entirely independent of [the people]3888-the people , some performed within closed doors . The only popular religious service was the supplication , which took place but occasionally . Then [the public]1079-the public streamed to the images of [the gods]3756-the gods , uttering fervent prayer , chanting hymns , prostrating [themselves]1079-the public before the couches , catching at [their]1079-the public bed - coverings , esteeming [themselves]1079-the public blessed if [they]1079-the public could lay [their]1079-the public hands on the sacred pillows . But there was no general consent as to which of [the gods and goddesses]1574-the gods and goddesses were most potent . [Some]760-some cried out that [Mother Orbona]304-mother orbona had helped [them]760-some , others that [Fortuna]305-fortuna was a jade and promised but performed nothing . [One fanatic , in a transport]1576-one fanatic , in a transport , shrieked that [these gods]1577-these gods were good for naught , for [his]1576-one fanatic , in a transport part [he]1576-one fanatic , in a transport trusted only in [Consus]109-consus , whose temple was in ruins , whose altar was buried in earth by [the circus of [Tarquin]110-tarquin]1578-the circus of tarquin . But there were [others who swept in a strong current]1579-others who swept in a strong current towards the couch of [Jupiter]306-jupiter and of that of [Venus]201-venus . Another strong current , howling ‘ Io Saturne ! Salve Mater Ops ! ’ made for the images of [the Old God of Time]1580-the old god of time and [[his]1580-the old god of time divine Mate]1581-his divine mate . Simultaneously came a cross current of vendors of cakes and toys from [the Suburra]1582-the suburra , regardless of the devotion of [the people]3888-the people , careful only to sell [their]3888-the people goods — for the Saturnalia was a period at which [the children]1353-the children were regaled with gingerbread , and treated to dolls of terra cotta , of ivory and of wood . [Hawkers selling pistachio nuts]1585-hawkers selling pistachio nuts , the cones of the edible pine , [men with baked chestnuts]1586-men with baked chestnuts , [others]3837-others with trays of Pomponian pears and Mattian apples , vociferating and belauding [their]3888-the people wares , increased the clamor . Whilst this was at its height , down from [the Palatine by the New Way]1588-the palatine by the new way came [the German Imperial Body - Guard]1589-the german imperial body - guard , forcing a passage through [the mob]1561-the mob , [their]1589-the german imperial body - guard short swords drawn , bellowing imprecations , whirling [their]1589-the german imperial body - guard blades , striking with the flat of the steel , threatening to cut down such as impeded [their]1589-the german imperial body - guard progress . [Some vigiles]1591-some vigiles , or [city police]1592-city police , came up . There was no love lost between [them]1591-some vigiles and [the pampered foreigners employed in [the palace]620-the palace]1593-the pampered foreigners employed in the palace , and [they]1591-some vigiles opposed [the household troops]4381-the household troops . [Remonstrances]1596-remonstrances were employed and cast away . Then [a German]1597-a german was struck in the face by a pine cone , another tripped , fell , and [a hawker with a barrow - load of dolls]1598-a hawker with a barrow - load of dolls , in [his]1598-a hawker with a barrow - load of dolls eagerness to escape , ran [his]1598-a hawker with a barrow - load of dolls vehicle over [the prostrate guardsman]1599-the prostrate guardsman . At once [the Germans]1600-the germans ’ blood was up , [they]1600-the germans rushed upon [the police]1601-the police , and a fray ensued in which now this side , then that , gained advantage . [The populace , densely packed]1602-the populace , densely packed , came in for blows and wounds . When [a guardsman]1603-a guardsman fell , and [they]1600-the germans could lay hold of [him]1603-a guardsman , [he]1603-a guardsman was dragged away , and almost torn to pieces by eager hands stripping [him]1603-a guardsman of [his]1603-a guardsman splendid uniform . [The Præfect , who was in the Forum]1604-the præfect , who was in the forum , summoned [three cohorts]1605-three cohorts to [his]1604-the præfect , who was in the forum aid , to drive back [the household troops]4381-the household troops , and in a moment [the trough between [the hills]1608-the hills]1607-the trough between the hills was converted into a scene of the wildest confusion , [some women]1609-some women screaming that [they]1609-some women had lost [[their]1609-some women children]1356-their children , [others]3837-others crying to [the gods]3756-the gods to help [them]3837-others . [Boys]3915-boys had scrambled up the bases of the statues , and [one urchin]1614-one urchin sat with folded legs on the shoulders of [Julius Cæsar]307-julius cæsar , hallooing , and occasionally pelting with nuts where [they]1614-one urchin did not fear retaliation . The vendors of cakes and toys cursed as [their]1614-one urchin trays were upset , or [their]1614-one urchin barrows clashed . [Men]3873-men fought each other , for no other reason than that [the soldiers]4026-the soldiers were engaged , and [they]4026-the soldiers were unable to keep [their]4026-the soldiers itching hands off each other . Down [a stair]1617-a stair from [the palace]620-the palace came [the Emperor Vitellius]284-vitellius , carried on the shoulders of [soldiers]3954-soldiers , while [slaves]589-slaves bore flambeaux before [him]284-vitellius . [He]284-vitellius was seen to gesticulate , but in the uproar [none]3936-none heard what [he]284-vitellius said . Meanwhile , [the priests]1532-the priests were endeavoring to remove [the gods]3756-the gods , and met with the greatest difficulty . [Some frantic women]1624-some frantic women clung to the images and refused to allow [them]1624-some frantic women to be taken away . [Some of the figures]1625-some of the figures had been upset , and [the servants of the temples to which [they]1625-some of the figures belonged]1626-the servants of the temples to which they belonged made rings about [them]1625-some of the figures with interlaced arms , to protect [them]1625-some of the figures from being trampled under foot . [Jupiter Capitolinus]306-jupiter had been injured and lost [his]306-jupiter nose . [A priest with the help of a torch]1627-a priest with the help of a torch , was melting the wax and fastening it on again , whilst [the guard of [the temple]566-the temple]1628-the guard of the temple kept off the rabble . The currents of [human beings]1630-human beings , driven by diverse passions , jostled , broke across each other , resolved [themselves]1630-human beings into swirls of [living men]1631-living men and [women]4410-women carried off [their]1630-human beings feet . The litter of [the lady Duilia]1633-the lady duilia and [[her]1633-the lady duilia daughter]901-her daughter tossed like [a boat]511-a boat in a whirlpool , and [the widow]818-the widow shrieked with terror . Then two powerful arms were thrust within the curtains of the palanquin , and [the slave]520-the slave [Eboracus]193-eboracus laid hold of [Domitia]191-domitia , and said : — “ There is no safety here . Trust [me]520-the slave . [I]520-the slave will battle through with [you]191-domitia . Come on [my]520-the slave arm . Fear not . ”[520-the slave] “ Save [me]181-duilia ! [Me]181-duilia , also ! ”[181-duilia] screamed [Duilia]181-duilia , “ [I]181-duilia shall be thrown out , trodden under foot ! O [my]181-duilia wig ! [My]181-duilia wig ! ”[181-duilia] But [Eboracus]193-eboracus , regardless of [the widow]818-the widow , holding [[his]193-eboracus young mistress]3803-his young mistress on [his]193-eboracus left arm , with the right armed with a cudgel , which [he]193-eboracus whirled like a flail , and with which , without compunction [he]193-eboracus broke down all opposition , drove , battered [his]193-eboracus way through the throng where most dense , across the currents most violent , and did not stay till [he]193-eboracus had reached a comparatively unobstructed spot , in one of [the narrow lanes between [the Fish Market]1641-the fish market and [the Hostilian Court]1642-the hostilian court]1640-the narrow lanes between the fish market and the hostilian court . Hardly had [Eboracus]193-eboracus conveyed [Domitia]191-domitia out of [the Forum]4222-the forum into a place of safety , than a rush of [people]4227-people down [the street]1645-the street threatened to drive [him]193-eboracus back in the direction whence [he]193-eboracus had come . [The drifting mob]1646-the drifting mob , as it cascaded down , cried : “ [The Prætorians]4250-the prætorians are coming from [[their]4250-the prætorians camp]4661-their camp ! ”[1646-the drifting mob] It was so . Down [the hill]1647-the hill by the Tiburtine way marched [a compact body of soldiery]1648-a compact body of soldiery . The danger was imminent ; [Eboracus]193-eboracus and [[his]193-eboracus young charge]1649-his young charge were between [two masses of military]1650-two masses of military , entangled in [a seething mob of frightened people]1651-a seething mob of frightened people , mostly of [the lowest class]1652-the lowest class . “ [[My]520-the slave lady]3717-my lady ! ”[520-the slave] said [the slave]520-the slave . “ There is but one thing to be done . ”[193-eboracus] [He]193-eboracus drew [her]520-the slave to a door , knocked , and when [a voice asked who demanded admittance]1654-a voice asked who demanded admittance , answered , “ Open speedily — [Paris]308-paris ! ”[1654-a voice asked who demanded admittance] The door was furtively unbarred and opened sufficiently to admit [the slave]520-the slave and [Domitia]191-domitia , and then hastily bolted and locked again . “ Excuse [me]193-eboracus , [dear mistress]4663-dear mistress , ”[193-eboracus] said [Eboracus]193-eboracus . “ [I]193-eboracus could do no other . In [this insula]4664-this insula live the actor [Paris]308-paris and [Glyceria]309-glyceria . [They]4665-they were [both slaves in [[your]4663-dear mistress household]4667-your household]4666-both slaves in your household , but were given [their]4665-they freedom by [[your]4663-dear mistress father]4066-your father , [[my]193-eboracus late master]4669-my late master , when [he]4669-my late master went to [the East]2-the east . [They]4665-they will place [themselves]4665-they at [your]4663-dear mistress service , and offer [you]4663-dear mistress shelter in [[their]4665-they humble dwelling]4670-their humble dwelling , [the first flat on the right]4671-the first flat on the right . ”[193-eboracus] [The house]744-the house was one of [those insulæ , islets of [Rome]13-rome in which [great numbers of [the lower classes]1659-the lower classes]1658-great numbers of the lower classes were housed]1657-those insulæ , islets of rome in which great numbers of the lower classes were housed . [They]1660-they consisted in square blocks , built about [a court]1661-a court , and ran to the height of seven and even more stories . [The several flats]1662-the several flats were reached by stone stairs that ran from [the central yard]1663-the central yard to [the very summit of [these barrack - like buildings]1665-these barrack - like buildings]1664-the very summit of these barrack - like buildings . [They]1660-they vastly resembled [[our]1666-our modern model lodging - houses]1667-our modern model lodging - houses , with one exception , that [they]1660-they had no exterior windows , or at most only slits looking into [the street]1645-the street ; doors and windows opened into [the central quadrangle]1669-the central quadrangle . [These houses]1670-these houses were [little towns]1671-little towns , occupied by [numerous families]1672-numerous families , [each family]1673-each family renting [two or more chambers on [a flat]1675-a flat]1674-two or more chambers on a flat , and as in [a city]1676-a city there are diversities in rank , so was it in [these lodging - houses]1677-these lodging - houses ; [the most abjectly poor]1678-the most abjectly poor were at the very top , or on the ground floor . [The first flat]1679-the first flat commanded the highest rent , and the price of [rooms]1680-rooms gradually dwindled , the greater the elevation was . Glass was too great a luxury , far too costly to be employed except by [the most wealthy]1681-the most wealthy for filling [their]1681-the most wealthy windows . Even talc was expensive ; in [its]1682-its place thin films of agate were sometimes used ; but among [the poor]1683-the poor there was little protection in [[their]1683-the poor dwellings]1684-their dwellings against cold . The doors admitted light and air and cold together , and were always open , except at night , and then a perforation in the wood , or a small window in the wall , too narrow to allow of ingress , served for ventilation . In [a huge block of building like [the insula]1686-the insula]1685-a huge block of building like the insula , there were no chimneys . All cooking was done at the hearth in [the room that served as [kitchen]1688-kitchen and [dining - room]1689-dining - room]1687-the room that served as kitchen and dining - room , often also as [bedroom]1690-bedroom , and the smoke found its way out at the doorway into [the central court]1691-the central court . But , in fact , little cooking of food was done , except the boiling of pulse . The meals of [the poor]1683-the poor consisted mainly of salads and fruit , with oil in abundance . Dressed always in wool , in cold weather multiplying [their]1693-their wraps , [the Roman citizens]1694-the roman citizens felt the cold weather much less than [we]1695-we might suppose possible . In the rain — and in [Rome]13-rome in winter it raineth almost every day — [the balconies]1696-the balconies were crowded , and then [the women]806-the women wove , [men]3873-men tinkered or patched sandals , [children]3831-children romped , [boys]3915-boys played marbles and knuckle - bones , and sometimes [a minstrel]1701-a minstrel twanged a lyre and [the young girls]1702-the young girls danced to keep [themselves]1702-the young girls warm . There were little braziers , moreover , one on [every landing , that were kept alight with charcoal]1703-every landing , that were kept alight with charcoal , and here , when [the women]806-the women ’s fingers were numb , [they]806-the women were thawed , and [children]3831-children baked chestnuts or roasted apples . [Domitia]191-domitia had never been in [one of these blocks of habitations of [the lower classes]1659-the lower classes]1706-one of these blocks of habitations of the lower classes before , and [she]191-domitia was surprised . [The quadrangle]1708-the quadrangle was almost like an amphitheatre , with [[its]1708-the quadrangle tiers of seats for [spectators]1710-spectators]1709-its tiers of seats for spectators ; but here , in place of seats , were balconies , and [every balcony]1711-every balcony was alive with [women]4410-women and [children]3831-children . [Men]3873-men were absent ; [they]3873-men had gone out to see the commencement of [the Saturnalia]114-the saturnalia , and of [women]4410-women there were few compared to the numbers that usually thronged [these balconies]1716-these balconies . [Eboracus]193-eboracus conducted [[his]193-eboracus young mistress]3803-his young mistress up the first flight of steps , and at once a rush of [children]3831-children was made to [him]193-eboracus to ask for toys and cakes . [He]193-eboracus brushed [them]1719-them aside , and when [the mothers]1720-the mothers saw by the purple edge to [her]3803-his young mistress dress that [Domitia]191-domitia belonged to [a noble family]1721-a noble family , [they]1720-the mothers called [[their]1720-the mothers youngsters]1722-their youngsters away , and saluted [her]3803-his young mistress by raising thumb and forefinger united to the lips . [The slave]520-the slave at once conducted [Domitia]191-domitia through a doorway into [a little chamber]1724-a little chamber , where burnt a fire of olive sticks , and a lamp was suspended , by the light of which [she]191-domitia could see that [a sick woman]1725-a sick woman lay on a low bed . [Domitia]191-domitia shrank back ; but [Eboracus]193-eboracus said encouragingly : “ Be not afraid , [dear young mistress]4672-dear young mistress ; this is no catching disorder ; Glyceria suffers from an accident , and will never be well again . [She]1725-a sick woman is [the sister of [[your]191-domitia servant]4674-your servant [Euphrosyne]268-euphrosyne]4673-the sister of your servant euphrosyne . ”[193-eboracus] Then , approaching [the sick woman]1726-the sick woman , [he]193-eboracus hastily explained the reason for [his]193-eboracus taking refuge with [[his]193-eboracus mistress]1727-his mistress in [this humble lodging]1728-this humble lodging . [The sick woman]1726-the sick woman turned to [Domitia]191-domitia with a sweet smile , and in courteous words entreated [her]191-domitia to remain in [[her]1726-the sick woman chamber]1730-her chamber so long as was necessary . “ [[My]1726-the sick woman husband]4051-my husband , [Paris]308-paris , [the actor]4676-the actor , is now out ; but [he]4051-my husband will be [home]1201-home shortly , [I]1726-the sick woman trust — unless , ”[1726-the sick woman] [her]1726-the sick woman face grew paler with sudden dread , “ some ill have befallen [him]4051-my husband . Yet [I]1726-the sick woman think not that can be , [he]4051-my husband is [a quiet , harmless man]4678-a quiet , harmless man . ”[1726-the sick woman] “ [I]191-domitia thank [you]193-eboracus , ”[191-domitia] answered [Domitia]191-domitia , and took a seat offered [her]1726-the sick woman by [Eboracus]193-eboracus . [She]191-domitia looked attentively at [the sick woman]1726-the sick woman ’s face . [She]1726-the sick woman was no longer young , [she]1726-the sick woman had at one time been beautiful , [she]1726-the sick woman had large , lustrous dark eyes , and dark hair , but pain and weakness had sharpened [her]1726-the sick woman features . Yet there was such gentleness , patience , love in [her]1726-the sick woman face , a something which to [Domitia]191-domitia was so new , a something so new in [that old world]1732-that old world , that [she]191-domitia could not take [her]191-domitia eyes off [her]1726-the sick woman , wondering what the fascination was . [Glyceria]309-glyceria did not speak again , modestly waiting till [the lady of rank]1733-the lady of rank chose to address [her]309-glyceria . [Presently Domitia]191-domitia asked : “ Have [you]309-glyceria been long ill ? ”[191-domitia] “ A year , [lady]3723-lady . ”[4676-the actor] “ And may [I]4676-the actor inquire how it came about ? ”[4676-the actor] “ Alas ! It is a sad story . [[My]191-domitia little boy]4680-my little boy — — ”[191-domitia] “ [You]191-domitia have [a son]4681-a son ? ”[4676-the actor] “ [I]4676-the actor had — — ”[4676-the actor] “ [I]4676-the actor ask [your]309-glyceria pardon for the interruption ; say on . ”[4676-the actor] “ [[My]4676-the actor little boy]4680-my little boy was playing in [the street]1645-the street , when [a chariot]786-a chariot was driven rapidly down [the hill]1647-the hill , and [I]4676-the actor saw that [he]4680-my little boy would be under the horses ’ feet , so [I]4676-the actor made a dart to save [him]4680-my little boy . ”[4676-the actor] “ And then ? ”[4676-the actor] “ [I]4676-the actor was too late to rescue [him]4680-my little boy , and [I]4676-the actor fell , and the wheel went over [me]4676-the actor . [I]4676-the actor have been unable to rise since . ”[4676-the actor] “ What ! like this for all these months ! What say [the doctors]4686-the doctors ? ”[4676-the actor] “ [Alack]310-alack , [lady]3723-lady ! [they]4686-the doctors give [me]4676-the actor no hope . ”[4676-the actor] “ But for how long may this last ? ”[4676-the actor] “ [I]4676-the actor can not say . ”[4676-the actor] “ As [the gods]3756-the gods love [me]4676-the actor ! if this befell [me]4676-the actor , [I]4676-the actor should refuse [my]4676-the actor food and starve [myself]4676-the actor to death ! ”[4676-the actor] “ [I]4676-the actor can not do that . ”[4676-the actor] “ What ! [you]4676-the actor lack the resolution ? ”[4676-the actor] “ [I]4676-the actor can bear what is on [me]4676-the actor laid by [God]180-titus . ”[4676-the actor] “ There is no need to endure what can be avoided . [I]4676-the actor would make short work of it , were this [my]4676-the actor lot . And [[your]4676-the actor husband]4689-your husband ? ”[4676-the actor] “ [He]4689-your husband is here . ”[4676-the actor] Through the door came [the actor]4676-the actor , [a handsome man , of Greek type]1735-a handsome man , of greek type , with a package in [his]4676-the actor arms . [He]4676-the actor would have walked straight to [[his]4676-the actor wife]572-his wife , but had to turn at the door and drive off a clamorous pack of urchins who had pursued [him]4676-the actor , believing that [he]4676-the actor was laden with toys . “ There , [Glyceria]309-glyceria ! ”[4676-the actor] [he]4676-the actor exclaimed joyously ; “ [they]4690-they are all for [you]309-glyceria . There is such a riot and disturbance and such a crush in [the street]1645-the street , that [I]4676-the actor had hard work to push through . [I]4676-the actor misdoubt [me]4676-the actor some are broken . ”[4676-the actor] “ Oh , [Paris]308-paris ! do [you]308-paris not observe ? ”[193-eboracus] “ What ? [I]4676-the actor see nothing but [thy]309-glyceria sweet face ? ”[4676-the actor] “ [[Our]4692-our dear master ’s daughter]4693-our dear master ’s daughter , [the lady [Domitia Longina]191-domitia]4471-the lady domitia longina . ”[4676-the actor] [The actor]4676-the actor turned sharply , and was covered with confusion at the unexpected sight , and almost let [his]4676-the actor parcel fall . [Eboracus]193-eboracus explained the circumstances . Then [Paris]308-paris expressed [his]308-paris happiness , and the pride [he]308-paris felt in being honored by the visit under [[his]308-paris humble ceiling]1738-his humble ceiling , of [the lady]482-the lady , [the daughter of the good and beloved master who had given [him]308-paris and [Glyceria]309-glyceria [their]1741-their freedom]1740-the daughter of the good and beloved master who had given him and glyceria their freedom . “ Go forth , [Eboracus]193-eboracus , ”[191-domitia] said [Domitia]191-domitia , “ and [I]191-domitia prithee learn how it has fared with [[my]191-domitia mother]3924-my mother . Bring [me]191-domitia word speedily , if [thou]4696-thou canst . ”[191-domitia] When [the slave]520-the slave had withdrawn , [she]191-domitia addressed [Paris]308-paris and [Glyceria]309-glyceria . “ [I]191-domitia beseech [you]308-paris , suffer [me]191-domitia to remain [here]3736-here in quiet , and concern not [yourselves]308-paris about [me]191-domitia . [I]191-domitia have been alarmed , and this has shaken [me]191-domitia . [I]191-domitia would fain rest in this seat and not speak . Go on with what [ye]308-paris have to say and do , and consider [me]191-domitia not . So will [you]308-paris best please [me]191-domitia . ”[191-domitia] [The actor]4676-the actor was somewhat constrained at first , but after a little while overcame [his]4676-the actor reserve . [He]4676-the actor drew a low table beside [[his]4676-the actor wife]572-his wife ’s couch , and , stooping on one knee , began to unlade [his]4676-the actor bundle . [He]4676-the actor set out a number of terra cotta figures on the table , representing cocks and hens , pigs , horses , cows and [men]3873-men ; [some infinitely comical]1746-some infinitely comical ; at [them]1746-some infinitely comical [Glyceria]309-glyceria laughed . Then , as [she]572-his wife put forth a thin white hand to take up one of the quaintest images , [Domitia]191-domitia noticed that [Paris]308-paris laid hold of it , and pressed it to [his]308-paris lips . A lump rose in [the girl]3790-the girl ’s throat . “ No , ”[572-his wife] thought [she]572-his wife ; “ if [I]572-his wife had one so to love [me]572-his wife and consider [me]572-his wife , though [I]572-his wife were sick and in pain , [I]572-his wife would not shorten [my]572-his wife days . [I]572-his wife would live to enjoy [his]308-paris love . ”[572-his wife] Then again , falling into further musing , [she]572-his wife said to [herself]572-his wife : “ In time to come , if it chance that [I]572-his wife become ill , will [[my]572-his wife Lamia]4698-my lamia be to [me]572-his wife as is [this actor]4699-this actor to [[his]308-paris poor wife]4700-his poor wife ? Will [he]308-paris think of and care for [me]572-his wife ? But — and if evil were to befall [him]308-paris , would not [I]572-his wife minister to [him]308-paris , care for [him]308-paris night and day , and seek to relieve [his]308-paris sorrow ? Would [I]572-his wife grow indifferent when [he]308-paris most needed [me]572-his wife ? Then why think that [he]308-paris should become cold and neglect [me]572-his wife ? Are [women]4410-women more inclined to be true than [men?—Yet]4410-women see [this actor]4699-this actor — [this Paris]308-paris . By [the Gods]198-the gods ! Is [Lamia]219-lamia like to be [a more ignoble man]4703-a more ignoble man than [a poor freedman that gains [his]4704-a poor freedman that gains his living on the stage?—i living on the stage?—I]4704-a poor freedman that gains his living on the stage?—i should even be happy serving [him]4704-a poor freedman that gains his living on the stage?—i sick and suffering . Happy in doing [my]572-his wife duty . ”[572-his wife] And still musing , [she]1748-i said on to [herself]1748-i : “ Duty ! Yes , [I]1748-i should find content and rest of mind in that ; but to what would it all lead ? Only to a heap of dust in the end . [His]308-paris light would be extinguished , and then [I]1748-i , having nothing else to live for , would die also — by [mine]1748-i own hand:—there is nothing beyond . It all leads to an ash - heap . ”[1748-i] [Glyceria]309-glyceria , observing [the girl]3790-the girl ’s fixed eye , thought it was looking inquiringly at [her]3790-the girl , and said in [her]309-glyceria gentle voice that vibrated with the tremulousness given by suffering : “ Ah , [lady]3723-lady ! [the neighbors]4706-the neighbors and [[their]4706-the neighbors children]1356-their children are very kind . There is more of goodness and piety in [the world]466-the world than [you]3723-lady would suppose , seeing [men]3873-men and [women]4410-women only in [an amphitheatre]4711-an amphitheatre . [I]309-glyceria can do but very little . [One boy]4712-one boy fetches [me]309-glyceria water — that is [Bibulus]311-bibulus , and [[my]309-glyceria Paris]4713-my paris has bought [him]4712-one boy [this little horseman]4714-this little horseman — and [Torquata]312-torquata , [a little girl]4715-a little girl , [daughter of [a cobbler]4717-a cobbler]4716-daughter of a cobbler , [she]312-torquata sweeps the floor ; and [Dosithea]313-dosithea , that is [a good widow ’s child]4718-a good widow ’s child ; [she]4718-a good widow ’s child does other neighborly acts for [me;—and]4719-me;—and [they]4720-they thrust [me]309-glyceria on [my]309-glyceria bed to the side of the hearth , and bring [me]309-glyceria such things as [I]309-glyceria need , that [I]309-glyceria may prepare the meals for [[my]309-glyceria husband]4051-my husband . And [Claudia]314-claudia , [the wife of [a seller of nets]4723-a seller of nets]4722-the wife of a seller of nets , [she]314-claudia makes [my]309-glyceria bed for [me]309-glyceria ; but all the shopping is done for [me]309-glyceria by [Paris]308-paris , and [I]309-glyceria warrant [you]191-domitia , [lady]3723-lady , [he]308-paris is quite knowing , and can haggle over a fish or a turnip with [a market - woman]4725-a market - woman like [any housewife]4726-any housewife . ”[309-glyceria] “ [He]308-paris is very good to [you]308-paris , ”[191-domitia] said [Domitia]191-domitia . Then [Paris]308-paris turned , and , putting [his]308-paris hand on [[his]308-paris wife]572-his wife ’s mouth , said : “ [Lady]3723-lady ! [you]191-domitia can little know what [a wife]4728-a wife [my]308-paris Glyceria is to [me]308-paris . [I]308-paris had rather for [my]308-paris own sake have [her]4728-a wife thus than hale as of old . Somehow , sorrow and pain draw hearts together wondrously . ”[308-paris] “ [He]308-paris is good , ”[309-glyceria] said [Glyceria]309-glyceria , twisting [her]309-glyceria mouth from [his]308-paris covering hand . “ [We]4729-we have had a hard year ; on account of the troubles , there has been little desire among [the people]3888-the people for the theatre , and [he]308-paris has earned but a trifle . [I]309-glyceria have cost [him]308-paris much in physicians that have done [me]309-glyceria no good , yet [he]308-paris never grumbles , [he]308-paris is always cheerful , always tender - hearted and loving . ”[309-glyceria] “ Hush , [wife]3875-wife ! ”[308-paris] said [Paris]308-paris . “ [The lady]482-the lady desires rest . Keep silence . ”[308-paris] Then again [Domitia]191-domitia fell a - musing , and [the player]1751-the player and [[his]1751-the player wife]572-his wife whispered to [each other]598-each other about the destination of the several toys . Somehow [she]191-domitia had hitherto not thought of [the classes of [men]3873-men and women below [her]191-domitia station]1754-the classes of men and women below her station as having like feelings , like longings , like natures to [her]191-domitia own . [They]1754-the classes of men and women below her station had been to [her]191-domitia as puppets , even as those clay figures ranged on the table , mostly grotesque . Now that great pulse of love that throbs through the world of humanity made itself felt , it was as though scales fell from [her]191-domitia eyes , and the puppets became [beings of flesh and blood to be considered , capable of happiness and of suffering , of virtue as well as of vice]1756-beings of flesh and blood to be considered , capable of happiness and of suffering , of virtue as well as of vice . “ [I]308-paris have a little lamp here — with a fish — the fish on it , ”[308-paris] said [Paris]308-paris in a whisper . “ It is for [Luke]219-lamia , [the Physician]938-the physician . ”[308-paris] “ What ! ”[191-domitia] exclaimed [Domitia]191-domitia , starting from [her]191-domitia reverie , “ [you]308-paris know [him]219-lamia ? [We]4734-we had a talk once , and it was broken off and never concluded . [I]191-domitia would hear the end of what [he]219-lamia was saying — some day . ”[191-domitia] [Eboracus]193-eboracus brushed aside [some urchins]1757-some urchins and [girls]1758-girls blocking the door , looking in with eager , twinkling eyes at [the strange lady]1759-the strange lady and at the set out of dolls on the table . There passed whispers and nudges from one to another — but all ceased as [the British slave]1760-the british slave put together [his]1760-the british slave hands as a swimmer and plunged through [them]1761-them . “ Get away [you]191-domitia sprats and gudgeons , ”[1760-the british slave] said [he]1760-the british slave , good - humoredly . Then entering , [he]1760-the british slave said to [Domitia]191-domitia : “ [Lady]3723-lady , [[your]191-domitia mother]4592-your mother has reached [home]1201-home in safety . [I]1760-the british slave chanced to run across [Amphibolus]315-amphibolus , sent out in quest of [you]191-domitia , and [the good - for - naught]4738-the good - for - naught had turned sulky , because it is the Saturnalia , when , said [he]1760-the british slave , [the mistress]507-the mistress should do [the slave]520-the slave ’s bidding . “[1760-the british slave] That can be , ” said [he]1760-the british slave , “[1760-the british slave] but at one time in the year , and should not be forgotten . ” And [the lanes]4741-the lanes are clear of rabble . If [Paris]308-paris here will walk on one side of [you]191-domitia and [I]316-io saturne on the other , it will be well . [That rascal Amphibolus]4742-that rascal amphibolus [I]316-io saturne bade wait , but not [he]4742-that rascal amphibolus , said [he]1760-the british slave , “[316-io saturne] [Io Saturne]316-io saturne ! ” ”[4676-the actor] “ [I]4676-the actor will attend with joy , ”[4676-the actor] announced [the actor]4676-the actor . [Domitia]191-domitia rose to leave , [she]191-domitia tendered thanks to [Glyceria]309-glyceria and took two steps towards the entrance , halted , turned back , and taking the thin hand of [the sick woman in [hers]1763-the sick woman in hers]1763-the sick woman in hers , somewhat shyly said : “ [I]191-domitia may come again and see [you]191-domitia ? ”[191-domitia] Before [Glyceria]309-glyceria could reply , so great was [her]191-domitia surprise , [Domitia]191-domitia was gone . [The streets]1075-the streets were nearly empty , [they]1075-the streets were [mere lanes between huge blocks of windowless buildings]1765-mere lanes between huge blocks of windowless buildings , towering into the sky , but from [the forum]4222-the forum could be heard a hubbub of voices , cries , the clash of arms , and anon a cheer . Presently—“Stand aside ! ”[308-paris] said [Paris]308-paris , and there swept down [the lane]1767-the lane a number of [young fellows]1768-young fellows masked and tricked out in ribbons and scraps of tawdry finery . “ [I]3914-one am [the king]4743-the king ! ”[3914-one] shouted [one]3914-one , “ [Præfect of the guard]4744-præfect of the guard , arrest [those people]4745-those people .
