It has ceased to be of use to [me]181-duilia . ”[181-duilia] [Elymas]207-elymas [the sorcerer]1399-the sorcerer stood bowing before [Domitia]191-domitia , [his]1399-the sorcerer hands crossed upon [his]1399-the sorcerer breast . [She]191-domitia looked scrutinizingly into [his]1399-the sorcerer dark face , but could read nothing there . [He]1399-the sorcerer remained immovable and silent before [her]191-domitia , awaiting the announcement of [her]191-domitia will . “ [I]191-domitia have sent for [thee]1399-the sorcerer , ”[191-domitia] [she]191-domitia said . “ How long , [I]191-domitia would know , before the sixth veil falls ? ”[191-domitia] “ [Lady]5906-lady and [Augusta]350-augusta , ”[4788-the magian] answered [the Magian]4788-the magian , “ remember that when [thou]1399-the sorcerer lookest out upon [the Sabine Mountains]80-sabine mountains , on one day all is so distinct that [thou]1399-the sorcerer wouldst suppose a walk of an hour would bring [thee]1399-the sorcerer to [them]80-sabine mountains . On the morrow , the range is so faint and so remote , that [thou]1399-the sorcerer wouldst consider it must require days of travel to attain their roots . It is so with [the Future]172-the future . [We]5907-we look into [its]172-the future distance and behold forms — but whether near or far [we]5907-we know not . This only do [we]5907-we say with confidence , that [we]5907-we are aware of [their]172-the future succession , but not of [their]172-the future nearness or remoteness . ”[4788-the magian] “ What ! and the stars , will [they]172-the future not help [thee]1399-the sorcerer ? ”[191-domitia] “ There is at this time an ominous conjuncture of [planets]5908-planets . ”[191-domitia] “ [I]4788-the magian pray [thee]1399-the sorcerer , spare [me]4788-the magian the details , and tell [me]4788-the magian that which [they]172-the future portend . ”[4788-the magian] “ Is it thine own future , [Augusta]350-augusta , [thou]1399-the sorcerer desirest to look into ? ”[191-domitia] “ [Elymas]207-elymas , [my]191-domitia story has been unfolded — to what an extent it has been managed by such as [thyself]5909-thyself , that [I]191-domitia can not judge . But of a certainty it was [thou]1399-the sorcerer who didst contrive that [I]191-domitia was carried away from [[[my]191-domitia husband]4051-my husband ’s house]5911-my husband ’s house . Then what followed , [the Gods]3756-the gods know how far [thou]1399-the sorcerer wast in it , but [I]191-domitia have heard it said that [the God Titus]180-titus would not have had [his]180-titus mortal thread cut short but that , when in fever , [thou]1399-the sorcerer didst persuade [him]180-titus to a bath in snow water . It is very easy to predict what will be , when with [our]5913-our hands [we]5913-our mould the future . And now — [I]191-domitia care not whether [thou]1399-the sorcerer makest or predictest what is to be — but an end there must be , and that a speedy one — for [thine]1399-the sorcerer own safety hangs thereon . ”[191-domitia] “ How so , [lady]3723-lady ? ”[4788-the magian] “ [The Augustus]4126-the augustus has been greatly alarmed of late at sinister omens and prophesies ; and [he]4126-the augustus attributes them to [thee]3723-lady . Perhaps , ”[191-domitia] with a scornful intonation , “ [he]4126-the augustus also is aware that fulfilment is assured before a prophesy is given out . ”[191-domitia] [The Magus]210-the magus remained motionless , but [his]210-the magus face became pale . “ [I]210-the magus know , because at supper with [[his]4126-the augustus intimates]5916-his intimates , [Messala]407-messala and [Regulus]408-regulus and [Carus]409-carus , [he]4126-the augustus swore by [the Gods]3756-the gods [he]4126-the augustus would have [you]3723-lady cast to savage dogs , and [he]4126-the augustus would make an example of such as filled [men]3873-men ’s minds with expectation of evil . ”[210-the magus] “ [Lady]3723-lady — — ”[210-the magus] But [Domitia]191-domitia interrupted [him]210-the magus . “ [Thou]3723-lady thinkest that [I]191-domitia say this to alarm [thee]3723-lady and bend [thee]3723-lady to [my]191-domitia will . If [the Augustus]4126-the augustus has [[his]4126-the augustus spies]5921-his spies that watch and repeat to [him]4126-the augustus whatsoever [I]191-domitia do , whomsoever [I]191-domitia see , almost every word [I]191-domitia say — shall not [I]191-domitia also have a watch put upon [him]4126-the augustus ? Even now , [Magus]210-the magus , that [I]191-domitia have sent for [thee]3723-lady , and that [thou]3723-lady art closely consulted by [me]191-domitia this has been carried to [his]4126-the augustus ears , and as [he]4126-the augustus knows how [I]191-domitia esteem [him]4126-the augustus , [he]4126-the augustus will think this interview bodes [him]4126-the augustus no good . ”[191-domitia] “ When , [Lady Augusta]350-augusta , was this said ? ”[210-the magus] “ [The Emperor]1035-the emperor is this day returned from [Albanum]145-albanum , and the threat was made but yesterday . Who can say but that the order has already been given for [thy]3723-lady arrest , and for the gathering together of the dogs that are to rend [thee]3723-lady . ”[4042-the man] [The man]4042-the man became alarmed and moved uneasily . “ [Magus]210-the magus , ”[191-domitia] said [Domitia]191-domitia , “ [I]191-domitia can not save [thee]3723-lady , [thine]3723-lady own wits must do that . Find it written in the stars that [thy]3723-lady life is so bound up with that of [the Cæsar]224-domitian , that the death of one is the extinction of the other ; or that [thou]3723-lady holdest so potent a charm that if [thou]3723-lady wilt [thou]3723-lady canst employ it for [his]3723-lady destruction . It is not for [me]191-domitia to point out how [thou]3723-lady mayest twist out of [his]3723-lady grasp — [thou]3723-lady art [a very eel for slipperiness]5923-a very eel for slipperiness , and a serpent for contrivance . What [I]191-domitia desire to know is — How much longer is this tyranny to last , and how long am [I]191-domitia to suffer ? ”[191-domitia] Then [the magician]1391-the magician looked round [the room]1883-the room , to make sure that [he]1391-the magician was unobserved ; [he]1391-the magician raised the curtain at the door to see that [none]3936-none listened outside , and satisfied that [he]1391-the magician was neither observed nor overheard , [he]1391-the magician pointed to a clepsydra . This was an ingenious , but to [our]3268-our minds a clumsy , contrivance for measuring time . It consisted of a silver ball , with a covered opening at the top , through which the interior could be replenished . About the base of the globe were minute perforations through which the liquid that was placed in the vessel slowly oozed , and oozing ran together into a drop at the bottom which fell at intervals into the bucket of a tiny wheel . When the bucket was full , the wheel revolved and decanted the liquid whilst presenting another bucket to the distilling drops . At each movement of the wheel a connection with it gave motion to the hand of a statuette of [Saturn]410-saturn , who with [his]410-saturn scythe indicated a number on an arc of metal . The numbers ranged from one to twelve , and the contrivance answered for half the twenty - four hours . “ [Lady]3723-lady , ”[1309-the magus] said [the Magus]1309-the magus , “ before [Saturn]410-saturn has pointed to the twelfth hour — — ”[1309-the magus] Steps were heard , approaching [the room]1883-the room , along [the mosaic - laid passage]3271-the mosaic - laid passage , and next moment , the curtain was snatched aside , and [Domitian]224-domitian , [his]224-domitian face blazing with anger , entered [the apartment of [[his]224-domitian wife]572-his wife]3272-the apartment of his wife . “ So ? ”[224-domitian] said [he]224-domitian , “ [you]3723-lady are in league with [astrologers]5925-astrologers and [magicians]5926-magicians against [me]224-domitian ! But , by [the Gods]198-the gods ! [I]224-domitian can protect [myself]224-domitian . ”[224-domitian] [He]224-domitian clapped [his]224-domitian hands , and [some of [the guard]3912-the guard]3274-some of the guard appeared in the doorway . “ Remove [him]224-domitian , ”[1035-the emperor] said [the Emperor]1035-the emperor . “ [I]1035-the emperor have given orders concerning [him]224-domitian already . Hey ! [Magus]210-the magus ! knowest [thou]5927-thou what will be [thy]5927-thou doom , [thou]5927-thou who pretendest to read the fate of [men in the stars]5928-men in the stars ? ”[1035-the emperor] “ [Augustus]218-augustus , ”[3277-the necromancer] answered [the necromancer]3277-the necromancer , “ [I]3277-the necromancer have read that [I]3277-the necromancer should be rent by wild dogs . ”[3277-the necromancer] “ Sayest [thou]5927-thou so ? Then by [Jupiter]306-jupiter ! [I]224-domitian will make [thy]5927-thou forecast come to naught . Go , [Eulogius!—it]411-eulogius!—it is [my]224-domitian command that [he]306-jupiter be at once , mark [you]5927-thou , this very night , burned alive . [We]5929-we will see whether [his]306-jupiter prophecies come true . Here is [my]224-domitian order . ”[224-domitian] [Domitian]224-domitian plucked a packet of tablets from [his]224-domitian bosom , bound together with a string , drew forth one , and wrote hastily on it , then pressed [his]224-domitian seal on the wax that covered the slab and handed it to [the officer]3278-the officer . Then [the guard]3912-the guard surrounded [the astrologer]2160-the astrologer , and led [him]2160-the astrologer away . [Domitian]224-domitian waved [his]224-domitian hand . “ Every one out of earshot , ”[224-domitian] ordered [he]224-domitian , and [he]224-domitian walked to the window and looked forth . It was already night ; to the south the sky was quivering with lightning , summer flashes , without thunder . “ A storm , a storm is coming on , ”[1035-the emperor] said [the Emperor]1035-the emperor ; “ there ’ll be storms everywhere , and lightning falling on all sides — portents [they]5930-they say . So be it ! as the sword of heaven smites , so does [mine]224-domitian . But it falls not on [me]1035-the emperor , but on [[my]1035-the emperor enemies]5931-my enemies . [Domitia]191-domitia , ”[1035-the emperor] said [he]1035-the emperor , leaving the window , “ there has been a conspiracy entered into against [my]1035-the emperor life , and [the fools]5932-the fools thought to set up [Clemens]294-clemens — [he]294-clemens , [that weakling]5933-that weakling , [that coward]5934-that coward ; but [I]1035-the emperor have sent [him]294-clemens to [his]294-clemens death , and [those who were associated with [him]294-clemens]5935-those who were associated with him , the sentence is gone forth against [them]5935-those who were associated with him also . ”[1035-the emperor] “ [I]1035-the emperor marvel only that [any in [Rome]13-rome]5936-any in rome are suffered to live . ”[1035-the emperor] “ [Minerva]412-minerva gives [me]1035-the emperor wisdom — to defend [myself]1035-the emperor . ”[1035-the emperor] “ Any wild beast can employ teeth and claws . ”[1035-the emperor] “ [Domitia]191-domitia , ”[1035-the emperor] [he]1035-the emperor came close to [her]3282-her , “ [I]1035-the emperor am [the most lonely of [men]3873-men]5937-the most lonely of men . [I]1035-the emperor have [no friends]5939-no friends ; [[my]1035-the emperor kinsmen]5940-my kinsmen either have been , or hate [me]1035-the emperor ; [[my]1035-the emperor friends]5941-my friends are [the most despicable of flatterers , who would betray [[their]5941-my friends own parents]5943-their own parents to save [their]5941-my friends own throats]5942-the most despicable of flatterers , who would betray their own parents to save their own throats ; [I]1035-the emperor use [them]5941-my friends , but [I]1035-the emperor scorn [them]5941-my friends . [You]3283-you know not what it is to be alone ! ”[1035-the emperor] “ [I]1035-the emperor ! [I]1035-the emperor have been alone ever since [you]3283-you tore [me]1035-the emperor from [Lamia]219-lamia . ”[1035-the emperor] “ [Lamia]219-lamia ! ”[3283-you] [he]3283-you ground [his]3283-you teeth ; “ still [Lamia]219-lamia ! But by [the Gods]3756-the gods ! not for long . And [you]3283-you — [you]3283-you [[my]3283-you wife]5281-my wife whom [I]3283-you have loved , for whom [I]3283-you would have done anything — [you]3283-you are against [me]3283-you ; [you]3283-you take counsel with [a Chaldæan]5946-a chaldæan how long [I]3283-you have to live ; [the Senate]4140-the senate , [the nobles]5948-the nobles hate [me]3283-you , and by [Jupiter]306-jupiter , [they]5948-the nobles have good cause , for [I]3283-you cut [them]5948-the nobles with a scythe like ripe wheat . That was a good lesson of [Tarquin]110-tarquin to [[his]110-tarquin son]4558-his son [Sextus]414-sextus to nip off the heads of the tallest poppies . And [the people]3888-the people — [you]3283-you have been currying favor with [them]3888-the people — against [me]3283-you ; [the soldiers]4026-the soldiers alone love [me]3283-you , because [I]3283-you have doubled [their]4026-the soldiers pay ; let another offer to treble it and , to [a man]3770-a man , [they]4026-the soldiers will desert [me]3283-you . By [the Immortals]258-the immortals ! it is terrible to be alone — and to be plotted against , even by [[one]3914-one ’s wife]5954-one ’s wife . ”[3283-you] [He]3284-he walked [the room]1883-the room , flourishing [his]3284-he tablets , then halted in front of the clepsydra . “ What said [that star - gazer]5955-that star - gazer about the twelfth hour ? ”[3284-he] [he]3284-he asked . “ Walls have ears , nothing is said that does not reach [me]3284-he . So , [old Saturn]410-saturn , with [thy]410-saturn scythe , dost [thou]410-saturn threaten ? Then [I]3284-he defy [thee]410-saturn — ha ! [I]3284-he saw the storm was coming up over [Rome]13-rome . ”[3284-he] A long - drawn growl of thunder muttered through [the passages of [the palace]620-the palace]3286-the passages of the palace . “ [I]4158-the prince saw no flash , ”[4158-the prince] said [the prince]4158-the prince , “ yet lightning falls somewhere , maybe to kindle the pyre on which [that sorcerer]5956-that sorcerer will burn ; [I]4158-the prince care not . Fire of heaven fall and strike where and whom [thou]410-saturn wilt ! ”[4158-the prince] [He]4158-the prince went again to the window and looked forth . The air was still and close . The sky was enveloped in vapor and not a star could be seen . A continuous quiver of electric light ran along the horizon . Then the heavens seemed to be rent asunder and a blaze of lightning shot forth , blinding to the eyes . [Domitian]224-domitian turned away , and laid the tablets on the marble sideboard as [he]3284-he pressed [his]3284-he hands to [his]3284-he eyeballs . “ By [the Gods]3756-the gods ! ”[3284-he] [he]3284-he exclaimed a moment later , “ here comes the rain ; it descends in cataracts ; it falls with a roar . ”[3284-he] [He]3284-he paced [the room]1883-the room , halted , stood in front of [the clepsydra]3290-the clepsydra and looked at the dropping water . The water had been reddened , and it seemed like blood sweated out of the silver globe . At that moment the wheel revolved , and sent a crimson gush into the receiver . With a jerk [Saturn]410-saturn raised [his]410-saturn scythe and indicated the hour ten . [The Emperor]1035-the emperor turned away , and came in front of [Domitia]191-domitia . “ [None]3936-none have ever loved [me]1035-the emperor , ”[1035-the emperor] [he]1035-the emperor said bitterly , “ how then can it be expected that [I]1035-the emperor shall love any ? [[my]1035-the emperor father]3834-my father disliked [me]1035-the emperor , [[my]1035-the emperor brother]4617-my brother distrusted [me]1035-the emperor — and [you]191-domitia — [[my]1035-the emperor wife]5281-my wife , have ever hated [me]1035-the emperor . [I]1035-the emperor need not ask the cause of that . It is [Lamia]219-lamia , always [Lamia]219-lamia . Because [he]1035-the emperor has never married [you]191-domitia think [he]1035-the emperor still harbors love for [you]191-domitia ; and [you]191-domitia — [you]191-domitia hate [me]1035-the emperor because of [him]1035-the emperor . It is hard to be [a prince]5277-a prince , and to be alone . If [I]1035-the emperor hear a play — [I]1035-the emperor think [I]1035-the emperor catch allusions to [me]1035-the emperor ; if it be a comedy — there is a jest aimed at [me]1035-the emperor ; if a tragedy , it expresses what [men]3873-men wish may befall [me]1035-the emperor . If [I]1035-the emperor read [a historian]5964-a historian , [he]5964-a historian declaims on the glories of [a commonwealth]5965-a commonwealth before [these men]5145-these men , [these Cæsars]5967-these cæsars became [tyrants]5968-tyrants , and as for [[your]191-domitia philosophers]5969-your philosophers — away with [them]5969-your philosophers , [they]5969-your philosophers are wind - bags , but the wind is poisonous , it is malarious to [me]1035-the emperor . When [I]1035-the emperor am at [the circus]2746-the circus , because [I]1035-the emperor back green — [you]191-domitia , [the entire hoop of [spectators]1710-spectators]5971-the entire hoop of spectators cheer , bet on the blue — to show [me]1035-the emperor that [they]1710-spectators hate [me]1035-the emperor . At [the Amphitheatre]2745-the amphitheatre , if [I]1035-the emperor favor the big shields , then every one else is for the small targets . [A prince]5277-a prince is ever [the most solitary of [men]3873-men]5975-the most solitary of men . If [you]191-domitia had protested that [you]191-domitia loved [me]1035-the emperor , had fondled [me]1035-the emperor , [I]1035-the emperor would have held [you]191-domitia in suspicion , mistrusted [your]191-domitia every word and look and gesture . Perhaps it is because that [you]191-domitia have never given [me]1035-the emperor good word , gentle look , and gesture of respect that [I]1035-the emperor feel [you]191-domitia are true — cruelly true , and [I]1035-the emperor have loved [you]191-domitia as [the only true person [I]1035-the emperor know]5977-the only true person i know . Now answer [me]1035-the emperor — [you]191-domitia asked after [my]1035-the emperor death ? ”[1035-the emperor] “ Yes , ”[191-domitia] answered [Domitia]191-domitia . “ [I]191-domitia knew it . ”[191-domitia] “ And , ”[191-domitia] said [she]191-domitia , in cold , hard tones , looking straight into [his]3292-his agitated , twitching countenance , “ [I]191-domitia bear to [you]3292-his a message . ”[191-domitia] “ From whom ? ”[191-domitia] “ From [Cornelia]230-cornelia , [the Great Mother]5617-the great mother . ”[191-domitia] “ Well , and what — — ”[3292-his] [he]3292-his stopped , [some one]4638-some one approached the door . “ What would [you]191-domitia have ? ”[4638-some one] [The mime Latinus]3294-the mime latinus appeared . “ Well — speak . ”[3294-the mime latinus] “ [Sire]415-sire , the rain extinguished the pyre , before that [the astrologer]2160-the astrologer was much burnt ; then the dogs fell on [him]2160-the astrologer , as [he]2160-the astrologer was unbound , and [they]5980-they tore [him]2160-the astrologer and [he]2160-the astrologer is dead . ”[3292-his] “ [Ye]5981-ye Gods ! ”[224-domitian] gasped [Domitian]224-domitian , putting up [his]224-domitian hand . “ [His]2160-the astrologer word has come true after all . ”[224-domitian] [Domitia]191-domitia signed to [the actor]4676-the actor to withdraw . “ [You]3292-his have not heard the message of [Cornelia]230-cornelia . ”[3292-his] [He]3292-his did not speak . “ [She]230-cornelia has summoned [you]224-domitian , [the Augustus]4126-the augustus , [the Chief Pontiff]3211-the chief pontiff , [the unjust Judge]5984-the unjust judge , to answer before [the All - righteous Supreme Justice]5985-the all - righteous supreme justice , above — before the scythe points to [Twelve]265-the immortal twelve . ”[3292-his] [Domitian]224-domitian answered not a word , [he]3292-his threw [his]3292-his mantle about [his]3292-his face and left [the room]1883-the room . [He]3292-his had left [his]3292-his tablets on the table . For some moments [Domitia]191-domitia remained without stirring . But then , roused by a glare of lightning , succeeded by a crash so loud as to shake [the palace]620-the palace , [she]191-domitia saw in the white blaze the tablets of [the Emperor]1035-the emperor lying on the table . At once , aware of the importance of what [she]191-domitia had secured , [she]191-domitia seized them , and went to the lamp to open them . They consisted of thin citron - wood boards , framed and hinged on one side , the surfaces within covered with a film of wax , on which notes were inscribed with a stile or iron pen . There were stray leaves that served for correspondence , orders and so forth , but what [Domitia]191-domitia now held was a diptych , that is to say , two leaves hinged , like a book - cover , which had included loose sheets and were bound together by strings . [She]191-domitia at once opened the diptych , and saw on the first page : — “ To be executed immediately : — In the Tullianum , by strangulation , [Lucius Ælius Lamia Plautius Ælianus]219-lamia . To be torn by dogs : — [The Chaldæan Elymas , otherwise called Ascletarion]5986-the chaldæan elymas , otherwise called ascletarion . ”[191-domitia] On the second leaf : “ To be executed on the morrow : — By decapitation : [Petronius Secundus]358-petronius , [Præfect of the Prætorium]5987-præfect of the prætorium . [Norbanus]416-norbanus , likewise [Præfect of the Prætorium]5987-præfect of the prætorium . By strangling , in the Tullianum : [Parthenius]417-parthenius and [Sigerius]418-sigerius , [Chamberlains of [the Palace]620-the palace]5989-chamberlains of the palace . To be bled to death : [Stephanus]419-stephanus : [steward]5991-steward to [[my]191-domitia niece]5992-my niece [Domitilla]333-domitilla . [Entellus]420-entellus : [Secretary a libellis]5993-secretary a libellis . ”[191-domitia] The words applying to [Lamia]219-lamia acted on [her]191-domitia as a blow against [her]191-domitia heart . [She]191-domitia staggered to a stool , sank on it and struggled for breath . But the urgency of the danger allowed no delay — [she]191-domitia rallied [her]191-domitia strength immediately , flew from [the room]1883-the room and summoned [Eboracus]193-eboracus . To [him]193-eboracus , breathless , [she]191-domitia said : “ [Fly]421-fly — summon [me]191-domitia at once [Stephanus]419-stephanus [the steward]491-the steward , [Petronius]358-petronius and [Norbanus]416-norbanus , [præfects]5995-præfects , and [the chamberlains Parthenius]5996-the chamberlains parthenius and [Sigerius]418-sigerius . Bid [them]5996-the chamberlains parthenius come to [me]191-domitia at once — not make a moment ’s delay . ”[191-domitia] [She]191-domitia sank again on the stool and put [her]191-domitia hands to [her]191-domitia temples and pressed them . The lightning continued to flare and the thunder to roll . There ensued a turmoil , and a sound of voices crying ; then a rush of feet . [Euphrosyne]268-euphrosyne entered with startled mien—“My [mistress]3718-mistress ! The bolt of heaven has fallen on [the Palatine]1547-the palatine , and [the chamber of [the Augustus]4126-the augustus]5999-the chamber of the augustus has been struck . [The Temple of the Flavians]6001-the temple of the flavians is on fire , and is burning in despite of the rain . ”[3300-the chamberlain] [The chamberlain]3300-the chamberlain , [Parthenius]417-parthenius , entered . “ [Augusta]350-augusta ! ”[417-parthenius] said [he]417-parthenius , “ the lightning has struck [that part of [the palace occupied by [Cæsar]224-domitian]6003-the palace occupied by cæsar]6002-that part of the palace occupied by cæsar . [He]224-domitian must have [[his]224-domitian apartment]6004-his apartment for the night on this side . ”[417-parthenius] “ That is well , ”[191-domitia] answered [Domitia]191-domitia . “ [Parthenius]417-parthenius , have [you]417-parthenius received [my]191-domitia message from [Eboracus]193-eboracus ? ”[191-domitia] “ No , [lady]3723-lady . ”[417-parthenius] “ Then read this , ”[191-domitia] [she]191-domitia extended to [him]417-parthenius the wax tablets . [The chamberlain]3300-the chamberlain turned ash gray and trembled . “ [Parthenius]417-parthenius , ”[191-domitia] said [Domitia]191-domitia , “ it is no vain augury that lightning has struck [the Temple of the Flavians]6001-the temple of the flavians , and driven [Cæsar]224-domitian from [[his]224-domitian apartments]6007-his apartments . Let [his]224-domitian place of rest be to - night in [the room adjoining this —]6008-the room adjoining this — and — if [he]224-domitian wakes — ”[191-domitia] [she]191-domitia looked at the clepsydra , as at that moment with a click the wheel turned and [Saturn]410-saturn moved [his]410-saturn scythe—“there is but an hour in which the fate of more than [yourself]417-parthenius , of [Lamia]219-lamia — of [Entellus]420-entellus must be decided . Take the tablets . ”[191-domitia] [Scarce]422-scarce had [she]191-domitia spoken , before quick steps were heard , and in a moment [Domitian]224-domitian entered . [Parthenius]417-parthenius hastily concealed the tablets by throwing a fold of [his]417-parthenius garment over the hand that held them . “ [Sire]4218-sire , ”[417-parthenius] said [he]417-parthenius , “ [I]417-parthenius have come to announce that [[thy]4218-sire chamber]6010-thy chamber must be on this side . ”[417-parthenius] “ Go [thy]4218-sire way , ”[224-domitian] said [Domitian]224-domitian roughly , “ see to it that [I]224-domitian have a bed brought at once . Hast heard , [Domitia]191-domitia , the fire has fallen ! ”[224-domitian] “ [Sire]4218-sire , ”[417-parthenius] said [Parthenius]417-parthenius , “ [I]417-parthenius haste to obey and pray [the Gods]3756-the gods that in spite of thunder and lightning [you]4218-sire may sleep sound and not wake . ”[417-parthenius] [The Emperor]1035-the emperor walked to the clepsydra , and laughed scornfully . “ The bolt of [Jove]354-jove has missed [me]1035-the emperor , ”[1035-the emperor] said [he]1035-the emperor . “ [The red - handed One]6013-the red - handed one made a mistake . [I]1035-the emperor am wo nt to be in bed at this hour — by good luck , this night [I]1035-the emperor was not . [He]6013-the red - handed one has levelled [his]6013-the red - handed one bolt at [my]1035-the emperor pillow and burnt that — [I]1035-the emperor am escaped scot - free . Now [I]1035-the emperor have no further fear . ”[1035-the emperor] “ [The temple of [[your]1035-the emperor divine family]6015-your divine family]6014-the temple of your divine family is in flames . ”[224-domitian] “ What care [I]3303-he ? [I]3303-he will rebuild [it]6014-the temple of your divine family — [the majesty]6016-the majesty , the divinity of [the Flavians]352-the flavians resides not in stones and marble — it is incorporate in [Me]3303-he . [I]3303-he may have been in danger for a moment . Now [I]3303-he snap [my]3303-he fingers in the face of [that blunderer Jove , who burnt a hole in [my]3303-he pillow instead of transfixing [my]3303-he head]6017-that blunderer jove , who burnt a hole in my pillow instead of transfixing my head . And yon [old Chronos]423-old chronos — ”[3303-he] [he]3303-he made a sign of contempt towards [scythed Time]424-scythed time , “ [I]3303-he defy [thee]423-old chronos and [thy]423-old chronos bucket of blood . Twelve o’clock ! In spite of [Jove]354-jove ’s bolt , and the summons of [Cornelia]230-cornelia — [I]3303-he shall be asleep by that hour . ”[3303-he] “ [I]3303-he pray [the Gods]198-the gods it may be so . ”[3303-he] Then [Domitian]224-domitian went out precipitately . [His]224-domitian defiant attitude , [his]224-domitian daring talk did not serve to disguise the alarm which [he]224-domitian felt . Suddenly , after having left [the room]1883-the room [he]3303-he turned , came back and said , “ [Domitia]191-domitia ! What sword is that ? What need has [a woman with a sword]6018-a woman with a sword ? ”[3303-he] [He]3303-he pointed to that of [Corbulo]204-corbulo , suspended against the wall . [He]3303-he went to it and took it down . “ Leave it , ”[3305-she] said [she]3305-she harshly . “ It is that on which [[my]3303-he father]3834-my father fell . It is stained likewise with the blood of [Nero]212-nero . ”[3303-he] [He]3303-he held it by the scabbard . [She]3305-she caught the handle and , as [he]3303-he turned , drew forth the blade . At the same moment [he]3303-he heard steps in [the passage]1245-the passage approaching the door , and without noticing that [he]3303-he held but the sheath , or else purposing to demand the weapon itself later , when the interruption was over , [he]3303-he walked towards the entrance uttering an expression of impatience , holding the empty scabbard in [his]3303-he right hand . In the doorway stood [Stephanus]419-stephanus , [a freedman]483-a freedman , [the steward of Flavia Domitilla , [wife]3875-wife , or rather widow of [Clemens]294-clemens , whom [Domitian]224-domitian had recently put to death]3308-the steward of flavia domitilla , wife , or rather widow of clemens , whom domitian had recently put to death . [Domitilla]333-domitilla had been exiled , and [the Emperor]1035-the emperor had appropriated to [his]1035-the emperor own use [the estates of [[his]1035-the emperor kinsman]2426-his kinsman]3311-the estates of his kinsman . “ Why camest [thou]6020-thy hither ? ”[4158-the prince] asked [the prince]4158-the prince roughly . “ [I]4158-the prince shall have enough to say to [thee]6020-thy on the morrow because of [thy]6020-thy embezzlements . ”[4158-the prince] “ [Augustus]218-augustus ! [I]4158-the prince am innocent . ”[4158-the prince] “ [A thief]6021-a thief , [a vile purloiner , a blood - sucking leech]6022-a vile purloiner , a blood - sucking leech , that has fattened as do all [thy]6020-thy kind on [[thy]6020-thy masters]6023-thy masters . Go [thy]6020-thy way — [I]4158-the prince want [thee]6020-thy not here . ”[4158-the prince] And striding towards [him]1035-the emperor , with [Corbulo]204-corbulo ’s scabbard [he]4158-the prince struck [the freedman]489-the freedman across the face . [Stephanus]419-stephanus uttered a cry of rage and pain , and instantly smote at [the Emperor]1035-the emperor with a dagger [he]419-stephanus had held concealed in [his]419-stephanus sleeve . “ What , [hound]6024-hound ! [You]6024-hound dare ! [You]6024-hound shall be flayed alive ! Ho ! to [my]419-stephanus aid ! ”[419-stephanus] [Stephanus]419-stephanus threw [himself]419-stephanus on [the Emperor]1035-the emperor . Then [Domitia]191-domitia stepped between [the struggling men]3317-the struggling men and the doorway , and with one hand drew together the curtains so as to muffle the cries . “ To [my]224-domitian aid ! to [my]224-domitian aid ! ”[224-domitian] called [Domitian]224-domitian , as [the powerful steward]3318-the powerful steward grappled [him]224-domitian , and struck [his]224-domitian dagger into the thigh of [the prince]4158-the prince . “ To [my]1035-the emperor aid ! Ho , a sword ! ”[1035-the emperor] shouted [the Emperor]1035-the emperor , and [he]1035-the emperor grasped the weapon of [the steward]491-the steward but so that , holding the blade with [his]1035-the emperor hand , the weapon cut it across and the blood streamed forth . [He]1035-the emperor now made an effort to reach the doorway ; and [the steward]491-the steward , holding [him]1035-the emperor , strove to wrench away the dagger and inflict a mortal wound . But [Domitian]224-domitian , aware of [his]1035-the emperor object , with [his]224-domitian bleeding hand retained [his]224-domitian grasp of the blade . All at once , [the Emperor]1035-the emperor let go [his]1035-the emperor hold , and seizing [the steward]491-the steward by the head drove [his]1035-the emperor thumbs into [his]1035-the emperor eyes . [Stephanus]419-stephanus instantly dropped the dagger in [his]419-stephanus attempt to save [himself]419-stephanus from being blinded . [The two men]3325-the two men twisted and writhed in grapple with [each other]598-each other . [The freedman]489-the freedman was [a powerful man]3328-a powerful man — it was for this reason [he]489-the freedman had been sent to despatch [the prince]4158-the prince . But [Domitian]224-domitian was battling for [his]224-domitian life . Though [his]224-domitian legs were thin and out of proportion to [his]224-domitian body , [he]224-domitian was [a strong man]3330-a strong man — [he]224-domitian had ever maintained [his]224-domitian vigor by exercise of the muscles and had never weakened [himself]224-domitian by excess in eating and drinking . By a happy turn [he]224-domitian flung [Stephanus]419-stephanus , but clasped by [him]224-domitian fell with [him]224-domitian on the floor . And now [the two men]3325-the two men rolled and tossed in a tangled mass together . [Their]3325-the two men snorts and gasps and the bestial growl of rage filled [the room]1883-the room . “ Quick ! [Domitia]191-domitia — the sword ! At once — the sword — the sword ! ”[1035-the emperor] said [the Emperor]1035-the emperor . [He]1035-the emperor spoke in gulps and gasps . [He]1035-the emperor had [Stephanus]419-stephanus under [him]1035-the emperor ; [his]224-domitian knee was on [his]224-domitian chest and [his]224-domitian hand , the gashed left hand flowing with blood , contracted [the prostrate man]3334-the prostrate man ’s throat . “ [Domitia]191-domitia ! the sword ! ”[3335-she] But [she]3335-she stood , stern , cold , without stirring a step , and [she]3335-she folded the sword of [[her]3335-she father]3788-her father to [her]3335-she breast , with [her]3335-she arms crossed over it . “ Because of [Paris]308-paris — No ! ”[3335-she] “ The sword ! be speedy . [I]3335-she will finish [him]3334-the prostrate man ! ”[3335-she] “ Because of [Cornelia]230-cornelia — No ! ”[3335-she] “ [Domitia]191-domitia — help ! ”[3335-she] “ Because of [Lucius Lamia]219-lamia — No ! ”[3335-she] [She]3335-she went to the curtains , drew them apart , and called down [the passage]1245-the passage to [Norbanus]416-norbanus . [The two Prætorian præfects]3338-the two prætorian præfects were there with [the chamberlains]3339-the chamberlains — but [they]3338-the two prætorian præfects were ill able to restrain [the guard who suspected that [[their]3338-the two prætorian præfects prince]3341-their prince and [Emperor]4822-emperor was in danger and scented treachery]3340-the guard who suspected that their prince and emperor was in danger and scented treachery . Instantly a rush was made . [Some of [the soldiers]4026-the soldiers]3343-some of the soldiers , with [the præfect Norbanus]3345-the præfect norbanus , came on running , whilst the other , [Petronius Secundus]358-petronius , endeavored by [his]358-petronius authority to restrain [the rest]4161-the rest . But from the other end of [the passage]1245-the passage came [gladiators]4981-gladiators running , hastily brought together by [Parthenius]417-parthenius . For a moment there was a jam in the doorway , [a burly gladiator]3349-a burly gladiator and [a soldier of the guard]3350-a soldier of the guard were wedged together , each endeavoring to hold the other back and force [himself]3349-a burly gladiator in . Meanwhile [Petronius]358-petronius continued to exhort [[his]358-petronius soldiers]3351-his soldiers to stand back , and [Parthenius]417-parthenius to promise rewards to [the gladiators who pressed on]3352-the gladiators who pressed on . The tumult became terrible . [Men]3873-men came to blows without , there was a running together of [slaves]589-slaves and [freedmen]844-freedmen — of [frightened women]3356-frightened women and [pages from all sides]3357-pages from all sides . [Some]760-some had leaped from [their]760-some beds , roused from sleep , and were not clothed . [Some]760-some bore lamps — but again [certain others]3360-certain others attempted to extinguish the lights . [Some]760-some cried “ Treason ! ”[760-some] Others “ Away with the monster ! ”[760-some] [Some]760-some called out “ [Nerva]425-nerva is [the Emperor]1035-the emperor ! ”[760-some] others “ [Domitian]224-domitian is [the Augustus]4126-the augustus ! ”[3363-the gladiator at the door] Then [the gladiator at the door]3363-the gladiator at the door , by dint of elbowing , forced [his]3363-the gladiator at the door way within , but [he]3363-the gladiator at the door was unarmed . Next moment [the Prætorian guardsman held back by the gladiator]3364-the prætorian guardsman held back by the gladiator entered and struck at [Stephanus]419-stephanus , dealing a frightful blow . Relieved by this assistance , [Domitian]224-domitian staggered to [his]224-domitian feet and glared about [him]224-domitian . [He]224-domitian was too much out of breath to speak , and in at the door came others pressing , some crying one thing , some another . Then [Domitia]191-domitia unfolded [her]191-domitia arms , and taking the sword of [Corbulo]204-corbulo in [her]191-domitia right hand , extended it to [the gladiator]3365-the gladiator and said—“Make an end . ”[4042-the man] [The man]4042-the man snatched at the haft ; and with a blow drove the blade into the breast of [the Emperor]1035-the emperor . Still [the prince]4158-the prince remained standing , and stretched forth [his]4158-the prince hands gropingly for a weapon . [Parmenas]426-parmenas leaped at [him]4158-the prince , and with a knife struck [him]4158-the prince in the throat . Then [he]4158-the prince reeled ; in another moment [he]4158-the prince was surrounded , blows from all sides were rained on [him]4158-the prince . Again the sword of [Corbulo]204-corbulo was lifted and again smote , and [he]4158-the prince fell as a heap on the body of [Stephanus]419-stephanus . For a moment there was stillness . Then in that hush sounded a click and a gush . The bucket of the clepsydra had discharged , and with a jerk [Saturn]410-saturn raised [his]410-saturn scythe and pointed to the hour of midnight . “ [He]410-saturn has answered [his]410-saturn summons before [the seat of [Divine Justice]427-divine justice]6027-the seat of divine justice ! ”[191-domitia] said [Domitia]191-domitia . [She]191-domitia stooped and plucked the signet ring from the finger of [the murdered prince]3369-the murdered prince . No sooner had [Domitia]191-domitia got the signet from the finger of [the dead Emperor]3370-the dead emperor , than [she]191-domitia hastened from [the room]1883-the room , trembling , almost blind as to [her]191-domitia course , but armed with more than [her]191-domitia natural strength to force [her]191-domitia way through [those who filled the passage]3372-those who filled the passage . [Parmenas]426-parmenas was now there , and [he]426-parmenas cleared a way for [her]191-domitia , and in a loud voice forbade [any of [the slaves]494-the slaves]3373-any of the slaves to leave [the palace]620-the palace ; [Petronius]358-petronius at the same time gave orders to [the soldiers of [the guard]3912-the guard]3376-the soldiers of the guard to remain where [they]3376-the soldiers of the guard were , keeping watch that [none left to spread the tidings]3378-none left to spread the tidings , until [Cocceius Nerva]425-nerva had been communicated with , and [the Senate]4140-the senate had been summoned . [Domitia]191-domitia , however , made [her]191-domitia way from among [the excited and alarmed throng]3380-the excited and alarmed throng , and finding [some of [[her]191-domitia own slaves]3382-her own slaves]3381-some of her own slaves , bade [them]3381-some of her own slaves bring [Eboracus]193-eboracus to [her]191-domitia . “ [I]3825-the briton am here , [lady]3723-lady , ”[3825-the briton] answered [the Briton]3825-the briton . “ Then quick — with [me]3825-the briton . Not a moment is to be lost . Light a torch and lead the way . ”[3825-the briton] “ Whither , [mistress]3718-mistress ? ”[193-eboracus] “ To [the Tullianum]428-the tullianum . ”[193-eboracus] [He]193-eboracus stared at [her]191-domitia in amazement . “ Quick — a life , a precious life is at stake . Not a minute must [we]6030-we delay or it will be too late . ”[193-eboracus] “ [I]193-eboracus am ready , [lady]3723-lady . ”[193-eboracus] [He]193-eboracus snatched a torch from [an attendant]3384-an attendant , and advanced towards a postern gate that communicated with a flight of steps leading to [the Forum]4222-the forum . It was employed almost wholly by [the servants]1480-the servants and was used for communication between [the kitchen]5066-the kitchen and [the markets]3388-the markets . “ Shall [we]6030-we take [any one else]6032-any one else with [us]6030-we ? ”[193-eboracus] asked [Eboracus]193-eboracus . [He]193-eboracus answered himself—“Yes — here is [Euphrosyne]268-euphrosyne . [She]268-euphrosyne shall attend , and [a boy]1847-a boy shall carry the link . At night — and on such a night , [I]193-eboracus must have both arms at [my]193-eboracus disposal . ”[193-eboracus] [Domitia]191-domitia said nothing . [She]191-domitia was eager to be on [her]191-domitia way , was impatient of the smallest delay . [Euphrosyne]268-euphrosyne came up , and obeyed a sign from [the Briton]3825-the briton . [He]193-eboracus caught [a scullion who was rubbing [his]3390-a scullion who was rubbing his sleepy eyes , and wondering what had caused the commotion , and had roused him from his bed sleepy eyes , and wondering what had caused the commotion , and had roused [him]3390-a scullion who was rubbing his sleepy eyes , and wondering what had caused the commotion , and had roused him from his bed from [his]3390-a scullion who was rubbing his sleepy eyes , and wondering what had caused the commotion , and had roused him from his bed bed]3390-a scullion who was rubbing his sleepy eyes , and wondering what had caused the commotion , and had roused him from his bed . [Eboracus]193-eboracus thrust the torch into [his]193-eboracus hand and opened the door for [the Empress]2875-the empress . [Domitia]191-domitia stepped out to the head of [the stairs]3392-the stairs . The rain had ceased , but the steps were running with water . The eaves dripped . The shrubs were laden with rain , [they]3393-their stooped [their]3393-their boughs and shed a load of moisture on the soil , then raised [their]3393-their leaves again , once more to accumulate the wet , and again to stoop and shower it down . Runnels conveying water from the roof were flowing as streams , noisily : the ground covered with pools , reflected the torch ; as also every gleam from the retiring storm . Still in the distance thunder muttered , but it was a grumble of discontent at having failed to achieve all it had been sent to execute . On such a night [few]3394-few would be abroad , except [the patrols of [the Vigiles]5479-the vigiles]3395-the patrols of the vigiles and [them]3394-few there would be no difficulty in passing as the watchword was known to [Eboracus]193-eboracus , the word which allowed [those only who could say it to traverse [the streets]1075-the streets at night in [the respectable portions of [the city]3846-the city]3399-the respectable portions of the city]3397-those only who could say it to traverse the streets at night in the respectable portions of the city . But there were no lamps , not even the feeble glimmer of a lantern slung in the midst of [the street]1645-the street . Notwithstanding all the civili zation of ancient [Rome]13-rome the art of lighting [the thoroughfares]2703-the thoroughfares at night was unknown . [Such as were constrained to walk abroad after dark]3403-such as were constrained to walk abroad after dark were attended by [slaves bearing torches]3404-slaves bearing torches . [The streets of [Rome]13-rome]1818-the streets of rome had for long been of bad repute for the brawls and murders committed in [them]1818-the streets of rome at night . [Tipsy youths and rufflers]3406-tipsy youths and rufflers had assaulted [honest men]5361-honest men , and should [a woman]3962-a woman be out after dark , [she]3962-a woman was certain of insult . [Nero]212-nero [himself]212-nero had distinguished [himself]212-nero in such vulgar performances . But under [the Flavian princes]3409-the flavian princes much had been done to establish order and to ensure protection to life and purse of such as were out after dark , so that now , except in [the slums]3410-the slums , [a citizen]3411-a citizen could visit [[his]3411-a citizen friends]1817-his friends , [a doctor [[his]3411-a citizen patients]3414-his patients]3413-a doctor his patients , by night , without fear of molestation . And of [all portions of [Rome]13-rome]3415-all portions of rome , [the Forum]4222-the forum with [its]4222-the forum splendid monuments , [[its]4222-the forum rich temples]3417-its rich temples , especially that of [Saturn]410-saturn , that contained the city treasures , was most patrolled and therefore the safest . [Eboracus]193-eboracus had little expectation that [[his]193-eboracus mistress]1727-his mistress would meet with rudeness or encounter danger , the rain must have swept [the street]1645-the street of [all idlers]3420-all idlers . The long flight of steps was descended with caution , as they were slippery with rain , indeed with more caution than [Domitia]191-domitia approved , so impatient was [she]1727-his mistress to reach the object of [her]1727-his mistress journey . The distance was not great . [She]1727-his mistress had but to traverse [the upper end of [the Forum]4222-the forum]3421-the upper end of the forum . That at which [she]1727-his mistress aimed was [the prison of [Rome]13-rome]3423-the prison of rome . It lay at [the foot of [the Capitoline Hill]3425-the capitoline hill]3424-the foot of the capitoline hill , and consisted of an ancient well or subterranean chamber in which flowed a small spring . Above this was [the prison]3426-the prison , consisting of a series of cells that rose in stages to a considerable height , against the rock , the chambers being in part scooped out of the travestine . From the top of [the hill]1647-the hill ran a set of steps called [the Gemonian stair]4907-the gemonian stair , and it was customary for [State prisoners who had been condemned to death , after execution]3429-state prisoners who had been condemned to death , after execution to be cast from [the upper chamber of the Tullianum down the stairs]3430-the upper chamber of the tullianum down the stairs ; whence with hooks the corpses were dragged across [the Forum]4222-the forum and then flung into the Tiber . To [the house of [the jailer]3433-the jailer]3432-the house of the jailer , [Domitia]191-domitia with [[her]191-domitia attendants]3101-her attendants made [her]191-domitia way . [She]191-domitia had been stopped once in crossing [the Forum]4222-the forum , but [the watch]3436-the watch recognized [her]191-domitia , and saluted with respect , though with an expression of astonishment on [his]3436-the watch countenance at seeing [[Cæsar]224-domitian ’s wife]3437-cæsar ’s wife abroad at such a time of the night , in such weather and with such scant attendance . On reaching [the jailer]3433-the jailer ’s door , [Eboracus]193-eboracus knocked . No answer was given . [He]193-eboracus knocked again and louder , and continued knocking , till at length [a gruff voice from within]3439-a gruff voice from within called to know who was without , and what was wanted . “ Open — in the name of [the Augustus]4126-the augustus , ”[1760-the british slave] said [the British slave]1760-the british slave ; and at once [the keeper of [the prison]3426-the prison]3441-the keeper of the prison let down the bars and withdrew the bolts and chains , then carrying a lamp , peered out at [those who demanded admittance]3443-those who demanded admittance . Then [Domitia]191-domitia stood forward . “ [You]3433-the jailer have [a prisoner]6035-a prisoner here — [Lucius Ælius Lamia]219-lamia ? ”[191-domitia] “ Yes . ”[191-domitia] “ [You]3433-the jailer must lead [me]3433-the jailer to [him]6035-a prisoner . ”[3433-the jailer] [The jailer]3433-the jailer appeared disconcerted , [he]3433-the jailer held [his]3433-the jailer lamp aloft and eyed [the woman who spake]3445-the woman who spake . [He]3433-the jailer did not know [her]3445-the woman who spake , [his]3433-the jailer light was feeble , and as it happened , [he]3433-the jailer had seen little of [the Empress]2875-the empress . “ [You]3433-the jailer do not know [me]191-domitia , ”[191-domitia] said [Domitia]191-domitia . “ Know [you]3433-the jailer this ring ? ”[191-domitia] [The prison - keeper]3447-the prison - keeper held the flame of [his]3447-the prison - keeper lamp to the signet , and made the usual sign of respect and recognition . “ [You]3433-the jailer are required to lead [me]191-domitia within , ”[191-domitia] said [Domitia]191-domitia . [The jailer]3433-the jailer at once stood aside , and suffered [the Empress]2875-the empress and [[her]2875-the empress attendants]3101-her attendants to enter . Then [he]3433-the jailer barred and bolted the door again . “ And now , ”[191-domitia] said [Domitia]191-domitia , impatient at the leisurely proceeding of [the man]4042-the man , “ lead [me]191-domitia to [him]4042-the man . ”[191-domitia] Without another word [he]3433-the jailer went forward , holding [his]3433-the jailer lamp down that [those who followed]1263-those who followed might see the steps and not stumble at [them]3453-them . “ This way , ”[3433-the jailer] said [he]3433-the jailer , “ and bow [your]3433-the jailer heads , the entrance is low ; but [most of [them]1263-those who followed that pass this way]6036-most of them that pass this way have to hold [their]6036-most of them that pass this way heads still lower when [they]6036-most of them that pass this way are taken out . Look at these stones — great blocks built by [the Kings]1163-the kings — by [Servius Tullus]429-servius tullus , [they]1163-the kings say . By [Hercules]220-hercules ! this is not [a tavern where [men]3873-men tarry long , nor do [they]3873-men relish [our]3873-men fare]6038-a tavern where men tarry long , nor do they relish our fare . One thing [I]3433-the jailer must say in [our]3873-men favor , [we]3873-men make no charge for [our]3873-men hospitality . ”[3433-the jailer] Thus [the jailer]3433-the jailer muttered as [he]3433-the jailer went along . “ Look there — on [your]3433-the jailer right — there is [the cell where [Simon Bar Gioras]430-simon bar gioras , [the Jew]6041-the jew , was strangled]6040-the cell where simon bar gioras , the jew , was strangled — [[he]430-simon bar gioras who was the last to maintain the struggle against [the God Titus]180-titus , in defence of [Jerusalem]150-jerusalem]6042-he who was the last to maintain the struggle against the god titus , in defence of jerusalem ; and see — ”[3433-the jailer] [he]3433-the jailer threw open a door . “ Here is [the Bath of [Mamertius]174-mamertius in which [Jugurtha]431-jugurtha was starved]6043-the bath of mamertius in which jugurtha was starved , all in blackness of darkness and soaking in ice - cold water . What ! Impatient — do [you]3433-the jailer not care to see the sights and hear [my]3455-i gossip ? Well , well — but [I]3455-i have pretty things to show . [I]3455-i have a shankbone of [Appius Claudius]432-appius claudius , who committed suicide in [yon cell]6044-yon cell , and a garment of [Sejanus]433-sejanus , and the very bowstring wherewith — [I]3455-i am going on as fast as may be . See ! [we]6045-we have had [Christians]2508-christians [here]3736-here also . There was [another Jew]6048-another jew , [Simon Petrus]434-simon petrus by name , [he]6048-another jew was in [this cell]6049-this cell , and [I]3455-i have the chain whereby [he]6048-another jew was bound , and [I]3455-i sell the links to [the followers of [the Nazarene]6051-the nazarene]6050-the followers of the nazarene , ”[3455-i] [he]3455-i began to cackle . “ By [Hercules]220-hercules ! the chain is long enough . [They]6050-the followers of the nazarene come for more links than there would be , were the chain to reach across [the Tiber]107-the tiber . But any bit of old iron will serve , and [they]6050-the followers of the nazarene are not particular — take any scrap and pay in silver . [I]3455-i am going as fast as may be . [I]3455-i am not young . Fast enough [I]3455-i warrant . [He]6048-another jew is in no hurry — not [Lamia]219-lamia . [He]6048-another jew can wait . All the same to [him]6048-another jew whether [we]6052-we reach [him]6048-another jew now or an hour hence . ”[3455-i] Then [Domitia]191-domitia , whose brow was beaded with cold sweat , like the stones of [the vault that ran with moisture]3456-the vault that ran with moisture , laid hold of [the prison - keeper]3447-the prison - keeper ’s arm and said:—“Tell [me]191-domitia — is [he]6048-another jew — ”[191-domitia] [she]191-domitia could not say the word , [her]191-domitia heart beat so furiously , and everything swam before [her]191-domitia eyes . “ Aye , aye , [you]3447-the prison - keeper shall see for [yourself]3447-the prison - keeper . Come from [the Augustus]218-augustus to satisfy [him]6048-another jew that [we]6052-we do [our]6052-we work properly , [I]3458-he trow . [I]3458-he have not much strength in [these old - hands]6053-these old - hands , but [[my]3458-he two sons]6054-my two sons are lusty — and say the word — [they]6054-my two sons will bend [your]3447-the prison - keeper back and snap the spine , smite and shear off [your]3447-the prison - keeper head like a pumpkin under a scythe , twist , and the life is throttled out of [you]3447-the prison - keeper . Here — here [we]6052-we are . Go in and see for [yourself]3447-the prison - keeper that [we]6052-we are [good workmen]6055-good workmen . ”[3458-he] [He]3458-he threw open a door and raised [his]3458-he lamp . [A low vaulted chamber]3459-a low vaulted chamber was faintly illumined by the flame , the torch held by [Eboracus]193-eboracus was behind [Domitia]191-domitia and [the jailer]3433-the jailer ; [he]3458-he had taken it from [the link boy at the prison door]3461-the link boy at the prison door . [He]3458-he and [Euphrosyne]268-euphrosyne attended [[their]3462-their mistress]1794-their mistress , [the boy]3464-the boy was left without . [The old prison - keeper]3465-the old prison - keeper stood on one side . “ The order came yesterday , ”[3465-the old prison - keeper] said [he]3465-the old prison - keeper , “ and [we]6056-we are not slack in the execution . ”[3465-the old prison - keeper] [Domitia]191-domitia saw the figure of [a man lying on the stone floor]3466-a man lying on the stone floor . [She]191-domitia started forward — “ [He]3466-a man lying on the stone floor sleeps ! ”[191-domitia] “ [I]191-domitia warrant [you]3433-the jailer — right soundly . ”[191-domitia] [She]191-domitia uttered a smothered cry . “ Put down the lamp ! ”[191-domitia] [She]191-domitia turned and faced [the jailer]3433-the jailer . “ Leave [me]4042-the man alone with [him]3466-a man lying on the stone floor . [I]4042-the man will wake [him]3466-a man lying on the stone floor . [I]4042-the man know [he]3466-a man lying on the stone floor but sleeps . ”[4042-the man] [The man]4042-the man hesitated . Then [Eboracus]193-eboracus pressed forward and laid hold of [the jailer]3433-the jailer and whispered—“Go without , it is [the Augusta]5771-the augusta ! ”[193-eboracus] [The keeper of the prison]3441-the keeper of the prison started , raised [his]3441-the keeper of the prison hand to [his]3441-the keeper of the prison lips , bowed , set the lamp on the moist floor and drew back . “ Without ! Without all ! ”[191-domitia] ordered [Domitia]191-domitia . Then [Eboracus]193-eboracus pulled [the jailer]3433-the jailer out of [the cell]3472-the cell . [Euphrosyne]268-euphrosyne stood doubtful whether to remain with [[her]268-euphrosyne mistress]1316-her mistress or obey — but an impatient sign from [the Empress]2875-the empress drove [her]268-euphrosyne forth , and [the British slave]1760-the british slave closed the door . “ [He]3477-the old man is dead , ”[3433-the jailer] said [the jailer]3433-the jailer . “ Did [the Augustus]218-augustus desire to withdraw the order ? [His]218-augustus signet has arrived too late . [The prisoner]6058-the prisoner has been throttled by [[my]3433-the jailer sons]6059-my sons . ”[3433-the jailer] [The old man]3477-the old man and [the two slaves]3478-the two slaves remained for some quarter of an hour in [the passage]1245-the passage almost smothered by the smoke emitted by the torch . From within [they]3478-the two slaves heard a voice — at intervals , now raised in weeping , then uttering low soothing tones , then raised in a cry as the conclamatio of [hired wailers for the dead]3480-hired wailers for the dead , calling on [Lamia]219-lamia by name to return , to return , to leave [the Shadowland]175-the shadowland and come back into light . And then — a laugh . A laugh so weird , so horrible , so unexpected , that with a thrust , without scruple , [Eboracus]193-eboracus threw open the door . On the stone pavement sat [Domitia]191-domitia , [her]191-domitia hair dishevelled , and on [her]191-domitia lap the head of [the dead man]1157-the dead man . [She]191-domitia was wiping [his]1157-the dead man brow with [her]191-domitia veil , stooping , kissing [his]1157-the dead man lips , weeping , then laughing again — then pointing to purple letters , crossed L ’s woven into [his]1157-the dead man tunic . [Eboracus]193-eboracus saw it all — [her]191-domitia reason was gone . In [the old home of [Gabii]36-gabii]3482-the old home of gabii , under the tender care of [Euphrosyne]268-euphrosyne and in the soothing company of [Glyceria]309-glyceria , little by little , stage by stage , [Domitia]191-domitia recovered . There was a horrible past to which no reference might be made . [The true British slave]3483-the true british slave , [Eboracus]193-eboracus , was ever at hand to help — when needed . Never a day , never half a day , but [his]1157-the dead man honest face appeared at the door to inquire after [[his]1157-the dead man dear lady]3484-his dear lady , and as [her]3484-his dear lady senses came flickering back , it was [he]1157-the dead man to whom [she]3484-his dear lady clung to take [her]3484-his dear lady in [his]1157-the dead man arms into the trellised walk , or when stronger to lead [her]3484-his dear lady where [she]3484-his dear lady could pick violets for [Glyceria]309-glyceria , and to pile about the feet of the little statue of [the Good Shepherd]5032-the good shepherd . [He]1157-the dead man took [her]3484-his dear lady a row on [the lake]1111-the lake and let [her]3484-his dear lady fish — [he]1157-the dead man found nests of young birds and brought them to [her]3484-his dear lady ; and all at once disclosed great powers of story - telling ; [he]1157-the dead man told marvellous British tales as to [a little child]4356-a little child , of the ploughing of [Hu Cadarn]435-hu cadarn , of [Ceridwen]436-ceridwen and [[her]3484-his dear lady cauldron]3488-her cauldron . And [he]1157-the dead man would sing — [he]1157-the dead man fashioned [himself]1157-the dead man a harp , of British shape , and sang as [he]1157-the dead man accompanied [himself]1157-the dead man , but [his]1157-the dead man ballads were all in the Celtic tongue that [Domitia]191-domitia could not understand — nevertheless it soothed and pleased [her]191-domitia to listen to [his]1157-the dead man music . [Longa Duilia]181-duilia did not visit [her]191-domitia often . [She]181-duilia made formal duty calls at long intervals , and as [Domitia]191-domitia became better , these visits grew proportionately fewer . [Duilia]181-duilia , as [she]181-duilia [herself]181-duilia said , was not created to be [a nurse]3489-a nurse . [She]181-duilia knew that [some]760-some were fitted by nature to attend to [the sick]5014-the sick , and all that sort of thing — but it was not [her]181-duilia gift . Society was [her]181-duilia sphere in which [she]181-duilia floated and which [she]181-duilia adorned , but [she]181-duilia was distraught and drooping in [a sick - room]3492-a sick - room . [She]181-duilia wished [she]181-duilia had [the faculty]3493-the faculty — and all that sort of thing — but [all women]3494-all women were not cast in the same mould , run out of the same metal — and , [[my]0-i dear]4058-my dear , parenthetically — some are of lead , others of Corinthian brass — and which are which it is not for [me]0-i to say — [she]181-duilia thanked [the Gods]3756-the gods it was so . Nor did the visits and efforts to amuse , of [Duilia]181-duilia , avail anything towards [Domitia]191-domitia ’s cure . On the contrary , [she]181-duilia was always worse after [[her]181-duilia mother]519-her mother had been with [her]181-duilia . [The old lady]2217-the old lady ripped up ill - healed sores , harped on old associations , could not check [her]2217-the old lady tongue from scolding . “ [[My]2217-the old lady poor dear child]6060-my poor dear child — [I]2217-the old lady never made a greater blunder in [my]2217-the old lady life — [I]2217-the old lady , too , who have the pedigree at [my]2217-the old lady finger ’s ends — as to fancy that there was any connection with [those Flavians]6061-those flavians . [[My]2217-the old lady dear]4058-my dear ! yellow hair is quite out of fashion now , quite out . Look at [mine]0-i , a raven ’s wing is not darker . It was through [Vespasia Polla]293-vespasia polla — [I]2217-the old lady thought [we]6063-we were related — stupid that [I]2217-the old lady was — it was [the Vipsanians]6064-the vipsanians [we]6063-we were allied to , not [those low and beggarly [Vespasians]176-vespasians]6065-those low and beggarly vespasians . As [the Gods]3756-the gods love [me]2217-the old lady , [I]2217-the old lady believe [[Polla]293-vespasia polla ’s father]6067-polla ’s father was [an army contractor]6068-an army contractor . But [I]2217-the old lady have made it all right . [I]2217-the old lady have smudged out the line [I]2217-the old lady had added to the family tree , and as for the wax heads of [those Flavians]6061-those flavians , [I]2217-the old lady have had them melted up . Will [you]6070-you believe it — [I]2217-the old lady had the mask of [Domitian]224-domitian run into a pot and [that stupid Lucilla]6071-that stupid lucilla did not put a cover on it , and the rats have eaten it — eaten all the wax . [I]2217-the old lady hope it has clogged [their]6061-those flavians stomachs and given [them]6061-those flavians indigestion . [They]6061-those flavians doubtless thought it was dripping . But [I]2217-the old lady really have made a most surprising discovery . [I]2217-the old lady find there was an alliance with [the Cocceii]6072-the cocceii — [most respectable family]6073-most respectable family , [very ancient , admirable men all]6074-very ancient , admirable men all — and so there is a sort of cousinship with [the present admirable prince]6075-the present admirable prince . [[His]6075-the present admirable prince brother]4580-his brother [Aulus]437-aulus — rather old perhaps — but [an estimable man]6077-an estimable man — is — well — may be — in a word , [I]2217-the old lady intend to give a little supper — a dainty affair — all in the best style — so sorry [you]191-domitia ca n’t be there , [[my]2217-the old lady dear]4058-my dear [Domitia]191-domitia — but of course absolutely impossible . [Your]191-domitia state of health and all that sort of thing . Do n’t be surprised if [you]191-domitia hear — but there , there — [he]6075-the present admirable prince is rather old though , for [one who is only just turning off the very bloom of life and beauty]6079-one who is only just turning off the very bloom of life and beauty . ”[2217-the old lady] After such a visit and such talk the mind of [Domitia]191-domitia was troubled for several days . [She]191-domitia became timid , alarmed at the least noise , and distraught . But then [the poor crippled woman]3499-the poor crippled woman succeeded in comforting and laying [her]191-domitia troubles , and the painful expression faded from [her]191-domitia face . It became placid , but always with a sadness that was inseparable from the eyes , and a tremulousness of the lips , as though a very little — a rough word or two — would dissolve [her]191-domitia into tears . With the spring , the growing light , the increasing warmth , the bursting life in plant and insect , [she]191-domitia began to amend more steadily , and relapses became fewer . One sweet spring day , when Glyceria had been car ried forth into [the garden]690-the garden , and [Domitia]191-domitia sat on the turf near [her]191-domitia with purple anemones in [her]191-domitia lap , that [she]191-domitia was binding into a garland , [the paralyzed woman]1973-the paralyzed woman was startled by hearing [Domitia]191-domitia suddenly speak of the past . [She]191-domitia spoke , and continued weaving the flowers , “ [[My]191-domitia Glyceria]5793-my glyceria , [I]191-domitia intend this for [the little temple of [[my]191-domitia father]3834-my father]6081-the little temple of my father . It is all [I]191-domitia can do for [him]3834-my father — to give flowers where [his]3834-my father ashes lie — but it does not content [me]191-domitia . There were [two whom [I]191-domitia loved and looked up to as the best of [men]3873-men]6083-two whom i loved and looked up to as the best of men , and both are gone — gone to dust : [[my]191-domitia own dearest father]6085-my own dearest father , and [[my]191-domitia lover]6086-my lover , [[my]191-domitia husband]4051-my husband , [Lamia]219-lamia . [I]191-domitia can not bear to think of [them]6083-two whom i loved and looked up to as the best of men as heaps of ashes or as wandering ghosts . When that thought comes over [me]191-domitia , [I]191-domitia seem to be as [one drowning]6088-one drowning , and then darkness is before [my]191-domitia eyes . [I]191-domitia can not cry — [I]191-domitia smother . ”[191-domitia] “ Why should [you]3502-i think of [them]6083-two whom i loved and looked up to as the best of men as [wandering ghosts]6089-wandering ghosts or as heaps of dust ? ”[191-domitia] “ [I]3502-i know that [they]6083-two whom i loved and looked up to as the best of men are dust — [I]3502-i suppose they are shadows . But of anything else , all is guess - work , [we]6090-we know nothing — and that is so horrible . [I]3502-i love [two only]6091-two only — have loved two only — and they are no more than shadows . No , no ! [I]3502-i mean not that . ”[3502-i] [She]3502-i flung [her]3502-i arms about [Glyceria]309-glyceria , and laid [her]3502-i cheek against that of [the sick woman]1726-the sick woman . “ No , [I]3502-i do love [you]309-glyceria , and [I]3502-i love [Euphrosyne]268-euphrosyne and [I]3502-i love [Eboracus]193-eboracus . But [I]3502-i mean — [I]3502-i mean in a different manner . [One]3914-one was [[my]3502-i father]3834-my father , and [the other]596-the other [[my]3502-i husband]4051-my husband . It is so terribly sad to think [they]6096-they are lost to [me]3502-i like yesterday or last summer . ”[3502-i] “ [They]6096-they are not lost . [You]309-glyceria will see [them]6096-they again . ”[3502-i] “ See [[my]3502-i father]3834-my father ! See [my]3502-i Lamia ! ”[3502-i] “ Yes — [I]3502-i know it will be so . ”[3502-i] “ O , [Glyceria]309-glyceria , do not say such things . [You]309-glyceria make [my]3502-i heart jump . How can it be ? [They]6096-they have been . ”[3502-i] “ [They]6096-they are and will be . Death is swallowed up in Life . ”[3502-i] “ That is impossible . Death is death and nothing more . ”[3502-i] Then [Glyceria]309-glyceria took the hand of [Domitia]191-domitia , and looking into [her]191-domitia eyes , said solemnly : “ Dost [thou]191-domitia remember having asked [me]191-domitia about [the Fish]167-the fish ? ”[191-domitia] “ Yes — this amulet , ”[3504-the noble lady] answered [the noble lady]3504-the noble lady , and [she]3504-the noble lady detached the cornelian from [her]3504-the noble lady throat , and held it in the hand not engaged by [Glyceria]309-glyceria . “ Yes — [I]3504-the noble lady recollect — there was some mystery , but what was it ? ”[3504-the noble lady] “ [The Fish]167-the fish is a symbol , as [I]3504-the noble lady said once before , and it is no amulet . ”[3504-the noble lady] “ Of what is it the symbol ? ”[3504-the noble lady] “ Of [One who died — who tasted of the bitterness of the parting of soul and body]6098-one who died — who tasted of the bitterness of the parting of soul and body , and who went into [the region of Shadows]6099-the region of shadows and returned — the soul to the body , and rose from the dead , and by the virtue of [His]6098-one who died — who tasted of the bitterness of the parting of soul and body resurrection gives power to all who believe in [Him]6098-one who died — who tasted of the bitterness of the parting of soul and body to rise in like manner . ”[3504-the noble lady] “ And [he]6098-one who died — who tasted of the bitterness of the parting of soul and body could tell about what the ghosts do — how they wander ? ”[3504-the noble lady] “ [I]3504-the noble lady can not say that . There would be no comfort in that . [He]6098-one who died — who tasted of the bitterness of the parting of soul and body rose to give [us]6100-us joy and to rob death of its terrors . ”[3504-the noble lady] “ But what has this to do with [the Fish]167-the fish ? ”[3504-the noble lady] “ [You]3504-the noble lady know what the word Fish is in Greek . ”[3504-the noble lady] “ Very well . ”[3504-the noble lady] “ Take each letter of that word , and each letter is the first of words that contain the very substance of the Christian belief — [Jesus Christ]336-christ , [the Son of [God]180-titus]6101-the son of god , [the Saviour]6102-the saviour . ”[3504-the noble lady] [Domitia]191-domitia looked at the little cornelian fish ; [she]191-domitia could not understand . “ [I]191-domitia believe that [one]3914-one could die and wake again . [I]191-domitia have fainted and come round . And [he]6098-one who died — who tasted of the bitterness of the parting of soul and body might say what was in the spirit world into which [he]6098-one who died — who tasted of the bitterness of the parting of soul and body had been — but [the region of ghosts]6104-the region of ghosts is very dreary , very sad . ”[191-domitia] “ Nay , [He]6098-one who died — who tasted of the bitterness of the parting of soul and body can do more . As [He]6098-one who died — who tasted of the bitterness of the parting of soul and body rose , [He]6098-one who died — who tasted of the bitterness of the parting of soul and body can raise [us]6100-us to new life , and [He]6098-one who died — who tasted of the bitterness of the parting of soul and body will do it , for [He]6098-one who died — who tasted of the bitterness of the parting of soul and body is [God]180-titus . [He]6098-one who died — who tasted of the bitterness of the parting of soul and body made [us]6100-us , and [He]6098-one who died — who tasted of the bitterness of the parting of soul and body will recall [us]6100-us from death . ”[3504-the noble lady] “ What — [[my]3504-the noble lady father]3834-my father ! [Lucius]219-lamia ! [I]3504-the noble lady shall see [them]6106-them again — not as shadows , but as they were — ? ”[3504-the noble lady] “ Not so — not as [they]6106-them were , mortal ; but raised to an immortal life . ”[191-domitia] “ [I]3504-the noble lady shall kiss [[my]3504-the noble lady darling father]6107-my darling father — put [my]3504-the noble lady arms around [[my]3504-the noble lady Lucius from whom [I]3504-the noble lady have been parted so long , and so cruelly , and who has been so — so true to [me]3504-the noble lady]219-lamia . ”[3504-the noble lady] Then [Domitia]191-domitia burst into tears . [Glyceria]309-glyceria stroked [her]191-domitia hand . “ There — [you]191-domitia see how joyous is [our]6100-us hope . Death is nothing — it is only a good - bye for a bit to meet again . ”[309-glyceria] “ O , [Glyceria]309-glyceria ! O , if [I]191-domitia could see them — [O Glyceria]309-glyceria ! O , [you]191-domitia should not have said this if it be not true . [My]191-domitia heart will break . O , if it might be so ! if [I]191-domitia could ! but once only — for a moment — — ”[191-domitia] “ Nay , that would not suffice ; forever , never to be separated ; no more tears , no more death . ”[309-glyceria] “ O , [Glyceria]309-glyceria — not another word — [I]191-domitia can not bear it . [My]191-domitia heart is over full . Another time . [My]191-domitia head , [my]191-domitia head ! O , if it might — it could be ! ”[191-domitia] Next day [Glyceria]309-glyceria saw by the red eyes of [Domitia]191-domitia that [she]191-domitia had slept little and had wept much . [She]309-glyceria did not turn the conversation to the same topic ; [she]309-glyceria wisely waited for [the noble lady]3504-the noble lady to begin on it [herself]309-glyceria , and [she]309-glyceria judged that [she]309-glyceria would take some time to consider what had been spoken about and to digest it . And in fact [Domitia]191-domitia made no further allusion to the matter for some days . But after about a week , when alone with [the paralyzed woman]1973-the paralyzed woman , [she]309-glyceria said to [her]1973-the paralyzed woman abruptly : “ [You]1973-the paralyzed woman have never been in [Syria]33-syria ? ”[309-glyceria] “ No , [dear lady]4510-dear lady . ”[309-glyceria] “ [I]3507-i have — and [I]3507-i have been on [the confines of [the desert]6110-the desert]6109-the confines of the desert and looked away , as far as the eye could reach , and have seen nothing but sand and [barren rock]6111-barren rock . Behind [me]3507-i [a rose - garden]6112-a rose - garden , syringas , myrtle and citron trees , and murmuring streams , before [me]3507-i — no green leaf , only death . It is to [me]3507-i , as [I]3507-i stand now and look back on [my]3507-i life as if it were [that barren desert]6113-that barren desert ; and the fearful thing is — [I]3507-i dare not turn and look the other way , for it is into impenetrable night . But no , [my]3507-i life is not all desolation , there are just two green spots in it where the date palms stand and there are wells — [my]3507-i childhood , when [I]3507-i sat on [[my]3507-i father]3834-my father ’s knee and cuddled into [his]3834-my father arms ; and once again , when [I]3507-i was recovering from the loss of [him]3834-my father and was basking in the joy of [my]3507-i love for [Lucius Lamia]219-lamia . All the rest — ”[3507-i] [she]3507-i made a gesture of despair—“Death . ”[309-glyceria] “ [Dearest lady]6115-dearest lady ! [I]309-glyceria would like to turn [you]6115-dearest lady about and show [you]6115-dearest lady that where [you]6115-dearest lady think only blackness reigns , lies [a beautiful garden]6116-a beautiful garden , [a paradise]6117-a paradise , and One at the gate who beckons and says , Come unto [Me]309-glyceria , all [you]6115-dearest lady that labor and are heavy laden , and [I]309-glyceria will give [you]6115-dearest lady rest . ”[309-glyceria] “ Ah ! but that may be all fancy and dream work like the promises of [the Magi]438-the magi , and the mysteries of [Isis]273-isis . ”[3507-i] [Glyceria]309-glyceria got no further than this . [Domitia]191-domitia was disposed to talk with [her]309-glyceria on [her]309-glyceria hope , and on the Christian belief , but always with reserve and some mistrust . There were old prejudices to be overcome , there was the consciousness that the promises so largely made by [the votaries of [the many cults from East and South who came to [Rome]13-rome]3509-the many cults from east and south who came to rome]3508-the votaries of the many cults from east and south who came to rome were unfulfilled , and this made [her]309-glyceria unable to place confidence in the new religion held by [slaves]589-slaves and [ignorant people]3511-ignorant people , however alluring it might seem . Among [the very few who came to [Gabii]36-gabii during [her]309-glyceria illness and convalescence]3512-the very few who came to gabii during her illness and convalescence , was [Flavia Domitilla]333-domitilla , [the widow of [Flavius Clemens]294-clemens , who had been put to death by [Domitian]224-domitian]3513-the widow of flavius clemens , who had been put to death by domitian . [Domitilla]333-domitilla had been banished , but returned immediately on the death of [the tyrant]616-the tyrant . [She]333-domitilla had suffered as had [Domitia]191-domitia . In [her]333-domitilla manner and address there was something so gentle and assuring , that [the poor ex - empress , in the troubled condition of [her]333-domitilla brain]3515-the poor ex - empress , in the troubled condition of her brain , was drawn to [her]333-domitilla , and after [her]333-domitilla visits felt better . [She]309-glyceria knew , or rather supposed , that [Domitilla]333-domitilla was [a Christian]2504-a christian . [[Her]333-domitilla husband]579-her husband had been [one]3914-one , and had suffered for [his]579-her husband faith . It was with real pleasure that [she]309-glyceria ran to welcome [her]333-domitilla one morning , when [the steward]491-the steward entered and announced : “ [The Lady Flavia Domitilla]333-domitilla . ”[491-the steward] “ [I]3520-the widow of flavius clemens have come , [dear Domitia]191-domitia , with a petition , ”[3520-the widow of flavius clemens] said [the widow of [Flavius Clemens]294-clemens]3520-the widow of flavius clemens . “ And it is one [you]491-the steward will wound [me]3520-the widow of flavius clemens if [you]491-the steward refuse . ”[3520-the widow of flavius clemens] “ But who would wound so gentle a breast ? ”[191-domitia] answered [Domitia]191-domitia , kissing [[her]191-domitia visitor]3521-her visitor . “ [He]3521-her visitor must be [heartless who draws a bow against a dove]6118-heartless who draws a bow against a dove . ”[191-domitia] “ Hearken first to what [I]3520-the widow of flavius clemens ask . [I]3520-the widow of flavius clemens am bold — but [my]3520-the widow of flavius clemens very feebleness inspires [me]3520-the widow of flavius clemens with audacity . ”[3520-the widow of flavius clemens] “ What is it , then ? ”[3520-the widow of flavius clemens] “ That [you]491-the steward come with [me]191-domitia to [[my]191-domitia villa]4261-my villa for a little change of scene , air and society . It will do [you]491-the steward good . ”[191-domitia] “ And [I]3520-the widow of flavius clemens can not refuse . It is like [your]491-the steward sweet spirit to desire nothing save what is kindly intended and does good to [others]3837-others . ”[3520-the widow of flavius clemens] “ As [you]491-the steward have assented so graciously , [I]3520-the widow of flavius clemens will push [my]3520-the widow of flavius clemens advance a little further and say — Return with [me]3520-the widow of flavius clemens to - day . Let [us]6121-we travel together .
